loans.name: Noli Christopher

texts.en:
Noli Christopher V. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old, married, and has two infants. To make a living, Noli Christopher owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Noli Christopher has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Noli Christopher joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli Christopher has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Noli Christopher is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Noli Christopher from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the South region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Aisha has a business of outside catering, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and baking flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to own a boutique.  Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her enough time to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and baking flour

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Hace algunos años AdeL. inaguro su bodega “XIOMARITA” el nombre es de una de sus  hijas su negocio esta ubicado en su misma casa, desde muy niña conoció el trabajo por que su mama también tenia una bodega y durante toda su vida vio como su mama trabajaba fue de elL. que aprendió  todo sobre este negocio, después de muchos años ya casada vio que era L. mejor forma de ganarse L. vida sin descuidar a su familia recuerda que solo tenia 50 soles lo único que pudo comprar fue algunas gaseosas, un molde de keke y así en L. puerta de su casa con solo una mesita empezó lo que ahora se convirtió en su fuente de trabajo, ahora tiene una bodega muy grande con muchos clientes a los que abastece de toda clase de productos es una de las bodegas mas completas y  tiene productos de bazar, abarrotes y licores. ElL. ofrece a sus clientes el pago a crédito de esa manera mantiene feliz a su clienteL. lo que hará próximamente es ampliar su casa y convertir toda L. primera planta  en un minimarket, su préstamo actual lo usara para comprar licores ya que tiene mucha demanda de esos productos por estas épocas de celebraciones. AdeL. acaba de ser elegida L. nueva presidenta del grupo “LAS EXITOSAS”

*L. Sra.AdeL. es L. sexta de L. foto
texts.en:
A few years ago AdeL. set up her grocery store “Xiomarita” which is named after one of her daughters.  Her business is located in her own home.  She has known the work since she was a little girl because her mom also had a grocery store and during her whole life she saw how her mom worked.  It was from her mom that she learned everything about this business.

After a lot of years, when she was already married, AdeL. saw that it was the best way of earning a living without neglecting her family.  She remembers that she only had 50 soles and the only things she could buy were some cans of soda and a cake tin.  With only a little table, she set herself up in the doorway of her home and began what has since become her source of work.  Now she has a very large grocery store with many customers who she supplies with all sorts of products.  Hers is one of the most complete grocery stores around and she sells market-place items, groceries and licquor.  She offers her customers goods on credit which enables her to keep her customers happy.  Soon she is planning to extend her house and turn the whole first floor into a minimarket.  He current loan will be used to buy liquor since these products are in high demand as it is a season for celebrations.  AdeL. has just been elected as the new president of the “Las Exitosas” (Successful Women) group.

* AdeL. is the sixth person along in the photo

loans.use: To buy liquor for her grocery store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Canituan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Norma is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his horticultural farming business.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy M., 28, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. M. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 10 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire a second-hand overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Benedicter

texts.en:
Benedicter M. is married and has three children, who range in age from 28 to 26. 

She has been working as a farmer for 45 years, producing goods such as bananas, eggs and milk for sale. The main challenges she faces in running her business are diseases and the lack of a large market.

She has requested this loan of 60,000 KES in order to purchase poultry. With the potential increase in income from her loan, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

In five years, she hopes to have expanded her business through the purchase of more chickens.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Eng C. is a single woman who was divorced from her husband many years ago. She currently lives with two children, one of whom is single and the other one married. To earn a living, Eng C. cultivates a rice crop and has been farming since 2008, while her sons work in different jobs for a profit. Eng C. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes so she can also raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean L. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province.  She is 33 years old.  Jean is widowed and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Jean owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and breads in the local community.  Jean has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Jean is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and biscuits.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and biscuits.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 27, unmarried, and does not have any children. For the past six years, he has run a shop where he sells common supplies such as salt, sugar, and other various items. So far, this business has allowed himl to purchase a piece of land. With the profits he hopes to realize from this loan, he wants to increase his capital and eventually buy his own house.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of salt, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Virginia Maria

texts.es:
Victoria de 27 años vive en Cundinamarca (Bogotá), con su cónyuge y su hija de un mes de nacida ella trabaja junto con su esposo en la comercialización  y reparación de celulares, venta de accesorios, arreglos de joyería y relojería, negocio que inició hace 4 años, en el barrio San Fernando donde aun lo tiene ubicado y es un sector  comercial donde operan almacenes de repuestos para vehículos y lujos, mercado que Victoria aprovecha muy bien  para  desde este punto vender minutos a celulares y recargas de todos los operadores que funcionan en el mercado.  El negocio de esta pareja   posee activos   representados un portátil, equipos para el arreglo de joyas, vitrinas y celulares para la venta principalmente; su capital de trabajo     está  representado  en inventario de mercancía para la venta: celulares, carcasas, manos libres, entre otros; realiza sus ventas de  de contado por lo cual no tiene cuentas por  cobrar y su rotación de inventarios es de 22 días.  
Virginia planea mas adelante emprender un nuevo punto de servicios, pero primero intenta lograr posicionarse  con productos totalmente diferenciadores e innovadores que despierten la atención y el interés de compra,  por parte de sus clientes actuales y potenciales. 
En la actualidad está solicitando su primer credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo  Domingo, con el cual comprará equipos celulares y accesorios,  repuestos de celulares para mejorar el surtido actual y modernizar la venta. Mientras su sueño es continuar con su cónyuge construyendo un futuro familiar prosperó y exitoso para que cuando su hijo crezca,  encuentre las mejores condiciones de bienestar que le sean posibles.
texts.en:
27 year-old Victoria lives in Cundinamarca (Bogotá) with her husband and one-month-old daughter.  She works together with her husband selling and repairing cell phones.  They also sell accessories and repair jewelry and watches.  They set up the business 4 years ago in San Fernando neighborhood where it is still located.  This is a commercial area where there are stores selling vehicle spare parts and accessories.  Victoria takes good advantage of this market in order to sell cell phone minutes and cell phone top ups for all the operators on the market.

This couple's business has assets which include a laptop, equipment for repairing jewelry, display cases and the cell phones which they sell.  Their working capital is invested in the stock that they have for sale: cell phones, cases, hands-free phones, and other products.  They sell for cash so they don't have accounts receivable, and their stock turnover period is 22 days.  In the future, Virginia plans to set up another location but first she will try to position herself with completely distinctive and innovative products which will attract her existing (and potential) customers' attention and make them want to buy.

Victoria is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy cell phones and accessories, and spare parts for cell phones, in order to improve her current stock and modernize her business.  Victoria's dream is to continue building a prosperous and successful family future, together with her husband, so that when her daughter grows up she will enjoy the best well-being possible.

loans.use: to buy modern accessories and spare parts for cell phones, in order to modernize her current stock

loans.name: Va's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen members make up this village bank loan. Va is the village bank president, selected by the other members. 

He was born in 1952 and is married to Khoem, who was born in 1959. They have three children. One is a laborer, and the other two are students who also help their parents on the farm. 

Va and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow bananas and potatoes. At this time they do not have enough money to support it.  Va would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas, and the rest of the loan he would use for growing potatoes.  Aside from working their own farm, they are also farming laborers where they can earn a small income to help support their family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas, and for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en la feria de inquilpata desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere amp0liar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the "San Martin de Zurite" community bank which is located in Zurite district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Paulina is 52 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and hens.  She makes her sales in Inquilpata street market from 8.00am to 4.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Paulina would like to expand her animal sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals.

Paulina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Kiduusu Women's Group

texts.en: 29 year old Sarah N. has been operating a pub for close to 5 years now in Kiduusu-Lugazi. She is affiliated with Kiduusu Women's group and she says she set forth in this business with savings from her food sales business. Sarah is happily married with 5 kids and says that running this business has been worthwhile in many ways, especially in that it has enabled her to fully support and provide for her family. She says her monthly business profits are about 38,000 shillings. With this Kiva loan, Sarah says she is going to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell at her pub.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell at her pub.

loans.name: Thubelihle Group

texts.en:
Nicholine is 62 years old and widowed. She has 7 children between the ages of 19 and 42 years. She cares for four relative. She runs a retail business in Empangeni in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her right hand.

Nicholine has been in her business for 20 years. She sells red meat and church uniforms. She sells from her home and at flea markets. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time. She also faces a challenge of not having enough money to buy inventory.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses and Kiva. She will us the loan to buy fabrics for church unifroms and red meat to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business in the long run. She would like to buy a car for her business. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow.

In her comments she adds that WDB has helped her a lot and they must continue helping other.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for church uniform and red meat

loans.name: Miwononvi - Vedoko Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWONONVI - VEDOKO est composé de trois personnes qui vendent dans le même marché au Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Louise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise est née le 28 Avril 1975 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Djamal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Louise mène comme activité depuis deux ans la vente de riz et de savons par le système de distribution. Louise s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Louise sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI - VEDOKO, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MIWONONVI - VEDOKO group consists of three people who conduct their sales activities at the same market in Benin. This is the group’s third time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Louise, the group’s representative, is seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born in Benin on April 28, 1975. Louise is married to a man named Djamal. The couple have four children, two of them still in their care. All their children have received formal schooling. 

Louise lives with her husband and their children. The couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Louise has been selling rice and soap through the distribution system for the past two years. She gets her stock at one of Benin’s markets. 

In order to meet the needs of her customers and increase her profits and revenue, Louise is seeking this third loan together with the other members of the MIWONONVI - VEDOKO group. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, and soaps

loans.name: Xom Ngoai-2-9 Group

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1974. She lives in Xom Ngoai village and she has a shop where she sells shoes. Her husband helps her in her shop. They have had this business for ten years and have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Hoa has participated in SEDA since 2010. The last cycL., she borrowed 5.014.000 VND. In this loan cycL., she would like T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. expand her shoe shop. She is the leader of a five-member group loan in SEDA. About the other entrepreneurs in her group:

Dung is 32 years old. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. breed pigs.

Tu is 37 years old. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. expand her shop.

Tuan is 35 years old. He wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. raise livestock.

Quang is 43 years old. He wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. repair his house.

loans.use: to expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Hardworking Hands Group

texts.en: Juana, Yolanda, and Glenda, all of whom reside in Danli, Honduras, formed the “Hardworking Hands” solidarity group in June, 2011. Juana earns a living by making and selling bedclothes, and she has run this business for the last 21 years. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase materials needed for making sheets, pillowcases, and bedcovers. Yolanda sells clothing and footwear and is soliciting a loan to purchase merchandise. Lastly, Glenda makes a living by selling fresh produce from out of her home and is requesting a loan to purchase bulk amounts of produce.

loans.use: this loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, pins, and sewing needles

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been selling timber in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 36 years old, married to Jedida and they have school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new power saw.

In future, Samson hopes to grow his business and become a leading supplier of timber in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a new power saw.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Arístides, tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo, él administra una tienda desde hace 10 años, vende a los vecinos de la zona todo lo relacionado artículos de cocina y primera necesidad, cerca está el centro escolar, los estudiantes también le consumen mucha mercadería, él a parte del negocio también es agricultor y normalmente siembra maíz.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono para la milpa, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el desarrollo del cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha, la cual invierte una parte para comercio y para consumo familiar.
Con esta cosecha espera tener para su familia alimentación para unos meses, además de generar ingresos por la venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Arístides, 57, lives with his wife and they have a child. He has had a store for 10 years where he sells basic goods and cooking articles to his neighbors in the area. The school is close by and the students also purchase a lot of merchandise. Aside from the store he is also a farmer and usually plants corn.

He asks for a loan to invest in compost for the corn fields. This loan will help him to improve the development of his crop and get a good harvest. He will invest part of the profit from his harvest in his business, and also in his family.

He hopes this harvest will provide food for his family for a few months, as well as generate income from the sales.

loans.use: to buy compost for his corn crop.

loans.name: Issa's Group

texts.en: Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 9,900,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial needs. This school was founded in 1991 to provide education to the children of Makeni and beyond. The school is staffed with 24 employees and has an enrollment of 318 pupils. Issa is the leader of this group of teachers. With seven years of experience in the teaching profession, Issa is 35 years old, is married and has 6 children – 4 in primary school, 1 in secondary school and 1 is too young for school. Issa has joined his colleagues to access a loan of 2,000,000 SLL in order pay his children’s school fees and to help his wife start a small business.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees and to help his wife start a small business.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a married woman with three children. She and her family live in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.

Maria Fe is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Maria Fe's family depends on their farm. Maria Fe and her husband work hard to earn better and provide for the needs in their household.

Maria Fe is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su hija en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, ubicada en el distrito de Reque que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años Estela se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), verduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa de sus padres para su  seguridad y comodidad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones diarias.  Estela es una madre responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por tener un negocio más grande y más comodidades en bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Estela is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her daughter in her parents' home which has piped water and electricity.  The house is located in Reque district, in Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

For some years, Estela has been selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs and candy), vegetables and drinks.  She set up her store in her parents' home for her own safety and convenience as she is able to serve her customers at whatever hour she pleases.  She uses the profits that she makes from selling her products to try and cover all her family's needs and expenses.

In order to be able to stock her business, she has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy a larger quantity of merchandise.  Her sole aim is for her business to grow and to have more products available to offer her customers.  This will enable her to repay her loan and cover her daily needs.  Estela is a responsible and devoted mother who would like to have a bigger business and more conveniences for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en:
Marie Fe is a single-mother of one child.  Maria Fe is 22 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.

She sells snacks and viands to earn a living and has had this type of business for two years.  She has a requested loan of PHP 7000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Marie Fe has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, Marie Fe hopes to improve her living condition and be able to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge for Nancy. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour, sugar and tea leaves for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour, sugar and tea leaves for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 32-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 2 and 16. Six of them go to school. 

Rose runs a food store business and has been in the business for five years. She has no employees. Rose heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more food items like onions, groundnut paste, tomatoes, and many others. Other than this business, Rose has no other source of income.

In five years' time, Rose would like to hope for the increase of her business size.  

Her major challenges include low income and home expenses.   

Rose says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan, which has enabled clients to pay for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like onions, groundnut paste, and tomatoes

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio tiene 27 años y vive junto a su familia en la aldea de Carrizal en el municipio de Taulabe. Su esposa Alma es ama de casa y cuida a dos niños de 7 y 4 años de edad, y un bebe de 4 meses. 

Antonio se dedica a la extracción de piedra para la elaboración de cal. Cal es normalmente utilizada en abonos, en la construcción de viviendas, y también para tratar silos de maíz. Antonio empezó el negocio hace 10 años cuando su padre le dejó el terreno donde ahora extrae la piedra.  Le motivó poner este negocio para generar más ingresos para apoyar a su familia. 

Antonio solicitó su primer crédito con un monto de L6,000 para invertir en transporte y mano de obra para ayudarle en la extracción de piedra. En el futuro, Antonio desea comprar su propio camión para transportar su producto.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 27, lives with his family in the village of Carrizal in the Taulabe municipality.  His wife, Alma, is a housewife.  She takes care of two children; ages seven and four, and a four month old baby.

Antonio’s work is extracting rocks in order to make lime powder.  Lime powder is normally used in fertilizers, in building houses, and to treat corn silos.  Antonio started this business ten years ago when his father left him the land where he now extracts the rocks.

He was motivated to establish this business in order to generate more income to support his family.

Antonio requested his first loan for the amount of 6,000 lempiras for transportation and for the labor to help him extract the rocks.

In the future Antonio wishes to buy his own truck to transport his product.

loans.use: to pay for transportation and labor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y  dinámica. Vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 32 y 8 años de edad, y sus tres nietos, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza María es la venta de productos Unión, consisten en pan, rollos de canela, galletas, kekes. Para lo cual tuvo que inscribirse en esta empresa, de esa manera cada 15 días le envían sus pedidos, para que ella los venda, contando entres sus clientes a sus vecinos, familiares, amistades, muchas veces dejando a crédito hasta 15 días. Tiene 8 meses dedicándose sola a esta actividad, tiempo que le valió para ganarse una regular clientela. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es ser una persona independiente económicamente, y con deseos de ser empresaria. Además de los ingresos económicos que le genera, con los cuales  ha podido comprarse algunas artefactos como televisor, ya que le da ganancias de hasta el 100 % de lo que invierte, esto la anima a seguir adelante. Su plan es montar una bodega de venta de abarrotes. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente alegre y agradecida por el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Desea  seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso comenta será puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además dice estar cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal, ya que sus miembros son personas amables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos Unión, y con las ganancias implementará un negocio en casa, como una bodega de abarrotes.
texts.en:
50-year-old Maria is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She lives with her two children and three grandchildren in a house she owns. Her children are 32 and 8 years old.
Maria sells Unión products. They consist of bread, cinnamon rolls, cookies and cakes. For this purpose she had to sign up with the company in order for them to send merchandise for her to sell, which happens every 15 days. Among her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends, and many times she provides them with credit for up to 15 days. She has been in this business for 8 months and she used this time to get a regular clientele.
What she likes about her business is to be a person who is financially independent and wishes to be an entrepreneur. Besides, with the profits she makes she has been able to purchase some appliances such as a TV. She makes a profit of up to 100% the amount she invested and this encourages her to move forward. Her plan is to set up a grocery store.
This will be her second loan with MFP. She is happy and thankful for the financial support in order to move forward with her business. She wishes to keep counting on this support and for that reason she says she will be punctual with her repayments. Furthermore, she reports that she is comfortable with her communal bank because its members are kind and supportive people. With the requested loan of 1.500 nuevos soles she will purchase more Unión products, and with her profits she will start a business from her home, such as a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase Unión products (bread, cinnamon rolls, cookies and cakes).

loans.name: Tusigaigoa

texts.en:
Tusigaigoa is a married mother. She is 40 years old and has two children.

Tusigaigoa owns and operates a business venture, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business. Tusigaigoa needs a loan of Samoan Talas (WST) 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tusigaigoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tusigaigoa's first loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Argenedith

texts.es: Argenedith con su anterior credikiva compró un inmenso toldo para protegerse y una máquina de freír.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar nuevos productos, parte de menaje para su cocina y sillas plásticas para hacer más confortable su negocio para si misma y especialmente para sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por su apoyo, espero seguir contando con estos créditos para ayudar a mantener el negocio y así seguir apoyando  a mi esposo en el mejoramiento del bienestar de mi hogar”.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Argenedith bought a large awning to protect herself and a deep fryer. She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan in order to buy supplies for making new products. Part of the money will be used to buy cooking utensils and plastic chairs so that her business will be more comfortable for her and especially her customers.

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “Thank you for your support. I hope to continue receiving these loans so that I can maintain my business and continue supporting my husband with improving the well-being in our home.”

loans.use: to buy ingredients, cooking utensils, and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La señora Maricruz de 43 años es casada, vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 6 años con su hijo y su nuera ya que su esposo se tuvo que ir a Estados unidos a trabajar para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia desde hace 10  años. Maricruz trabaja como operadora de costura en una maquiladora de la localidad trabaja 10 horas diarias de Lunes a Viernes para solventar los gastos familiares del hogar, ella poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su casa hace cuatro años más o menos coloco protecciones en las ventanas  de su casa y puertas de telas, las ultimas mejoras que le realizo fue levantar la barda del frente de su casa misma con la que compartió  el gasto con la vecina para que les saliera mas económica y pinto su casa por dentro y por fuera. La señora Maricruz sabe que la única manera de ir terminando su casa es poco a poco sabe que seria imposible terminarla en un abrir y cerrar de ojos por ello es que solicita el apoy para levantar barda lateral en la parte de enfrente de su casa.
texts.en:
Maricruz is 43 years old, married, and has lived in low-income housing for six years with her son and daughter-in-law since her husband had to go to the United States ten years ago to work to improve their family's quality of life.  Maricruz works as a sewing machine operator at a local factory.  She works ten hours a day from Monday to Friday in order to meet the financial needs of her household. 

She has slowly been making improvements to her house.  About four years ago she installed bars on the windows and doors.  Her latest improvement was to build a wall in front of her house. She shared the cost with her neighbor because it would be more economical.  She also painted her house outside and inside.  

Maricruz knows that the only way to finish her house is piece by piece.  She knows it would be impossible to finish it in the blink of an eye, so she is asking for help to continue the wall in front of her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to finish a wall.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is student Tuan’s mother. Tuan is attending school for vocational training. His program lasts three years. After graduation, he will become a skilled mechanician. He hopes to find a suitable job with stable income in a factory near his house. Currently, he wants to use this loan of 10,206,000 Viet nam dong to pay for tuition fees and transportation.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and transportation.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni, tiene 64 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas en las ferias, es madre de 5 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace un año, pero ya puede ver la diferencia que hay con otras entidades, ve que su palta esta segura, le gusta mucho ahorrar, siempre esta de viaje pero trata de estar en la capacitaciones, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para las ferias.
texts.en: Honorata is a member of the Ayni communal bank.  She is 64 years old and the mother of five children, and works selling clothing in the markets.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for a year, but she can already see the difference there is with other institutions.  She sees that her money is safe.  She very much likes to save.  She is always traveling but she tries to be in the training sessions.  She will invest the loan she is now requesting in buying clothes for the markets.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
Jose is a fruit and vegetable distributor who sells to the small stores and markets in Guayaquil. He borrows his cousin’s truck for $10 a day in order to be able to pick up the fruit he buys from wholesalers. His father and his uncle taught him how and where to buy the fruit at the best prices. When he was young he would often go along with his uncle when he bought these products and also when he sold them from his tricycle cart. When he was 15 he felt the need to contribute to his family’s income and took up the same line of his work as is father and uncle.

He travels to the wholesale markets every morning at 5 AM in order to buy the fruits that are in season. Right now he is buying mostly mangoes, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes and avocadoes. He borrows from the loan sharks in order to buy the fruit he distributes. He is seeking this loan in order to avoid borrowing from them at extremely high interest rates. His long term goal is to buy a home for his wife and two kids. Right now they all live at Jose’s mother in law’s home and he is saving up for a home of his own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Muka

texts.en: Muka started selling in 1988. He is married with two children. He sells purified water and women’s items, and provides bread to women for resale. His beginning business capital was $35. He began with a stock of 20 pairs of slippers. Muka got to know Hope’s programs through his church. In 2004, he decided to become a Hope member and began developing his plan of providing people in his community with purified water.  Muka has noticed that the demand for purified water in his neighbourhood has increased.  He also remarks that his purified water sales are contributing to the fight against diseases that are spread through contaminated water. With a loan of $725 Muka will meet the demand and people in his community will be healthier.

loans.use: He wants to buy a water purifying machine in order to expand his sales in purified water.

loans.name: Hidayet

texts.en: Hidayet Orucov Tenhali ogli is from a Meskheti Turk refugee family that fled from Uzbekistan during the Soviet regime. He is 54 years old and is married, with children. Hidayet runs a small animal-breeding business. He is looking for a loan of $700 to buy a calf and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Mercedes lives in her own home with her husband and her youngest daughter on Landaeta Street in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. She is 53 years old and for some time has been working with the creation of jackets, pants, banners, caps, etc. She currently works with Institutions (IMPRO) carrying out large contracts, because of which she now has three employees in her workshop whom she pays by the piece for completed work.

The loan she now seeks is to buy material; Mercedes is a small business owner who creates jobs and consequently becomes a subject of acceptable credit, moreover her cash flow responds to the financial necessities that permit her to pay off a line of credit while at the same time fulfilling her obligations to pay her employees as well as to cover her personal expenses.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Mercedes vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija menor en la calle Landaeta de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 53 años de edad y desde hace tiempo se dedica a la confección de chamarras, pantalones, bandera, gorras, etc. Actualmente trabaja con Instituciones realizando contratos mayores, por lo cual tiene en su taller tres empleados a los cuales les paga a destajo por prenda realizada. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material; Mercedes es una microempresaria que genera empleo y por consiguiente se convierte en un sujeto de crédito aceptable, además de que su flujo de caja responde a las necesidades financieras que le permiten cancelar el crédito y al mismo tiempo cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago a sus empleadas y utilidad suficiente para cubrir sus gastos personales.

loans.use: Working capital - Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a dairy farmer and is a salesman for Pil Andina (Milk Processing Plant). He also works as a construction worker. His wife helps him to sell potatoes, a product that they grow. This is how they earn money in order to support their 4 kids who depend on him.

They live in The Villandrani Community, one hour outside of La Paz.

He will use the credit to buy a medium sized cow to increase milk production.

This is his first credit with IMPRO, and the socio-economic evaluation that has been carried out shows his capability to repay the debt, and he is therefore authorized to ask for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco es productor de leche de vaca la misma que es comercializada a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también trabaja como albañil y su esposa le ayuda como comerciante de papa y chuño, productos que ellos mismos producen. Es así como logran obtener ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus 4 hijos que depende de él. Vive en la Comunidad de Villandrani (A una hora de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio-económica realizada muestra la capacidad de pago de la deuda y le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a milking machine/Compra de una vaca lechera

loans.name: Yambi

texts.fr:
Born in Atakpamé in 1959, Yambi A. is married and the mother of five. She lives in the N'Kafu district of Lomé. Because her parents no longer had the money, she dropped out of middle school, entered an apprenticeship, and as much, ran up against enormous difficulties. Little by little, she had developed her display of boutique items for sale on the roadside where she established herself. Next, she rented a shop for her business and is today requesting working capital of $1,000. This will serve to increase her stock of merchandise and to acquire an embroidering machine. She manages her business perfectly and has the ability to manage this loan well, which will certainly have a positive impact on profits and will improve her family's living conditions considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Atakpamé en 1959, madame Yambi A. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants et habite le quartier N’Kafu à Lomé. Madame Yambi A. a arrêté ses études secondaires car ses parents n’avaient plus les moyens de la soutenir. Elle entre en apprentissage et se heurta également à d’énormes difficultés. A petit coup, elle évolua et installa au bord de la route et sur étalage des articles de mercerie par la suite, elle loue une boutique pour ses activités et sollicite un fonds de roulement de $1000 qui servira à augmenter sa mercerie et à acquérir une machine à surfiler. C’est une femme qui maîtrise parfaitement la gestion de son commerce et a la capacité de bien gérer ce prêt qui aura à coup sûr un impact très positif sur la rentabilité de son activité et améliorera considérablement les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine and boutique items to sell

loans.name: Kerti

texts.id:
Made Kerti M. is a farmer whose living comes from land farming, however land condition could not support it, due to drought. That is why  Made Kerti is trying other avenues like cow farming, that he has calculated its feasibility from buying to selling. With this business, Made hopes he could provide  his family with a decent living, and provide schooling for his 4 small children. Calve's age are 3 months at a price of Rp 3,000,000-4,000,000/calf (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9000-9500.00). He will raise the calves for 6 months, then sell it to pay for daily living expenses.
Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.
Made Kerti M. adalah seorang petani yang mengandalkan kehidupan keluarganya dari bercocok tanam, namun kondisi tanah yang kurang mendukung karena kekeringan maka Made Kerti mencoba usaha lain  dengan cara memelihara sapi yang tentunya telah diperhitungkan mulai dari pembelian sampai dengan penjualan. Dengan usaha ini Made berharap bisa menopang kehidupan keluarganya dengan memberikan kehidupan yang layak dan dapat menyekolahkan keempat anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil. Usia bibit sapi yaitu 3 bulan dengan harga 3.000.000 – 4.000.000 rupiah/ekor yang kemudian akan dipelihara sampai  usia 6 bulan yang kemudian akan dijual untuk kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To buy calves, feed and raising expensesuntuk membeli bibit sapi, bahan makanan dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: Witness Chota

texts.en: Witness, age 35, is married and has a toddler. She works as a food vendor, which she began doing in 2006. Each day, she sells food from 6am to 10pm and she makes a monthly profit of around $410. She now requests a loan to buy more food stock in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria and Justo O. are the proud parents of three children, who are under the age of ten. For fifteen years the couple has worked together making shoes and school uniforms. Currently, they rent two salons. One is used by Maria’s husband to make shoes and from the other Maria sells shoes, uniforms, and other clothing. Eventually, they hope to increase business and have enough savings to buy a shop of their own. Until then, they are grateful that the profits they have made allowed them to build a home of their own.

Today, they are asking for a loan to buy school uniforms and more leather to make shoes.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and leather to make shoes

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es:
Day after day, Visitación struggles to overcome the economic crisis she endured for years. Due to the social consequences attached to it, she was unable to receive an education, but life’s lessons taught her to be prudent and skillful in the livestock business. She is a widow and lived alone for years. Now she lives with her elderly mother, her 25-year-old daughter and her granddaughter, to whom she gives all her love and affection. Together they unite to combine their efforts and carry out this labor, which tends to be very difficult.

Visitación tends to her cow and her sheep. Of the first, she sells its milk which is her livelihood, and the latter she offers for sale in the Chupaca fair during the weekends. Her wish is to use her savings as capital to purchase land so that she may also harvest potatoes and corn. This hard-working mother’s wish of acquiring a cow to benefit her family leads her to request your help through a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Visitación día a día lucha por superar la situación de crisis económica por la que atravesó por años, debido a la misma coyuntura social no accedió a estudiar pero las lecciones de la vida le enseñaron a ser prudente y hábil en el negocio del ganado, ella es viuda y por años vivió así, ahora vive con su anciana madre, su hija de 25 años y una nieta a la cual brinda todo su cariño a amor y juntas se unen para reunir esfuerzos y dedicarse a estas tareas que muchas veces suele ser dura, se dedica a cuidar a su vaca y a sus ovejas, de la primera vende diariamente la leche que le sirve de sustento y a las segundas las oferta en la feria de Chupaca los fines de semana. Su deseo es poder capitalizar algunos ahorro que tiene para comprar terrenos a fin de dedicarse también a la siembra de papa y maíz.El deseo de esta trabajadora madre de adquirir una vaca más para beneficio de su familia la conducen a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a cow.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 35 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 1-13. She and her husband also take care of another person, 40 years old. Nuru is a cloth seller; she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba M. is from Kyela and Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.  She is 21 years old and married, but has no children.   In 2006, Abiba established an agricultural business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers. Abiba now requires a  loan of $175 to buy more stock for her farm.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín is 41 years old and has been married to his 36-year old wife Juana for twenty years. They have three children aged 19, 9 and six. The two younger children go to school, but the oldest is no longer a student. For 20 years Valentín has worked buying, repairing, and selling used-vehicle batteries. He also sells new batteries. Working as a maid, his wife also contributes to household income.

Valentín says that he only completed grade 6 at school as he came from a poor family. He worked for several years in a vehicle repair shop where he learned all he could about repairing batteries. Then one day he decided to strike out on his own; he opened his own workshop in a rented space and now works from there every day.

He says that everything has turned out well as he owns the only business in the area that sells batteries for all kinds of vehicles. He is now seeking a loan to buy a larger number of batteries as they are much in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Valentín tiene 41 años, vive en pareja con Juana que tiene 36 años. Hace 20 años que viven juntos y tienen 3 hijos de 19, 9 y 6 años respectivamente. Los dos hijos menores aún van a la escuela mientras que el mayor ya no estudia más. Valentín se dedica hace 20 años a la compra, reparación y venta de baterías usadas de vehiculos, así como también la venta de baterías nuevas. Su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica, contribuyendo de esa manera con los ingresos del hogar.

Él comenta que solo pudo estudiar hasta el 6to. Año de la primaria debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde. Trabajó durante varios años en un taller de vehiculos, donde aprendió todo lo relacionado a la reparación de baterías. Fue así que un día decidió independizarse e instaló su propio taller en un local alquilado en donde realiza sus labores cotidianas.

Cuenta que le va muy bien debido a que es el único en la zona que se dedica a la venta de baterías para vehiculos de todo tipo. En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de baterías debido a que tiene mucha demanda de su producto.

loans.use: To purchase batteries.

loans.name: Kodzo Senyo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodjo Senyo E. was born on October 1, 1977 in Kuma Adame, a village located 135 km from the capital of Togo. He is married and has 2 children. His business consists in selling tires and inner tubes. He is a very astute businessman who chose to locate his business in a place much frequented by his target audience.

Since 2002 when he began the business, he has seen his clientele grow and he does everything he can to respond to their needs. Thus, to fill an order he has received, he is asking for this first loan which will allow him to buy 80 tires and 100 inner tubes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur E. Kodjo Senyo est né le 01 octobre 1977 à Kuma Adame un village situé à 135 km de la capitale du TOGO. Il est marié et a 02 enfants. Son activité consiste en la vente de pneus et de chambres à air. C’est un commerçant très astucieux qui pour s’implanter à choisi un lieu très fréquenté par sa clientèle cible.

Depuis 2002 qu’il a commencé cette activité, il a vue grandir sa clientèle et surtout il fait tout pour répondre a son besoin. Ainsi pour répondre à une commande qu’il a reçu, il sollicite ce premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 80 pneus et 100 chambres à air.

loans.use:
Purchase of tires and inner tubes

Achat de pneus et de chambres à air

loans.name: Mwatima

texts.en:
Mwatima is 43 years old. She is a married woman with two children, aged 20 and 19. She owns and runs a small general store, which she started in 1999. Every day, she works from 7:30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwatima now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeung P. is a villager in Chek Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who tries to work hard on a small piece of land growing rice and vegetables. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, Mrs. Hoeung P. wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Hoeung P. is a 48-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.en:
Muhamadjon N. is a 33-year-old married man with three children. Muhamadjon is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business ten years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business.

Therefore, Muhamadjon is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional cattle to sell; more specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing. He is offering to repay the loan in 12 months. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mr. Nhoem C. is a villager in Krodas Village in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Bo Koem, are farmers. They cannot cultivate rice because they do not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant. Thus, Mr. Nhoem C. is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. The couple has six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while other two attend the local school. The youngest is too young to work or study, being just five years old. Mrs Bo Keom is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah T. is a 36-year-old married man with one child. For the past 2 years, he has been a local producer of packaging materials. Josiah is a young man with a vision to serve humanity with his talent and skills, and he dreams of a well-established company of his own that would produce bulk packaging materials to serve all kinds of purposes. He produces and supplies his packaging materials to food vendors, market sellers, and super market operators so that they can wrap their customers' purchased items.

However, Josiah is constrained by inadequate capital, so he is unable to generate his packaging materials on a large scale to meet the demands of his customers. Thus, he is seeking a loan to buy a large quantity of rubber as well as a machine in order to increase his production and to thereby meet his customers' demands.

He belongs to the community group known as the Angel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. He notes that he does not sell any packaging materials on days when his group meets, and that his picture was taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To increase production and to meet his customers' demands by purchasing a large quantity of rubber and a machine

loans.name: Atakola Lending Group

texts.en: M. Annet, 31, is the leader of Atakola lending group in Jinja. She is married with 4 children and she cares for 1 niece. Annet has a retail shop that she has owned for 4 years while she has been a member of her group for 2 years. She is quick to say that life is different since she started getting loans because now she has a lot to sell and therefore more profits. She is grateful that now she is even able to save for her future plans as regards her children. Annet sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, detergents and many other things and she would like a loan to buy more goods for her shop.

loans.use: More sugar, salt, cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer J. is only 27. However, despite her age, she is already mature and started to worry about how is she going to stretch their family's budget. She has a son, who also has growing needs. At first, she was scared to raise him, but then her mother had been very generous in offering her a small store to manage. 

Now, she is into retailing. Jennifer sells a variety of goods and earns enough money for the family. She also wants to consider venturing into other lines of business. That is why she joined the CEVI credit program, to avail loans and be able to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Jennifer is happy about partaking in the benefits of joining the CEVI microfinancing program. Now, she enjoys availing its services, including the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that it offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sara Teodora

texts.es:
Hace dos años que Sara vende cerveza y chicha junto con su esposo. En un inicio vendía en su casa pero ahora el negocio de ha trasladado al local donde el esposo trabaja como herrero. Por ahora ella solo se dedica a vender los fines de semana pues se encuentra delicada de salud y próxima a una operación. 

Anteriormente, ofrecía el servicio de limpieza en una tienda de muebles; sin embargo, una vez que estuvo a cargo de su nieta tuvo que abandonar el trabajo, es por eso que se animó a abrir su negocio en casa. Las ganancias la ayudan a colaborar con los gasto de su nieta y también de su casa.
texts.en:
Sara has been selling beer and a beverage called “chicha” for the past two years with her husbands. In the beginning she use to sell it out of her house, now the business has moved to her husband's place of employment where he works as a blacksmith. For now she only sells on the weekends since she is experiencing health problems and she is getting ready to have an operation.

Before she use to offer cleaning services at a furniture store; however, once she was left in charge of her granddaughter and she had to leave her job. That’s why she finally deiced to start her own business at home. Her earnings allow her to contribute to providing for her granddaughter and also to the costs of her household.

Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.id: Setelah melalui periode pinjaman pertama ibu-ibu yang tergabung dalam kelompok Sari Mertha ini sangat merasakan ada peningkatan di dalam usaha mereka, dari keuntungan yang di dapat sebelumnya. Hal ini tidak lepas dari pembinaan dan kerja sama yang baik antar anggota kelompok dengan pola pemeliharaan yang teratur. Untuk periode pinjaman kedua ini kelompok Sari Mertha masih tetap beranggota 15 orang , pinjaman yang diperoleh Rp. 1.000.000,- per anggota dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dana tersebut dipergunakan sebagai tambahan modal usaha yaitu untuk membeli pakan yang berkualitas dan membeli bibit yang akan dipelihara selama sutu kali periode pemeliharaan (6 bulan). Untuk sekarang ini setiap anggota kelompok ada yang memelihara 2 sampai 4 ekor babi yang akan di panen 6 bulan kemudian dengan keuntungan bersih yang di dapat per anggota mencapai Rp. 500.000,-. Dari hasil yang di dapat ini kelompok Sari Mertha lebih bersemangat lagi untuk menjalankan usahanya agar bias meraih keuntungan yang lebih besar lagi.

loans.use: buy more piglets and it's feed

loans.name: Shakira's Group

texts.en:
Nabateregga Shakira is the leader of the Namungoona loan group in Kampala. She is a married lady with no children.  She has a business of selling television sets, electronics, phones, and electronic accessories from Bakuli, Mengo. Her profits help pay for school fees for her two brothers that she helps to care for.

This is the third time Shakira is seeking a loan from Pearl Microfinance. The first two loans helped her so much in enlarging her shop by allowing her to sell phones that she did not have before. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more phones and DVDs to sell.

loans.use: to buying more phones and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a 49 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Fatimah has been working as a seamstress for four years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

This is Fatimah’s second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Fatimah decided on starting her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Fatimah has requested a loan of 1000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion S. is a woman who hails from Hamtic, Antique. She is a 38 year old mother to an 18 year old son. She is married to Leoterio S., who is a farmer.

Before, Salvacion was engaged in poultry, hog raising and general store businesses. But since she has a rice field to cultivate, they decided to give priority to farming. Now, she proposes to use her next loan to buy one head of carabao to be used for plowing the farm.

She is positive that their business will succeed and will provide proceeds for bigger investments and for her family's needs. Education of her son is her greatest dream, and she hopes to send her son to college so that he will be able to find a job. She dreams of building a more secure and durable house.

loans.use: To buy one head of carabao to be used in farming.

loans.name: Erick José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Erick N. se dedica a atender su pequeño negocio de pulpería el cual ha establecido en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes con mucho entusiasmo ya que es una persona muy alegra, dinámica y con un gran espíritu de superación en el negocio.

Atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir a lo inmediato los productos para la pulpería tales como los comestibles, granos básicos y otros productos. Para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con dicho crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en el negocio que hoy mas que nunca requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Erick N.’s small business is his mini market, which is in his own home in the city of Masaya. He takes care of his customers with a lot enthusiasm. He is a happy, dynamic person with a great spirit for improving his business. He needs products for his mini market like food, basic grains, and others. He needs these products immediately. That is way he is asking Ceprodel for a loan. This way he can get ahead in his business. He needs their support now more than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his mini market

loans.name: Bushra Muhammad Ashfaq Group

texts.en:
Arshad baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business. 
Shahida baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.
Bushra baji is a widow and has been a citizen of Yadgar, Pakistan for the last 15 years.  She is the group leader of these above-mentioned ladies. Bushra baji is a very brave and hardworking lady. After the death of her husband, she became the breadwinner of her family. She started a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from Multan city because clothing rates are not as high in that city and she sells to her community. She gets a good number of orders every month. Nowadays she is out of stock and is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to complete the orders of her customers. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Uchunor

texts.en:
Uchunor O. sells drinks, both wholesale and retail. He is married with six children and is 52 years old.

He hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Kasambya 3 Kayima Lydia Group

texts.en: K. Lydia is thirty-two years old, married and blessed with two children of her own. She is also taking care of three dependents. All of the children are going to school. She has been in her business of selling drinks for six years. She is using the loan to purchase drinks such as water, sodas, etc., adding capital to her business. She is an active lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase drinks such as water, sodas, etc to capital to her business.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai Thị Nguyễn was born in 1973. She lives in Xom Huong, Co Loa, Dong Anh with her husband and 3 children. Her two older children are in school but the youngest children is still too young. She is a farmer. Also, she and her husband sell meat in the market. They have a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND.

Mai is a leader of an 8-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Mai needs a loan in the amount of 5.014.000 VND to expand her product offerings.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
* Chung Thị Nguyễn was born in 1952. She is a farmer who breeds pigs and poultry. She has 3 children. She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy food for pigs.
* Toán Thị Nguyễn was born in 1952 and she has one child. She sells paper goods and earns a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND to buy more paper.
*Thoa Thị K. Trương was born in 1957. She sells sundries. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to invest in her store.
*Lam Thị Nguyễn was born in 1975 and has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND for retailing purposes.
*Huệ Bích Nguyễn was born in 1976 has two children. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to invest in her music CD shop.
*Hay Thị Vũ was born in 1968. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or 280 USD) to expand her product offerings.
*Phương Thị Nguyễn was born in 1971 and she has three children. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy rice to make rice cakes.

loans.use: To expand their product offerings.

loans.name: Bulubandi 1 West Nakasolo Madina Group

texts.en: N. Madina is an active business lady. Her hope is to work hard, prosper and educate her children. She is using the loan for brickmaking,  that is purchasing firewood for burning bricks, paying workers, transporting the bricks to convenient places for sale, and so forth. She has been in her business for two years and she sincerely wishes to enlarge her business so that she can make more bricks for big markets and therefor earn more profit. N. Madina is married with five children; two go to school. She is also looking after one dependent, who is also going to school.

loans.use: For brick making,that is purchasing firewood for burning bricks, paying the workers, transporting the bricks to convenient places for sale, and so forth.

loans.name: Veronica Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Verónica del Rosario D. A. ella tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La señora Verónica se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella vende en su casa de habitación y distribuye  de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años, ella empezó a vender ropa nueva y usada a sus vecinos, sin embargo con el tiempo logro obtener mayor variedad de artículos. Su financiamiento será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías como es la compra de ropa de uniformes escolares y en la compra de cosméticos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda, en la cual pueda vender todos los artículos que ella ofrece con mayor comodidad y facilidad.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Bolaji

texts.en: Bolaji Motiatu is 36 years old, married to Bolaji and they have four children. Motiatu sells foodstuffs and she is doing well in her business. Motiatu hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
Junita O. runs a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. Junita is just starting this business. She is 45 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, Junita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Junita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Junita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 34 años, vive con su esposa (Gladis), de 32 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Víctor de 14, Steven de 7 y Jefri de 5 años de edad.
Desde hace 14 años él se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, su padre también se dedicaba a ello y él optó por seguirlo, ya que desde muy joven le gustaron los vehículos. Por ello, actualmente se siente contento de realizar su trabajo, saliendo desde muy temprano en las mañanas, pues cree que mientras más se esfuerce, logrará mejores ganancias. Este pensamiento le está arrojando buenos resultados, ya que los ingresos son favorables y puede brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo.

En el futuro él quiere comprar un carro de segunda mano con el cual pueda trabajar de manera más independiente, ya que el auto que usa actualmente es alquilado y debe dar parte de las ganancias de su trabajo a la persona que le arrienda el vehiculo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en todos los pagos, ya que se considera un apersona muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita dará la primera cuota para poder conseguir el auto propio que tanto desea. Además, también debe realizar algunas refacciones al carro que maneja actualmente.
texts.en:
Hugo is 34 years old. He lives with his wife, Gladis, 32 years old, and their three children: Victor, 14, Steven, 7, and Jefri, 5 years old.

For 14 years, he has offered transportation services to his passengers. His father also worked in this, and he chose to follow him. Hence, since a very young age, he has liked vehicles. Therefore, he is very content now to do his work, leaving very early in the mornings. He believes that the more one strives, the better his gains. This thought is giving him good results, as the earnings are favorable, and he can offer a good quality of life to his family, who are the motive for his efforts.

In the future, he wants to purchase a second-hand car so that he can work independently. The car he uses now is rented, and he must pay part of his work earnings to the person that rents him the vehicle.
