This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with all the payments. Already, he is considered a responsible person. With the money that he requests, he will put a down payment on his own car that he wants so much. Also, he will do some work on the car that he drives now.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of his working automobile

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo P. Sr., or “Boy” as he is known in his village, is 58 years old. He only finished elementary education. Due to hardships, he was unable to pursue his studies. Instead, he helped his father cultivate their farm lot by planting rice and some vegetables. When he was 18, his uncle, who is a mechanic, hired him to be a conductor and collector in his jeepney. At the same time, he taught him how to drive and how to repair the jeepney; after a year, he could perform both tasks with ease.

Following this, Domingo decided that he wanted to purchase his own jeepney so that he could apply what he had learned from his uncle. From that time onwards, he tried to save more of his income; after three years, he bought his own jeepney, which he used to earn income. 

Domingo is married to Teresita P.; they are gifted with five children. They want their children to finish their studies so that they will find stable jobs someday. Consequently, they are doing their best to earn money with which they can support the studies of their children. His wife is engaged in selling snacks in the school campus. 

As a result of their patience and sacrifices, they are able to earn an income of P 8,000 per month, which they use to meet their daily needs and finance the schooling of their children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, however, they need to earn more income to meet their needs. Domingo thus wants to borrow P 5,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his jeepney. He believes that with this financial assistance he will be able to use his jeepney regularly to earn income for the needs of his family.

loans.use: maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en:
Foisaga F. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Gagaifo Lefaga. She is married and has one infant child.

Foisaga owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for years and earns approximately 1,500 WST a month from these activities.

Foisaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Foisaga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.

Foisaga is now requesting a new loan of 2,400 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 37 years old, married, and has three school-age children: two daughters and a son. He runs a welding business and has been in business since 1997. He also earns some income from small-scale farming. He says that his business is competitive and busy. He successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for 20,000 Kenyan shillings and requested this loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase gauges, pipes, and rods for welding.

He describes himself as obedient, hardworking, and patient with customers and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has opened a savings account. In the future, he hopes to open a big garage and employ staff.

loans.use: Purchase gauges, pipes & welding rods

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica B. sells maize, and other provisions at Ensukye near Abura.  Monica has no educational background.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a teacher. Monica has been selling maize and other provisions since 1990. She supports her family by paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn Q. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Ginalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ginalyn owns and operates a fishing business, catching and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business.

In 2008, Ginalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ginalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Ginalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Maura Katalina

texts.es: La señora Maura Katalina C. O., de 57 años de edad vive en el barrio San Ignacio es casada y el señor se dedica a los trabajo de agricultura, ellos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 de ellos son adultos y casados que viven de manera independiente, el menor es el que habita con la familia apoyándole en las tareas del hogar y la finca, ellos tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la producción  de pitahaya, piña y plátano, el problema principal al que se han enfrentado ha sido la falta de capital para poder realizarle mejoras a los cultivos, por otra parte la familia el año pasado tuvo la mala fortuna de  perder a un hijo lo cual dentro de la desdicha familiar, les trajo serios gastos que cubrir por tanto optaron por cubrir estos egresos con dinero ahorrado que tenía la familia para invertirlo en el negocio, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan se les brinde este crédito con el fin de darle mantenimiento a la cosecha en la compra de fertilizantes, esto les traería mejores condiciones económicas por que le recuperaría lo invertido y les generaría las utilidades para nuevos proyectos de la familia. Ellos son una familia muy humilde y responsable que a lo largo de los años la misma comunidad lo confirma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura Katalina C. O. is 57 and lives in the San Ignacio area. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 5 children: 4 are married adults who live on their own. The youngest lives with his parents helping them with household tasks and the farm. They have been growing pitahaya (dragon fruit), pineapple and bananas for the past 15 years. The main problem facing them has been the lack of capital to be able to improve the crops. Coupled with this last year the family had the tremendous misfortune of losing a son. This family tragedy led to a series of big expenses to cover. They had to manage these expenses with their savings that they were going to use to invest in the business. That is why they are asking for a loan-to take care of their crops with the purchase of fertilizers. This will improve their economic situation and help them repay the loan, and will generate the means for new family projects. They have been a very humble and responsible family over the years-their community will confirm this.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia H. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Pob 1, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling dressed chicken and frozen food products. Cynthia’s husband Ruel works, but also helps her in running the business. They have four school-age children.

Cynthia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by selling dressed chicken and frozen food products. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Cynthia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her dressed chicken and frozen food products business. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 11th loan in the amount of  PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to sustain her dressed chicken and frozen food products business.  Cynthia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita S., a resident of Sanepa, lives in a single family home with her husband, Mr. Surendra S., and their two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 5 and her son is in primary school.

Both Mr. and Mrs. S. are engaged in business in a small restaurant which they opened two years ago. They make different items of Nepali food in their restaurant, and they prefer to make dal bhat (cooked or steamed rice and lentil soup) in their shop. They also serve tea and coffee to their customers.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy various types of food ingredients for their business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Esperanza en Cristo esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista cerca del campo de futbol. este grupo esta integrado por tres miembros, todos vecinos de la comunidad y se conocen desde hace tiempos,  se han organizado en grupo para obtener un prestamo monetario y asi salir adelante con sus negocios. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
el señor Oscar Romeo R. tiene cuatro hijos que estan estudiando, la madre de sus hijos se fue a España en busca de trabajo y le manda dinero para sus hijos. Oscar trabaja vendiendo agua en su coche y quiere comprarse otro carro ya que a visto que el negocio de venta de agua es muy bueno y es por esta razon que solicita el credito para completar el dinero que le cuesta el carro.
la señora Belkis Marina A. E. tiene 25 años de edad, el padre de sus hijos se fue a USA
en busca de trabajo y el le ayuda economicamente con los dos hijos que tienen.
Belkis esta solicitando el credito para compra de carnes y verduras, Belkis se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas y jugos naturales.
la señora Oneyda Yamileth R. A. tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y frescos  esta solicitando el credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio, desea tener su
pulperia surtida para poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza en Cristo” (Hope in Christ) communal bank is located in the Buena Vista neighborhood close to the football field. The group is composed of three members, all neighbors who have known each other for a long time. They have formed into a group to seek funding to move their businesses forward. Following are their various commercial activities: Oscar Romeo Rodríguez has four children who are students. Their mother went to Spain in search of work and she sends back money for the children. Oscar drives around in his car selling water and he would like to buy another car because the business of selling water is a good one. This is why he’s asking for a loan: to complete what he needs to buy the car. Belkis Marina A. E. is 25 years old. The father of her children went to the United States to seek work; he sends financial help for their two children. Belkis is asking for funding to buy meats and vegetables; she makes and sells snacks and natural fruit juices. Oneyda Yamileth Rodríguez A. is 30 years old. She sells groceries and soft-drinks. She is asking for funds to stock her store. She wants to have a well-stocked store to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft-drinks, juices, canned and bagged water, beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Faigame

texts.en:
Faigame Isara P. is 23 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, selling Samoan Biscuit made from breadfruit.  Faigame has 1 year of experience in this business.  Faigame needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Faigame joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faigame's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faigame Isara P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, anteriormente había solicitado un crédito pues fue de gran beneficio. Actualmente sigue adelante con su negocio como es la venta de ropa usada. En meses ha tenido problemas con la distribución de su producto, pero esto se debe a que las personas sin trabajo ahora están buscando como poner negocios, y este negocio de ropa usada es el más fácil de establecer, además que las ganancias son promedias. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima, ya que tiene la demanda de sus clientes. Su sueño, es tener una tienda en el mercado de Managua, en el cual distribuya todos sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Mercedes has worked with Fundación for a long time. Previously, she applied for a loan which was of great benefit to her. Currently, she is moving ahead with her business selling used clothing.

The last few months sales have been low because a lot of unemployed people are trying to set up their own businesses, and the sale of used clothing is the easiest to establish. In addition, profits are just average. This loan is for the purchase of inventory to meet the demand from customers. Her dream is to have her own shop in Managua’s market in which she con distribute all her products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy, 43, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She needs farm inputs for her rice field. But she lacks capital, and that's why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., requesting a loan of 6,000 Php. This loan will enable her to provide the supplies needed for her farm. She is a mother of 2 children. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some flour, ingredients and  spices

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina C. is from the village of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, married and has 10 grown children together with her in the picture is her grandchild. To make a living, Catalina owns & operates a "sari-sari" store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Catalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Catalina’s 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: 

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Azra Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Azra parveen is living in the city of Vehari, Pakistan with her husband & two children.


Her husband is a rickshaw driver who drives someone else's rickshaw.  Her husband wants to buy his own rickshaw because 30 percent of his income goes in paying rent for the rickshaw. Azra perveen wants to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw so she has applied for a loan. A new auto rickshaw will help her husband minimize costs and, also, he will be able to work full-time without any worries. 


Azra’s daughter is eighteen years old and is nearly of marriage age. Azra is hopeful that she will be able to collect a dowry for her daughter’s marriage with the help of increased profits.

loans.use: to purchase an auto rickshaw

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir A. is a 31-year-old man who sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in Agsu city. He started his business in 2009 and since that time has become very successful. His monthly income is about $375. The fruits and vegetables he sells are very good quality, and local people buy all of them in several hours. 

Samir is married and has one son. He would like to earn enough to open one more shop in another place in his city. Because the products he sells are in very high demand, he believes in his success.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell and increase his income

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina T. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Rufina is married and has nine school-aged children. Rufina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from producing and selling boiled duck eggs or balot in the local community. Rufina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Rufina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 7000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Rufina is now requesting her sixth loan from HSPFI, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: N. Ritah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ritah has a business selling secondhand clothes, a business she has had for less than a year. To help expand her business, Ritah is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell and will also help her pay her rent. She plans to use the loan in order to gain more customers and generate profit in order to help her family. In the future, Ritah hopes to have a big boutique of her own. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Xalil

texts.ru:
Xalil Xalilovu 24 let. Xalil ne jenat on jivet v Absheron regione. Xalil s detstva pomoqal svoyemu otcu v eqo rabote. Etomu biznesu eqo toje nauchil eqo otec. Xalil uje 4 qoda otkril etot maqazin po sovetu otca. 

Seychas Xalil nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye tipi materialov dlya prodaji. Ranshe Xalil prodoval materiali dlya sshitya odejdi , podushki  i t.d a seychas on xochet kupit tkani dlya zanavesok.
texts.en:
Xalil X. is 24 years old. He is single and lives in the Absheron region. Since he was a child, Xalil has helped his father with work. His father started this business. Four years ago, Xalil opened this store under his father. Currently, Xalil needs 2000 AZN to buy new types of fabric to sell. Before, Xalil sold fabric for sewing clothes, pillows, etc. Now, he wants to buy fabric for drapes.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new fabric

loans.name: Cherry Lou

texts.en:
Cherry Lou D. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Lou sells fish. She has been operating her business for more than eight years and earns a monthly net income of 2,300 PHP.

In 2008, Cherry Lou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Lou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Cherry Lou is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be Cherry Lou's seventh loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es: El Sr. Rómulo vive en la localidad de el Torno distante 40km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, capital de los Valles Bolivianos, es de ocupación albañil, trabaja en las construcciones de viviendas, y también  comercia con hojas medicinales, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir su vivienda, tiene dos hijos los cuales viven con su madre, por que son separados, por tal motivo el le pasa pensión mensual para sus dos hijitos, cuenta que esta situación es difícil para el ya que tiene los fines de semana para ver a sus hijitos, después de fracasar en su matrimonio le costo reponerse, nuevamente esta saliendo adelante, y agradece a la institución por darle ese apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
Romulo lives in the El Torno area, located 40 km. from Santa Cruz. He was born in the department of Cochabamba, capital of Los Valles Bolivianos. He is a brick layer, and works in residential construction. He also markets medicinal herbs. The purpose of the loan is to finish building his house. He has two children, who live with their mother. They are separated, and he pays monthly child support for his two little children. He reports that the situation is hard for him, since he has weekends to see his children. After his marriage failed, it was difficult for him to get back on the ground. He is making progress once more, and thanks the institution for providing this financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La Construccion  de su Vivienda

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es un caballero humilde que tiene la edad de 62 años. Es viudo y vive con su único hijo que ya tiene 30 años. El quiere comprar dos vacas para cria. Miguel no tiene su proprio finca pero cuida la de un vecino que le permite sacar provecho a las repastas. Lo que quiere es aumentar el numero de cabezas de ganado a su posesión y sacarles cría. Por lo cual su objetivo es superarse como persona y generar mas ingresos económicos. Es su primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Hace años realizó otro préstamo en El Banco Nacional de Costa Rica pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y a una tasa de interés mas baja.
texts.en:
Miguel is a humble gentleman who is 62 years old.  He is a widower, and lives with his only son who is now 30.  He would like to purchase two cows to raise.  Miguel does not have his own farm, but he tends to that of a neighbor’s.  He would like to increase the heads of cattle that he owns.  His objective is to succeed as a person, and to generate more income.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Years ago, he had a loan with the National Bank of Costa Rica but FUDECOSUR provided him the loan with greater ease and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to raise.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy C. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Nancy is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for additional product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for additional product offering

loans.name: Sulmaris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sulmaris Martínez D. Ávila, es una mujer D. 39 años que vive en San Juan D. Nepomuceno, donD. tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios D. internet, copias y también venD. papelería en general. Tiene 4 hijos en las edades D. 4 a 18 años a quien aspira lograr llevarlos hasta que sean profesionales exitosos y gente D. bien.
DesD. hace alrededor D. dos años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ha logrado obtener, con este su credikiva,  el tercer financiamiento.  Sulmaris  inició su negocio hace algo más D. dos años, comprándoselo a una amiga, con los recursos D. ahorro que le dejaron sus anteriores trabajos con la alcaldía municipal.  Inició con cinco computadores y luego agregó el servicio D. fotocopiado y más equipos D. cómputo;  Sulmaris es una mujer que además D. tener este negocio,  también trabaja en una empresa social del estado, por eso su mayor desafío es la multiplicidad D. trabajo que diariamente enfrenta entre las dos actividades, aunque ha logrado ajustarse muy bien con el apoyo D. una amiga, que se lo atienD. diariamente mientras Sulmaris lo trabaja al medio día y en la noche,  además D. los sábados , ayudada por sus hijos.
Con el apoyo D. la Fundación en financiamientos Sulmaris ha logrado adicionar otros productos como el D. venta D. papelería, adicionalmente su esfuerzo se ve reflejado en la seriedad él.  D. allí que su sueño es ampliarlo agregándole variedades para que sea un punto D. servicio muy reconocido en el pueblo y con el lograr ofrecerle a sus hijos las posibilidades D. estudios profesionales para que se conviertan en personas exitosas en su vida personal y familiar.
Con su credikiva Sulmaris comprará un telefax, papelería y detalles que empacará muy delicadamente, para que se conviertan en los regalos típicos D. las familias en estas fiestas D. fin D. año. Su mayor desafío es el mantenimiento preventivo y manejo apropiado que requieren los equipos D. tecnología, en lo que ha logrado avanzar con la asesoría D. un técnico en el asunto.
texts.en:
Sulmaris Martínez D. Ávila, 39, is a woman living in San Juan Nepomuceno where she has an Internet café.  She also provides photocopying services and sells general stationery items.  She has four children ranging in age from 4 to 18 years that she hopes to support until they become successful professionals and upstanding citizens.

She has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for about two years and has obtained, counting this Kiva loan, thirteen loans.  Sulmaris started her business a bit more than two years ago; she bought it from a friend with savings she had from previous employment as a city employee. She started out with five computers and then added the photocopying and other computer-based services.

Besides owning this business, Sulmaris is also employed by a state-run social agency so her greatest challenge is the daily work load she faces in both activities.  She does, however, have help from a friend who tends to the store daily during the morning and Sulmaris works afternoons and evenings as well as Saturdays with help from her children.

With loans from the Fundación Sulmaris has managed to add other products, like stationery.  Her efforts are reflected in the business’s formality. This leads to her dream of enlarging it adding more variety so that it will become a well known service point in town so that she can proviD. her children with the possibility to have professional studies so that they can become successful in their personal and family lives.

She will use her Kiva funds to buy a fax machine, paper goods and gift items that she will gift wrap delicately so that they will become typical family gifts for end of year festivities.

Her biggest challenge is to keep her technical equipment in good working order and to proviD. preventive maintenance for it; for that she relies on professional assistance from a technician versed in that matter.

loans.use: She will buy a fax machine, paper goods and decorative items that she will wrap very delicately so that they can become typical family gifts for end of year festivities.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani operates a business making "parandas," a kind of decorative hair-fastening ornament. She has been making and selling these for five years, offering them for sale not only to members of her immediate community but also to various shops at the market.

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her business through the purchase of larger quantites of necessary materials, such as colored thread and beads. This will allow her to make and sell parandas in greater quantities. She is hopeful that such an investment will further enhance her business and make her business more profitable. 

She lives with her family in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan famous for its leather industry, where she has lived for 20 years. The family resides in a two-room brick house in an area named Basti Uneekan. 
 
Rani's husband A. operates a leather-selling business. He provides leather to different shoemakers on order. His business is doing well and his eldest son helps him in his business. Their next-eldest son is 11 years old and studying in third class at school. 
 
Rani is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She is confident that it will prove to be a good decision for the future of her business.

loans.use: To buy colored thread and beads for making and selling "parandas," a kind of decorative hair-fastening ornament

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is 32 years old and is married with one child, who is one year old. Fortunee is a serious and determined woman who works hard to earn more profit from her business. Normally, Fortunee sells different kinds of products such as sugar, soaps, other cosmetic products and so forth. This is her eighth successful month in business. Her small shop is open from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.

Fortunee has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more products. This loan will be important for her because she will be able to attract more customers. Fortunee plans to reinvest any profit back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Loh M. is a 46-year-old married woman blessed with six children. She shares three rooms with her six children in Susia, a quarter in Bamenda, in the Northwest region of Cameroon.

Mariana has faced many difficulties in her life, ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs, to the increasing demands of her children. Among other challenges, she has also had difficulties with inadequate capital to expand her business. 

With this loan, she plans to buy more clothes, thread, foodstuff like beans, rice, tomato, onion, garlic, maggi, sugar, and cassava flakes commonly known as garri.  She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly, thus has many clients. She has minimized risk by diversifying her business. Her activity will help her community in reducing the cost of transportation to buy foodstuff, and their cordial relationship will allow for negotiation to pay later.

She will use a fraction of her profit to assist her husband to provide for the children’s school needs, to meet her personal needs, and to feed her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy clothes and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is a 55 year old lady, and is married to Alexander who is 56 years old. They live in Oepura Village. From the marriage, Jeane is blessed with 6 children and they are: Novi, Ivon, Melky, Mersi, Rolland and Andre. Five of the children work but still live with Jeane and Alexander. Jeane does not want to lean on her children's income even though they are willing to support their parents' needs.

Jeane is a successful woman in running her business. She initiated her business by selling mobile phone recharges with her own capital. She created a simple counter to sell the mobile phone recharges at her house. Unfortunately, she only generated small income about IDR 30,000 – 50,000/day. She is now interested in running a kiosk business using the capital, but she needs more capital to expand her business.

Jeane has been with the TLM group lending program for 3 cycles. She heard from her friend that TLM provided loans for entrepreneurs like her. Her previous loans were invested to buy her kiosk business stock. She has a good credit history under the group loan program. She plans to expand her business by purchasing more stock to sell in her kiosk. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000 from TLM through the individual lending program. She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her by providing the loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell in kiosk.

loans.name: Sékou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sékou S. est un homme marié de 31 ans polygame qui est père de trois enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse à Soromana, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
Monsieur S. est un cultivateur qui  pendant la saison non pluvieuse fait du commerce de céréales. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle il  adhère au programme crédit du prêt individuel  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir acheter,  30 tonnes  de maïs pour les revendre à Bamako, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et quelques  consommateurs. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  120. 000  F CFA qui sera investi dans entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Sékou S. is married (polygamous) and the father of three children. He lives with his wife in an extended traditional family in Soromana, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of  Kolondièba, in the third administrative district (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. 

Mr. S. is a farmer who sells cereals during the dry season. In order to satisfy his customers, he has joined Soro Yiriwaso's individual loan program, and is currently in his first cycle. With this loan, he plans to buy 30 tonnes of maize to re-sell in Bamako, to customers who are both re-sellers and consumers. He obtains his supplies in the surrounding villages and hopes to make an average monthly  profit of 120,000 CFA francs which will be re-invested in the business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Bintiomari faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes hard to get charcoal to supply to her customers. She hopes to supply charcoal at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: To  purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina lives in Lahore, a historic city in Pakistan. She has spent all her married life in the area of Yadgar, one of the historic places in Lahore. Nagina is a 46-year-old housewife, who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She has 3 sons; her 2 elder sons are electricians by profession and her youngest one is studying in 9th grade.

Nagina’s husband has a business producing shoe buckles. He makes deals with different shoe companies and provides them with buckles on order. Nagina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy iron in larger quantities to help him produce buckles in bulk and to fulfill customer demands on time.

Nagina wants to marry her eldest son who is now 26 years old. She is hopeful that an increased profit will help her save money for that purpose. Nagina is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy iron to make shoe buckles

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella N. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old, single and has 1 school-aged child.  Lovella owns and operates a recycling business, buying and selling plastics, bottles and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Lovella has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Lovella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bottles, plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lovella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bottles, plastics and other recyclables

loans.name: Marriette

texts.en: Marriette was born in 1973. She has two children who are 5 and 3 years old. Marriette owns a bar in which she sells several types of beer, and she has done this business for 4 years. Marriette is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her bar by buying more beer.

loans.use: Buying beer to sell

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en su carro realizando fletes.

Ella trabaja en una fábrica y también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también les vende  a sus compañeras de trabajo. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en la fábrica y  en las noches  se dedica a vender su mercadería, además los sabados y domingos aprovecha para visitar a sus clientes. Su mercadería  la  comprar en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace tres ciclos y le gusta la buena amistad que tiene con sus compañeras.

Su sueño es tener un negocio estable en un lindo local.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘San Juan’ has a meeting every two weeks in the neighborhood in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches which have local and foreign tourists all year round. Most of its inhabitants are fishermen or work in the sea.  

There we met Mrs. Ana who is 45 years old. She is married and has two adult children, one of them lives with her. Her husband works making deliveries with his car. She works in a factory and also sells different type of clothing door to door and to her coworkers. She works from Monday to Friday in the factory, in the evenings sells the clothing and usually visits her customers on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys new items in Guayaquil every two weeks or as she needs to.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children’s clothes. She is in her third loan cycle from the communal bank and enjoys the friendship she has with other members.

Her dream is to have a stable business in a pretty location.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, etc.

loans.name: Laet

texts.en:
Mrs. Laet was born in 1985 has two children who attend the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice. She sells part of her crop and uses the rest to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sochea, owns a mill machine. 

It is time to plant in the dry season and Mrs. Let would like to plant rice and improve her crop. She is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide to grow dry-season rice.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Jose Aquilino

texts.es:
José, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años, aprendió de su padre el proceso de la siembra, trabaja todos los días de la semana y actualmente está iniciando la preparación del terreno,  para la milpa de este año.
El solicita un préstamo para compra abono y fertilizantes, esta inversión le ayudara para tener completo los materiales para el cultivo.
Su objetivo es tener trabajo para ayudar a su esposa y a su hijo, también cubrir todo lo que demande el hogar.
texts.en:
José resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. He is a farmer and lives with his wife and three-year-old son. José has been farming for seven years and learned the process of planting from his father. He works every day of the week and is currently preparing his land for this year’s crop of corn.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers. This investment will help to complete the materials needed for cultivation. His goal is to have work so that he can help his wife and son, as well as cover all of the household demands.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia comercializa cosméticos para damas y también elabora chocolates. El crédito lo requiere para comprar perfumes, así podrá  aumentar su capital de trabajo, es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vive en alquiler en una casa, la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Achumani en  la ciudad de La Paz, Julia  es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella es cliente de Impro desde el año  2008.
texts.en: Julia sells ladies' cosmetics and she also makes chocolates.  She needs this loan to buy perfumes and thereby increase her working capital.  This is the source of income with which Julia covers her family's expenses.  She lives in a rental house in Achumani district, in the city of La Paz.  Julia is married and has one child.  She has been a client of Impro since 2008.

loans.use: to buy perfumes so that she can continue in her business selling cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, coépouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
A travers les relations de commerce et de parenté elles se sont connues. 
Dans l’intention de faire des stocks en traitant avec les grossistes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et ont à leur première expérience. Elles comptent utiliser leurs prêts pour faire le commerce de chaussures, de friperies et avec Oumou, le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine
Avec ce prêt Oumou, compte acheter, 5 paires de tasses INOX, 10 douzaines de cuillères, 4 paquets de verre à boire, auprès des fournisseurs de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le petit marché de Torakabougou. 
Avec ce prêt Oumou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera  réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en: The Benkadi group is made up of married women who are 34 years old on average and have 4 children.  They live in large traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and spouses.  These women reside in the Dialanikoro neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through commercial and parental relations.  With the intention of stocking up through the services of wholesalers, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and are on their first loan.  They expect to use their loans to run a  shop selling shoes, frippery, and in Oumou's case, cooking utensils.  With this loan, Oumou expects to buy 5 pairs of INOX cups, 10 dozen spoons, and 4 packages of drinking glasses from the suppliers of Bougouni.  She will make her sales at retail and at wholesale, for cash and for credit, in the small market of Torakabougou.  With this loan, Oumou expects to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA which will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils.

loans.name: Elvia Leonor

texts.es:
Elvia Leonor tiene 22 años, Es soltera vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Elvia se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una desgranadora de maiz.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura y ayudar a los padres.
texts.en:
Elvia Leonor is 22, single, and lives with her parents.  She has no children.  She lives in the Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province.  

The Señor de Salud village bank is located in Soloma in the Echeandia canton. The members earn their living in agriculture, planting corn and rice, which they buy in Ventanas and sell at the fairs every day, especially Sundays.  

Elvia Leonor is seeking a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  The loan would provide the financial support to get what she needs. She faces challenges like pests and diseases in her crops as well as variations in weather.  Her dream is to buy a corn sheller.  

She likes working in agriculture and helping out her parents.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 30 years old and married with five children between the ages of two and 15. She practices mixed farming in her hometown of Litein in South Rift Kenya. Edna produces maize, eggs, and milk, which she sells to the local market. She employs two farmhands on her farm. Edna’s main business challenge is finances.

Edna is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from the Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. She says the poultry business will help her meet her family’s basic needs, especially educating her children. Edna is very optimistic that her business will grow significantly.

loans.use: to puchase poultry

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, la señora Zoila María   es una  persona, responsable, trabajador con bueno valores morales, que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su familia y  ha logrado mantener estabilidad en  su hogar.
Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar  un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda, con este desembolso comprara materiales de construcción tales como cemento, bloque, hierro, estribo y pago de mano de obra, para poder reparar  su hogar  y poder dar una mejor condición de vida a sus familia.
texts.en:
Zoila María is a responsible, hardworking woman of good moral values, who has been able to provide for her family and who has succeeded in bringing stability to her house. She lives in Managua.
She has recently come to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan she will use to make improvements to her house. In order to have her house repaired and to offer better living conditions to her family, she will use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, iron and buttress, as well as to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, iron and buttress, as well as to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 48, is married with five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. Merlyn supports her husband in tilling the land and growing rice crops. She also manages their sari-sari store business, selling items such as eggs, canned goods and vinegar to the people in her community.

Merlyn requested this loan to fund their farm. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies they need. Merlyn hopes that through their businesses, their lives will be uplifted.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Idelma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Idelma casada, sus hijos estudiantes, los planes para la  familia es que sus hijos logren una carrera para defenderse ante la vida. Su esposo le ayuda económicamente. Siendo un ingreso más.
El proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Tiene su propio negocio ya que es costurera trabaja por cuentas propias desde hace tiempo en el trabajo no se le ha presentado ninguna dificulta. Iniciándolo con fondos propios ya que elabora productos y los vende. 
El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, la compra de láminas para el portón, soldaduras,  perlines entre otros materiales para la construcción del porche de la casa, así le brindara a su familia comodidad, seguridad.
texts.en:
Idelma is married and her children are students. Her hope for the family is that each of her children will embark on a career, so that they can fend for themselves in life. 

Idelma helps her husband financially, providing an additional income. She has her own business as a self-employed seamstress, and has been working for a long time. She has never experienced any difficulties with her business. Idelma started the business from her own funds, by making products and selling them. 

The project is to improve the infrastructure of their home. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand, slates for the entrance, welding equipment, purlins, and other materials needed for the construction of the porch. This will bring her family security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa Antonia tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su pareja y con su hija de 13 años de edad en el  Ventanas perteneciente al Cantón Mocache Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol dandul, para la compra de abonos y semillas  fertilizantes abonos agrícolas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas para poderse comprar una finca y un carro. 

Se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, en sus tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Rosa Antonia is 32 years old and lives with her common law partner and with their 13 year old daughter in Ventanas, belonging to Mocache canton in Los Rios Province.

The members of the NUEVA ESPERANZA communal bank are located in JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER precinct belonging to Ventanas canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice and gandul beans.

Rosa works in agriculture cultivating corn, rice and gandul beans. She purchases her products in the Roca Market in Ventanas and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan in order to plant corn, rice and gandul beans, for the purchase of fertilizers and seeds for agricultural production. Support from this loan will help her to economically provide for her needs. She confronts challenges such as infestations  and plant diseases. Her dream is to do extremely well and to work even harder in order to be able to buy a farm and a car. 

She is considered an enterprising and hard working woman. In her free time she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for agricultural production

loans.name: Aisuluu's Group

texts.en:
Aisuluu is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she brings up a son, who is fifteen and studies at school.

Aisuluu works as an office manager in the Rural Consultant Service. At the same time she is engaged in cattle breeding. She started this activity a long time ago. With the profits gained from reselling cattle Aisuluu saved money for purchasing a vehicle.  She applied for the loan because she needs financial funds to purchase feed for cattle. In the future she wishes to purchase an apartment in the center of the city.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de queso y crema, vive con dos hijos, ellos le ayudan a preparar la venta, María tiene 7 años de dedicarse al negocio, lo tiene ubicado en el centro de la ciudad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche para elaborar el queso y la crema, esta inversión le ayudara para tener más productos para la venta.  
Ella quiere mejorar el negocio, tener productos de calidad, para atender mejor la demanda de los clientes y aumentar las ganancias para sus hijos.
texts.en:
María sells cheese and cream.  She lives with her two children, and they help her prepare for her sales.  María has been in this business for seven years.  It is located in the center of the city.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy milk to make cheese and cream.  This investment will help her have more products to sell.

She wants to improve the business and have quality products in order to better meet customer demand and increase her income for her children.

loans.use: to buy milk in order to make cheese, cream, and curd.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Joy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Joy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tapiracuai Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Tapiracuai Poty se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo y sobre todo demuestran mucho entusiasmo para emprender algo nuevo. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 14 integrante, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de mutua cooperación y ayuda.
Una de las miembros es la señora Miguelina, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, como ser pantalones, remeras, camisas y demás. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para la posterior venta, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee “Tapiracuai Poty” was established as a result of several neighbors from the community joining together. The members have formed a very unified and capable group in which they work together in activities to strengthen their camaraderie. Above all, they have demonstrated great enthusiasm as they start this new endeavor. The group currently has 14 members who all work in a spirit of mutual cooperation and helpfulness.

One of the members is Sra. Miguelina. She sells clothing of all types such as trousers, t-shirts, shirts, and other items. She says that through her work she has been able to move her family forward and provide for the daily household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes for eventual resale so that she can restock her inventory and fulfill the orders from her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for eventual resale.

loans.name: Migdalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Migdalia Del Carmen tiene 41 años, su actividad es la pesca artesanal. Tiene más de 15 años en este negocio esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues a pesar de que no es fácil sacar adelante su negocio debido a los diferentes problemas que atraviesa esto no la desanima a seguir adelante con este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de una lancha para proporcionar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: Migdalia Del Carmen is 41 years old and she is a fisherwoman, an activity she has been engaged in for 15 years. This is the first time she is requesting a loan, and even though it is not easy to carry on her activity owing to the different problems she has to face, she is not discouraged and she keeps on engaging in this activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a small boat in order to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy a small boat.

loans.name: Ata Allah

texts.en:
Ata Allah is a 53-year-old married man from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a father of five children.

Ata Allah has his own bakery and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to do maintenance for his bakery and purchase raw materials.

Ata Allah is looking to open another branch of his bakery and finance the education of his children in school.

loans.use: to do maintenance and purchase materials.

loans.name: Ana Betty

texts.es:
Ana, necesita nuevamente un préstamo, porque quiere comprar productos para el negocio, como bolsos, cinchos, repuestos para bicicletas, esta compra fortalecerá el negocio y así como en el anterior, vera un aumento en las ganancias, mejorando su actividad comercial.
La familia de Ana continúan siendo los mismos, no han aumentado y gracias a Dios todos siguen con salud, solamente apoyándola en el negocio.
texts.en: Ana needs a loan again because she wants to buy products for her business like purses, belts and bicycle spare parts.  This purchase will strengthen the business like the last one did and she’ll see an increase in profits improving her commercial activity.  Ana’s family continues unchanged, they haven’t increased and thanks be to God continue in good health just helping her with the business.

loans.use: to buy purses, belts and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Magaly Baltazara

texts.es:
La Señora. Magaly es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante  del país, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracteriza por ser gente amable y carismática.

Doña Magaly tiene 48 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 5 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, su hija de 24 años está estudiando en la universidad y su último hijo de 17 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La Señora Magaly también  cuida a dos nietos. Su esposo es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de calzado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Magaly es oriunda de la provincia de Manabí vive hace 9 años en la ciudad de Cuenca. Ella al igual que su esposo es comerciante y también se dedica a la venta de calzado, lleva 6 años en el negocio y su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de zapatos para tener un mayor surtido.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Magaly is a member of the 'Medio Ejido' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  Cuenca is the third most important city in the country.  Its people maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  They are noted for being kind and charismatic people.

Magaly is 48 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and the couple have five children.  Three of their children are married and live independently.  Their 24-year-old daughter is studying at university and their youngest son, who is 17, attends high school in the city.  Magaly also cares for two grandchildren.  Her husband is a salesman and sells footwear.  They do not own their own home and so live in a rental house.

Magaly is originally from Manabí province.  She has been living in the city of Cuenca for 9 years.  She is a salesperson like her husband and also sells footwear.  She has been in her business for 6 years and she travels round the city selling her merchandise.

This is Magaly's second loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying shoes so that she has more stock.

Magaly's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while the other one is too young for school. His wife Kwekwe is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

James has operated a retail shop for the past five years; his potential clients are his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings he wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepcion, esta decidida por un nuevo prestamo, este nuevo tramite es para utilizarlo en la compra de mesas y sillas plasticas, tambien gaseosas, para el negocio que hoy en dia administra, ella se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios por la temporada que se acerca.
Ella esta contenta por que el primer prestamo le ayudo a cubrir un gasto personal el cual era de mucha importancia.
texts.en:
Concepcion decided to ask for a new loan to buy plastic tables and chairs, and also soft drinks for the business she manages.  She sells food for the upcoming season.

She is happy because the first loan helped her cover a very important personal expense.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gaby Julia

texts.es: La señorita Gaby,  cliente de emprender esta ves se encuentra en su segunda secuencia, se dedica a la venta de frutas como manzanas, limones y ajos desde hace dos años en una calle de la ciudad de el Alto,  área de mucha afluencia en el comercio, la cliente cuenta que en el futuro piensa adquirir otro puesto y así crecer en presencia dentro del mercado y también incrementar su capital de trabajo, solicito el crédito para la compra de frutas por cantidad para surtir su puesto, ya que estas fechas tiene mucha venta, la Señorita Gaby trabaja muy duro ya que esta es su única fuente de ingreso para mantenerse, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gaby, a client of Emprender, is now in her second loan sequence.  She has been working for two years selling fruit, such as apples, lemons, and garlic, in a street in the city of El Alto, a very busy area for commerce.

Gaby hopes that in the future she can acquire another stall and so increase her presence in the market and also her working capital.

She requested the loan to buy fruit wholesale to supply her stall, since she makes a lot of sales these days.

Gaby works very hard because this is her only source of income to support herself.  She is happy and grateful for the opportunity this gives her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy apples, lemons, and garlic to sell.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: At this time, Terbish is requesting a loan to purchase necessary building materials for making renovations to his house and fence.

loans.use: To purchase necessary building materials for making renovations to his house and fence.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es: A sus 56 años, la señora Luz Estella es madre de tres hijos de 16, 13, 11 años de edad, por quienes trabaja día a día con el ánimo de brindarles una buena calidad de vida, dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza y cuidado personal por catalogo desde hace dos años a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos. Gracias a esta actividad puede generar los ingresos necesarios para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. La señora Luz Estela necesita de la compra de surtido en dichos productos los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, calidad de vida y a futuro cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en: At 56 years old, Luz Estella is the mother of three children who are 16, 13, and 11 years old and for whose sake she works day after day in hopes of offering them a good quality of life.  For two years now, she has sold beauty and personal care products through catalogs to her family, neighbors, and friends.  Thanks to this business she is able to generate the income she needs to cover her household expenses.  Luz Estella needs to stock up on those products so she can offer them to her customers and be able to improve her income, her quality of life, and in the future to achieve her dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to stock up on creams, body lotions, perfumes, and beauty products

loans.name: David

texts.es: David de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermana, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de sus ventas, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta C., a 61-year-old widow, native of the District of Matutuine, in the south of the province of Maputo, has 8 children and 6 grandchildren, grew up in the Swiss Mission church and was not able to attend school due to the differences between the colonial government and the church.

After the death of her husband, who was a fisherman, 6 years ago from an illness, she has gone through many difficulties because the reserve of savings was used to take care of the hospital expenses of her late husband.

After the death of her husband, with a group of 12 members under her care, she had no choice but to continue the work her late husband did, even though the equipment was in a precarious state and the sea was polluted by the Greek petroleum ship, Katina P.

Even with these problems, she met the challenge, and with her youngest son who, at the time was 14, started the work up again, with him as captain of the ship.

In 2001, she found out about the Microfinance Institution called Hluvuku-Adsema, which operated around 45 km from where she was, so she went there and requested a loan to acquire and rehabilitate fishing equipment. This was accepted and she also benefitted from training on business management. With this loan, she was able to revitalize the microbusiness, and several others followed to maintain and expand the business, totalling 6 loans in all. Given her low level of schooling, she has received continuous monitoring from the Hluvuku-Adsema staff in order to generate more business and ensure the repayment of the loans. This work won her 3rd place in the Global Micro-Businessperson Contest held in Mozambique in 2004, during the commemorations of the International Year of Microcredit.

She currently has a motor boat and 8 permanent workers. With a loan of 20,000 meticais, she plans to buy more fishing nets in order to increase her production capacity, create more jobs - it should be 4 more seasonal workers - as well as buy a freezer with 270 L capacity to be able to better preserve the fishing products.

Her activity has a greater impact on the life of the community because, in addition to generating more jobs for the people who work directly with fishing, she creates more jobs for the people who acquire the product to later resell it. She also contributes to a continuous supply of a range of seafood to the city of Maputo, greatly contributing to improve the population\'s diet.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Marta C. Sector de Actividade Pesca Valor de Empréstimo: 20.000,00 Mtn (769 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: compra de redes pesca e sistema de frio( congelador) Inicio - 14/11/2006 Fim – 06/05/2008 Marta C., viúva de 61 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Matutuine, sul da província de Maputo tem 8 filhos e 6 netos, cresceu na igreja da Missão –Suiça e não conseguiu frequentar a escola divido as divergência entre o governo colonial e a igreja.

Depois da morte do Marido que era pescador à 6 anos vítima de doença atravessou muitas dificuldades porque a reserva das economias foram usadas para custear as despesas de hospitalares do falecido.

Desde a morte do marido e com um agregado de 12 membros sob a sua responsabilidade, não tinha alternativa para a continuidade da actividade que o falecido marido exercia uma vez que para alem do estado precário em os equipamento se encontravam, o mar estava poluído pelo petroleiro grego “Katina P”.
