Mesmo com estas dificuldades desafiou a situação e com o filho mais novo que na altura tinha 14 anos reiniciaram a actividade, este como capitão da embarcação.

No ano de 2001, teve informações da existência de uma instituição Micro-financeira denominada Hluvuku-Adsema, que operava a cerca de 45km da sua localidade tendo se deslocado para lá e solicitou um empréstimo para aquisição e reabilitação de equipamento de pesca, o qual foi aceite e também beneficiou-se de formação sobre gestão de negócio. Com este empréstimo conseguiu revitalizar a micro empresa tendo seguindo vários outros para a ampliação do negócio e sua manutenção totalizado 6 empréstimos desembolsados. Dado o seu baixo nível de escolarização tem recebido um acompanhamento contínuo de monitorização por parte do pessoal da Hluvuku- Adsema de forma a gerir melhor o seu negocio e garantir os reembolsos dos empréstimos, este trabalho garantiu-lhe a conquista do 3º lugar no Concurso Global de Micro – Empresário realizado em Moçambique no ano 2004 no âmbito das comemorações do ano internacional de micro crédito.

Actualmente conta com um barco a motor e 8 trabalhadores efectivos, com empréstimo de 20.000, 00 mtn, pretende comprar mais redes de pesca de forma a aumentar a sua capacidade de produção, criar mais postos de trabalho pelo que conta contratar mais 4 trabalhadores sazonais assim como comprar um congelador com capacidade de 270 L de forma a poder conservar melhor os produtos de pesca.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na vida da comunidade porque para além de gerar mais posto de trabalho para o pessoal que trabalha directamente com a pesca cria mais posto de trabalho para o pessoal que adquirir o produto para uma posterior revenda e por outro lado permite um abastecimento contínuo em diversos mariscos à cidade de Maputo contribuindo grandemente para melhor dieta alimentar da população.

loans.use: Buying nets and refrigater

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en: Deogratius is 44 years old and married with  four children. He owns a hardware shop selling construction equipment and materials. Construction of houses in the area is on the rise. Deogratius is planning to add electrical items on the shop, because he learned that people usually like to find all the items they want under one roof. Deogratius needs USD 1,200 to purchase the new stock.

loans.use: Add stock to his hardware shop.

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en: Zachariah is married with seven children, all of whom are in school.  He started his business seven years ago.  He makes kitchen utensils using melted aluminium.  He started the business while in Sudan, then moved to Kampala, and finally settled in Malaba. In Malaba, he has trained almost everyone who is interested, and the business is booming.  With a loan from PEMCI, he plans to increase his stocks of raw materials to enable him to expand his production of utensils and other household goods. His long term plan is to grow into a mini factory producing an assorted range of aluminum goods. Through his business, he has been able to employ ten people, and educate his children. His wife is also engaged in the business. He has also brought the aluminum smelting skills to the people of Malaba. Through him, many have opened similar facilities. He is, therefore, a role model and a reference point in the business.

loans.use: To Buy Stocks of Scrap Metals

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Señor A. is the owner of a mill where tortillas are made. Additionally, coffee and cocoa beans are ground here and prepared into different national drinks. He is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials for maintaining his work site. He plans to repair the roof, because the last rains damaged his mill. He plans to change the floor, because he says the current floor gives his business a bad appearance. With the repairs, he hopes to increase his number of clients and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. A. es propietario de un molino en el cual se fabrican la masa con la cual se elaboran tortillas, además se muele café y cacao con el cual se preparan diferentes bebidas nacionales. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para realizar el mantenimiento a su local, piensa reparar el techo, ya que las últimas lluvias lo han dañado y piensa cambiar el piso ya que según el Sr. A. le da mal aspecto a su negocio. Con las reparaciones espera incrementar el número de clientes y elevar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Repair the roof and improve the floor of his work site.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Mr. Taleh is a low income, vulnerable person. He is 32, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Taleh sells beef in Saatli town during the morning and then in the afternoon goes to the meadow to  graze cattles. During the autumn months animals are cheap and this gives Taleh a chance to buy and increase his cattle stock. That's why he applied for a $500 loan to  the Normicro Saatli branch. This amount would allow  him buy two calfs and earn $1200 in half a year.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Ayaba Déla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayaba Déla D. is married and takes care of four (04) people. She was born March 10, 1977 in Lomé and is a pharmaceutical retailer. She brilliantly manages all aspects of her business and is now requesting a loan in order to build up her inventory and buy essential products. To help the local population and meet its needs, Mrs. Ayaba Déla D. is requesting a loan of $1000.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée avec quatre (04) personnes à charge, la revendeuse de produit pharmaceutique madame Ayaba Déla D. est née le 10 mars 1977 à Lomé. Maîtrisant tous les contours de son commerce, elle désire un appui financier pour faire des stocks de marchandises en achetant surtout les produits de première nécessité. Pour arriver à sauver et à satisfaire la population, madame Ayaba Déla D. sollicite un crédit de $1000.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Houng

texts.en:
Mr. L. Houng , 52, has been married since 1983. He's been a fisherman for over 30 years, a skill he learned as a young man by watching other men in the village. His wife, Phon, has been farming for the same length of time. Almost every day Phon travels to Phnom Penh to sell their vegetables and fresh fish at the markets. They have nine children, ages 3-23, six of whom are attending school. The oldest two are employed.

Houng is requesting a first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. He will use this loan to purchase a new fishing net (US$ 100) and repair his boat engine. Fishing is a profitable business, by Cambodian standards, but the upfront costs are high. This loan will enable Houng to continue his work and earn a good profit without sacrificing the family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a new fishing net and repair boat motor

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Dedicated to her small coffee, citrus, and banana plantation, Mrs. Marisol P. makes the best effort to provide an education for her seven children. This noble mother regrets not having the financial means to offer her children higher education because she has obligated three of her eldest children to help out by working on the farm and taking care of the younger children. However, she does not lose the hope of being able to provide an education for her younger children, who will soon conclude their school year in an educational center in their humble community. For this reason, Marisol wishes to have your support, so that she can invest the loan into her plantation and increase production. We are counting on your generous cooperation so that we may grant this family a little ray of hope.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Dedicada a su chacra de café cítricos y plátanos, doña Marisol, se esfuerza al máximo por educar a sus siete hijos, de los cuales los tres mayores la apoyan en la chacra; esta noble madre lamenta no tener la capacidad adquisitiva para ofrecer a sus hijos una educación superior ya que la necesidad ha obligado a sus hijos mayores a apoyar a su madre y cuidar a sus hermanos.No pierde las esperanzas de educar a sus pequeños hijos que están pronto a culminar su año académico en un centro educativo de su humilde comunidad. .Motivo por el cual, Marisol, desea vuestro apoyo para invertir el dinero que solicita en sus terrenos de cultivo a fin de incrementar su producción.Contamos con su gentil colaboración para poder otorgarle un rayito de esperanza a esta familia.

loans.use: Increase production

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina R. works very hard selling ice cream in the Santa Ana market of the beautiful city of Chinandega.

She is married with one child and it is in order to support such a responsibility that she began her business selling ice cream. She started as a walking saleswoman inside the market, and later she established her own store in order to attract more customers. For the past three years Cristina has worked with the lending organization Ceprodel, which has given her loan assistance. She has used the money to purchase raw materials, and she has successfully repaid 15 previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de helados es el negocio al cual muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Cristina R. en el mercado Santa Ana de la bella ciudad de Chinandega.

Es madre casada y con un hijo a su responsabilidad y es por esta razón que emprende este negocio vendiendo primeramente ambulante en el interior del mercado, luego se establece en su localidad para asi captar mas clientes. Desde hace 3 años la señora Cristina ha recurrido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado una mano de ayuda con créditos que los ha utilizado directamente para la inversión en la compra de su materia prima. Su record es de 15 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a business selling Juane in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. Juane is a food typical of the region and culture of the Peruvian jungle; it is most often made of rice and chicken wrapped in a palm leaf. Ana is from Moyobamba where they add extra spices to their Juane. She continues to use this recipe and has received rave reviews. Ana has sold her Juane in Tarapoto for five years and now has numerous loyal customers. They tell her she has the tastiest Juane in town.

Ana is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She started the business to help her family and take charge of her life. She wakes up at 5 a.m. every morning to go sell her Juane in the main market. She returns home at lunch to start preparing Juane for the next day. Ana is happy that she can provide a better life and more opportunities for her children. She hopes to buy a computer for her children in the near future.

A member of the community bank Las Orquideas, Ana is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 6 months. She would use the extra capital to buy oil, rice, chicken, pork, yucca, and corn. With the extra money Ana will be able to keep up with ever increasing demand.

loans.use: She would buy ingredients, including: oil, rice, chicken, pork, yucca and corn

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 14. Rehema owns a small shop and has been a shopkeeper since 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Specioza Nambooze's Group

texts.en:
Specioza is the leader of 5 group members. She is 50 and married with 4 children. Their ages are 26, 17, 15, and 13. The last 3 are in school. The community she works and lives in is semi urban and a slum within an area that is prone to flooding in the rainy season.

She buys rolls of material, which she takes for designing to tailors at a fee for onward selling. There are stalls for charcoal, vegetables, and bananas for food, which she collects from the rural areas and sells retail and wholesale.

Her main challenges are the seasonality of the agricultural produce, high taxation and transport costs, and the floods in the rainy season. The stalls become inaccessible during the rains, and at the same time it becomes difficult for her to move around in order to sell the clothes. There is a ready market for the other merchandise.

She is able to pay rent and school dues and contribute towards fending for the family. She was also able to buy a piece of land.

Her plan is to build a house. Specioza has paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: Her plan is to build a house.

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
The main activity of the group "Sky" is making hand embroidered clothes, purses and folk disguises. They work with Pro-Mujer and take on much responsibility. They have already finalized the work that people have ordered, art work for stores, and folk disguises for fairs in the city of "La Paz."

The dream of the association is to export their products to the interior and exterior of the country. In order to do this, they need better credit to replenish their capital for work and be able to hire personnel to help them in the business. They already have orders that demand manual labor and much time and they will train these new employees in order to ensure the quality of their products. In this way, they will achieve better economic and personal status for the benefit of their homes.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El bordado a mano de carteras, monederos y disfraces folklóricos es la principal actividad de la asociación “Cielo”, que trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad. Ya finalizados sus trabajos los venden a pedido, en tiendas de artesanía, tiendas de disfraces folklóricos y ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. El sueño que la asociación, es el de exportar sus productos al interior y exterior del país. Para esto necesitan mayores créditos para reforzar su capital de trabajo y poder contratar personal que les ayude en este negocio ya que al ser una producción manual demanda mucho tiempo además de acceder a capacitaciones donde aprendan a promocionar sus productos de manera mas calificada. De esta manera logran crecimiento personal y económico, para el bien de sus hogares.

loans.use:
They need capital to share amongst themselves and to take professional courses.
necesitan capital para comtartar pérsonal y para acceder a cursos profesionales

loans.name: Nulu Nakakande’S Group

texts.en:
Nulu N. is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, ranging in age from 21 years to 10 months old.  She sells mukene (siver fish), a small fish sold by the scoopful and used to provide relatively inexpensive protein for meals.  Twice a week, she travels by truck from Kampala to Entebbe, about an hour drive away, to buy mukene from the market, leaving at 4:00 a.m.  She buys 8 large sacks at a time at 80,000/= each (Ugandan shillings, about $48 US), and brings them back to sell at the local market in smaller amounts.  Each sack nets a profit of about 20,000/= (about $12).  

Nulu and her group have previously received 8 loans from MCDT.  With this loan, Nulu would like to add inventory for her business.  The loan will also help her to pay school fees for her two middle children.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Kidogo's Hidaya Njema Group

texts.en:
Kidogo is 48 years old, married, with 4 children ages 25, 11, 9, and 2. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Kidogo now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has business dealing with shop own

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Thi Tinh's Group

texts.vi:
chị N. thị Tình năm nay 41 tuổi Ms 01020028 chị vay mức 3.186.000 VND để buôn thóc và chăn nuôi lợn. vợ chồng chị sinh được 4 con, 2 con gái đi lấy chồng, 1 con đi làm và 1 con đang đi học. Chồng chị ngoài việc chăn nuôi, anh còn đi đánh bắt cá về bán.Vì vậy mức thu nhập của gia đình từ 120.000 VND đến 150.000 VND / ngày. Nên chị rất thích hình thức vay vốn này vì nó giúp chị có cơ hội trả dần. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Tính Ms 01020004 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Cảnh Ms 01020063 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ buôn thóc, gạo
  • chị Nguyễn thị Chiên Ms 01020064 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để sản xuất giò chả
  • chị Nguyễn thị Đức Ms 01020065 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi buôn thóc, gạo
texts.en:
Mrs N. thị Tình is 41 years old. She is seeking a loan of 3.186.000 VND to buy rice for retail and to raise pigs. She is married and has 4 children: 2 girls who are already married, 1 who is working and the youngest one is still in school. Her husband is responsible for the pigs. He is also a fisherman. Her family income is 120.000 VND to 150.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program a lot because it gives her the opportunity to pay back in small payments. Her group is comprised of:
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Tính, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells basic goods
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Cảnh, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells rice
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Chiên, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She's a sausage maker
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Đức Ms, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells rice

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise pigs and sells rice

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos de 49 años de edad, esta felizmente casado desde hace 15 años con la señora Juana de 47 años.

Desde pequeño, Don Carlos trabajaba en un taller, lugar donde acumuló la experiencia necesaria para luego, en el año 1.995 emprendiera su propio taller mecánico, con un pequeño ahorro que contaba hasta entonces. En el año 2.004 amplio su negocio y abrió una casa de repuestos para motos y bicicletas.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más aún su taller para poder ofrecer un servicio completo a su clientela.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para motos y bicicletas.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos (49 years of age), is happily married for 15 years now with señora Juana (47 years of age). From the time he was a small boy, Carlos worked in a factory where he gained the necessary experience to open his own machine shop in 1995. He was able to do this with the savings he had accumulated until that point in his life. Then, in 2004, he expanded his business to include a spare parts shop for motorcycles and bicycles.

Now his personal dream is to expand his workshop even further and offer complete services to his customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase additional spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles.


Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr. Chin S. lives in Sras Pring village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn his living. On his plantation, he now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which affects his crop. To solve this problem, he would like a loan of $125 to buy fertilizers to ammend the field. His wife, Mrs. Ur Pha, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Chin S. is 50 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a driver and one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one attends the local school. His wife appears with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to ammend his rice field.

loans.name: Segundina Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” del Distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito – Puno, vive en el Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco Nº 146, Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos que están a su cargo, es casada y se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Segundina con el primer préstamo de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, etc. para aumentar su mercadería.

Al mismo tiempo teje chompas para los clientes que le hacen pedidos, ella compra golosinas de Desaguadero.

Con el préstamo que recibirá de S/.  1000.00 nuevos soles  el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprara mas golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, etc.

Su mayor deseo es poner una Tienda grande para poder vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs Paulina belongs to "Banco Comunal Inmaculada Concepción" of the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Puno. She lives in Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco No. 146. She is 42 years old and a mother of 2 children who depend on her. She is married and sells candy for a living. With the first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles Segundina bought candy, cookies, soft drinks etc. in order to increase her merchandise.

At the same time she knits sweaters ordered by her clients. She buys candy at Desaguadero.

With the loan of S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, etc. It is her greatest wish to have a big store so she can sell in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah K. is 50 years old, married,  and the mother of four children. She manufactures palm kernel oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale because she does not have sufficient capital to buy machines for processing the oil. She is requesting a loan so she can buy more raw material (palm kernel) and the processing equipment that will help her to produce palm kernel oil in larger quantities. She believes this increased production will augment her income so she can better provide for her family and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “Tumi wura” (Almighty) Trust Group. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm kernel and the equipment to process it

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon H. is a farmer who lives in Preak Phum village in the Kandal province. Since her field is quite a distance from an irrigation system, Mrs. Lon H. has difficulty watering her field. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to irrigate her field and improve her crops. Her husband, Mr. Em Srin, helps her on the plantation.

Mrs. Lon H. is 41-years-old and the mother of eight children. Three are employed in a garment factory, while four others are attending the local school. The youngest child, age four, stays at home.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to irrigate the field and improve the crop production.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, con sus treinta y nueve años, tiene una historia de trabajos bastante variada. En su juventud trabajó durante cinco años de empleada en una tienda de ropa intima. Sin embargo tuve que dejar este trabajo cuando estaba embarazada de su segunda hija, por que tuvo dos amenazas de aborto.

Volvió a trabajar después de un tiempo por ayudar a su esposo, que era visitador medico, y que en este tiempo no lograba dar a su familia el nivel de vida deseado con su solo empleo. Ahora ya desde hace cuatro años tiene un contrato fijo en un laboratorio.

Rosa volvió a trabajar vendiendo anticuchos en las calles, justo fuera de su casa, durante cuatro años. Quería trabajar en algo que le dejara estar cerca de sus dos hijos menores. Hace tres años empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y así pude empezar otro negocio que le interesaba más: la venta de cosméticos.

Contribuye a los gastos del hogar pagando los servicios y cubriendo los consumos de su niños, lo que sobra lo reinvierte en su negocio.

Está conversando con una amiga para juntarse y abrir un salón de belleza en el futuro próximo.
texts.en:
In her 39 years, Rosa has had a wide variety of jobs. In her youth she worked for 5 years as an employee in and underwear shop. However, she had to leave this job when she was pregnant with her second daughter because she had two threats of miscaraige.

She returned to work to help her husband, then working as a visiting doctor, who could not support the family alone. Now, four years later, Rasa's husband has a solid job at a labratory.

Rosa resumed work selling snack foods on the street right in front of her house so that she could be close to her children. She wanted to work in something that would not make her leave her two youngest children alone. Three years ago she began to receive loans from EDAPROSPO, so she could start a business that she enjoyed more, selling cosmetics.

Rosa contributes to the family, helping pay for services and food. She invests any left over money in her business. Rosa hope to start a beauty salon with her friend in the near future.

(Translated by Ally of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New Merchandise (Cosmetics)

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Ms. Justine A. has a grocery shop. She is a hard-working woman with 4 children who are school-going. Justine has 6 years experience in her business.

The loan is enabling Justine to purchase more items for her shop such as rice, "posho" (cornmeal), margarine, sugar, and many more items. This has increased her profits, thus improving her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more items such as rice, cornmeal, margarine, and sugar for re-sale

loans.name: Kponbogan

texts.fr:
V. Kponbogan est née dans la commune de zoungbomey le 19 septembre 1970. Actuellement Kponbogan vit à Takon à Sakété, département de Plateau. Kponbogan est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. V. Kponbogan transforme le noix de palme en ses différents produits finis. Mais Kponbogan n'a pas suffisamment d'argent pour élever son niveau d'activité. Pour pouvoir y arriver, Kponbogan a besoin de crédit. 
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
V. Kponbogan was born in the area of zoungbomey on September 19 septembre 1970. Currently, Kponbogan lives in Takon in Sakété, a department in the Plains. Kponbogan is married and mother of 3 children, only 1 of whom is in school. V. Kponbogan transforms palm nut in its various finished products. But Kponbogan does not have sufficient funds to improve her level of activity. To accomplish this, Kponbogan needs a loan. The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, the Fon, is « a path always exists for the poorest ». Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria where the GNP per capita is $1,500. ALIDé offers special 0% loans to very vulnerable people and is part of a group that will soon launch a microinsurance program for the beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy palm nut

loans.name: Souhayla

texts.en:
Souhayla is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Souhayla has been a sewer for six years. She requested a loan of 1300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. Souhayla has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time. 
Her previous loans helped her improve her work. Her clients are friends, neighbors, family members and others. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Mrs. Saron T. lives in Ro Teang village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Eang Chheang, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow vegetables to earn a living. They are facing some problems with their cultivation, because they do not have enough money to buy vegetable seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Saron T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 57 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others stay at home to help with the housework and help with their parents' work. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell generic medicines

loans.name: Manzooran Moula Baksh Group

texts.en:
My name is Manzooran and I have been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the last eleven years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. I own a two-room house in this city.

My husband’s name is M. B. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He has four years of experience in this business. I’m applying for a loan to repair my husband’s auto-rickshaw because it’s creating trouble and it requires an urgent repair otherwise the engine becomes seized.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality:

Shahnaz begum baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

Kalsoom akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. 

Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy toys for her toy shop.

Note: In the photo, Shahnaz begum baji is showing her clothes variety.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren C. lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two oldest children both go to private high schools and the youngest daughter goes a local kindergarten.

Nyamsuren runs a small factory that produces concrete blocks for construction in the city. His factory is located in Tolgoit, one of the suburban areas of Ulaanbaatar, connected to the city by a paved road. His factory currently has three employees and he plans to expand the factory as the demand for construction materials in the city picks up soon.

Nyamsuren works hard in order to be financially able to meet his family's ever increasing expenses. His two children both go to private schools and it significantly adds up to the family expense. He stressed the importance of education for his children and hopes to keep supporting their education as long as he can. Nyamsuren requests a loan to purchase raw materials for his concrete-block-making business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as sand and small rocks

loans.name: Tdo 2 Nakimuli Annet Group

texts.en: Nakimuli A. is 24 years old, married with four children (who are in schooling) and looking after one dependent. She has been in her business of operating a salon for four years and a boutique for one year so far. She is using the loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals and hair treatments, and for purchasing boutique items such as various types of clothing. She is also employing some people to help her in case she is not around. Nakimuli A. is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase salon items such as hair chemicals and hair treatments, and to purchase boutique items, such as various types of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Ndiuka C Group

texts.en:
Zamoyoni is a member of the Ndiuka C borrower group,she is 24 years old,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 3 and 1 years.

Zamoyoni started her own food clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 100,000 Tsh.

This is Zamoyono`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Zamoyoni hopes to save more money and expand her business.
Fikiria is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 250,000 Tsh in order to expand her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Rannie

texts.en:
"My farm (is) doing great. Because of it I am able to provide the needs for my family," says Rannie, a 34-year-old farmer. He only has one child who is 15 months old now. He started farming in 2008 and now he needs additional capital to run his farm and make it more productive.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures to support his farm. Receiving a loan will truly help him buy farming needs like rice seeds and fertilizers.

His dream for his child is to be a good person when he grows up. He said he likes CEVI services because of the insurance coverage and small interest rate they provide.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is 56 years old and married with four children. She sells underwear. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more underwear to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna M. is an entrepreneur Tanzanian business married woman. She runs a business of keeping poultry at Yombo Dovya ward in Dar es Salaam. She keeps both Broilers and Layers at her poultry cages unit. She has seven hundred Layers and three hundred Broilers. Layers always takes five to six months to get the first lay out while Broilers takes only three months. She collects twenty trays of eggs per day and selling to retail and whole sales customers. She has been in the business for five years. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost up the busines

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Pir

texts.ru: При Тошбоев проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена у себя дома занимается пашивкой одежды. Сам же Пир более 6 лет занимается перевозками пассажиров, т.е. предоставлением услуги такси. До этого он более 15 лет работал "учителем", по специальности. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Pir T. lives in the Yavan region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife sews clothing at home. Pir himself has been transporting passengers as a taxi driver for more than six years. Before that he has worked as a teacher for more than fifteen years. He is asking for a loan to repair his auto.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair auto

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline G. is from the village of Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 43 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture selling beauty products from AVON Cosmetics. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to access their programs and services. Currently, she's requesting her 1st loan in the amount of 3,000 P which will be used for purchasing beauty products from AVON Cosmetics.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for purchasing beauty products from AVON

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina S. is from the town of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 44 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Magdalina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. She harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for years.

Magdalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores P. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, is married, and has two school-aged and four adult children. Dolores owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Dolores joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
El señor Ariel P. C. tiene 28 años y vive en la zona de Maica Chica en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Ariel recién se caso hace solo unos meses y viven en casa de su madre, puesto que aun no tienen  dinero para una casa propia. En esta casa es donde tiene 4 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama cuando el cumplió los 18 años.

Ariel se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero mejorado, que es un trabajo que su familia hace desde hace muchas generaciones. Gracias al buen manejo del ganado la pequeña granja que tiene es conocida en la zona por la buena calidad de la leche que produce. Ahora que tiene el apoyo de su esposa Ariel asiste a un instituto en las noches para aprender mecánica automotriz y así poder algún día abrir un taller mecánico.  

El crédito será utilizado para construir corrales para alojar ganado. Esta es la época donde empiezan las lluvias en la ciudad de Cochabamba y es un problema para las vacas cuando no tienen refugio, por esa razón es que Ariel quiere construir los Corrales para que sus vacas no sufran las tempestades de la lluvia. Al tener un refugio las vacas no tendrán problemas de ninguna índole y por ende no bajaran su producción de leche, entonces los ingresos de Ariel no disminuirán. El mayor sueño de Ariel es hacer crecer su granja lechera y abrir una mecánica automotriz que es un hobby que a él le gusta mucho.
texts.en:
Ariel P. C. is 28. He lives in the Maica Chica area south of the city of Cochabamba. Ariel got married a few months ago. They live in his mother’s house because they do not have enough money for their own house. At this house he has the four dairy cows that were an inheritance his mother gave him when he turned 18. Ariel raises dairy cows. It is work that has been in his family for many generations. Thanks to good cattle management, their small farm is well known in the area for the good quality of milk it produces. Now that he has help from his wife, Ariel goes to an institution in the evenings to learn auto mechanics. That way he will one day be able to open a mechanic’s shop. The loan is to build corrals to house the cattle. This is the season when the rains start in the city of Cochabamba. It is a problem for the cows when they do not have refuge. That is why Ariel wants to build the corrals, so that the cows do not suffer from the rain storms. By having a refuge, the cows will not have any problems. Therefore, milk production will not decrease. Ariel’s dream is to make his dairy farm grow and to open an auto mechanic shop, which is a hobby that he really likes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build corrals to house livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda Barnidas is a 65-year-old mother of eight children whose ages range from 23 to 44 years-old. Through her hard work and determination in running a business to help her husband support the education of their children until they graduated from college, all the children are now professionals. However, Erlinda is not free of her financial obligations to her children because they have their own families to take care of. Therefore, she joined Kiva partner ASHI to have access to credit which she will use to grow a business which she has been nurturing for a long time. With the help of her farmer husband, Erlinda plans to purchase additional cattle which she will raise with her existing cattle in her selling and breeding business. Through ASHI she is requesting a loan and Erlinda has the courage to invest the loan in her business because she has much experience in this field. She knows that once the cattle are sold, profits can as much as double from the initial investment. She negotiates, supported by her husband, with potential buyers in different municipalities during market days. On these days, people from different municipalities also come to buy other commodities being sold.

Erlinda’s intention of making her business successful is not only for herself but for her grandchildren as well. She wants to make her grandchildren happy by supporting their financial needs if their parents have problems to do so.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es: El señor Juan Israel A. es propietario de su pulpería que tiene desde hace tres años y que la ha logrado mantener gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos por mejorarla. Él se ha destacado por ser una persona muy esforzada y trabajadora y ha sabido llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de los productos para la pulpería como las gaseosas, comestibles, algunos medicamentos y otros productos para ofrecerlos en su pulpería en el mercado Mayoreo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Israel A. owns a general store that he has managed for the past three years. He has invested a great amount of effort to maintain and improve it. Juan is known for being a strong, hardworking person who supports his household. The loan he is requesting will be used to acquire products for his store such as sodas, food, medicines, and other items. His store is located at the wholesale market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en:
Allahyar A. is a 47-year-old man who sells different kinds of men and women clothes as well as hair colors and some perfumes. He has been in business for the past nine years. He rents a place next to a woman's beauty salon, so a lot of women customers come to buy something before they go to the salon. This clever move makes Allhyar a successful entrepreneur and helps to cover his family's needs. 

Allhyar's dream is to build his own store one day and, as a first step to approach his dream, he has applied for a 1600 AZN loan. Let’s do our best to help this hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes and expand his business

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: Née en 1966, A. Pierrette vit depuis 19 ans environs à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à FATON Bienvenu, un revendeur de graviers, Pierrette est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Pierrette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Pierrette n'a pas été à l'école. C'est depuis 15 ans que Pierrette vend de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs), dans son quartier. Pierrette vend également de façon secondaire, des poissons frits à PK10. Pierrette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Pobè dans le département du Plateau. Pierrette a déjà obtenu plusieurs crédits à ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Pierrette sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé, en vue d'augmenter son capital et d'élever le niveau de son activité. Ainsi, Pierrette pourra mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et se faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Pierrette A. has lived in the PK10 neighborhood of the Sèmè-Podji area of Bénin for 19 years. She is married to Faton Bienvenu, a used gravel salesman, and has four children who are all in school. The couple takes care of the family expenses together. Pierrette has never been to school. For 15 years, she has sold akassa (a local food made of corn starch) in her neighborhood. As a supplement, she also sells fried fish in PK10. Pierrette stocks up on supplies at Dantokpa, an international market in Bénin and in Pobè, in the province of Plateau. Pierrette has already repaid several loans from Alidé and requests another loan to increase her working capital and to improve the level of her activities. In this way, she will be able to better respond to the demands of her customers and to increase profits.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia (vol), Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 kg of maize

loans.name: Mujeres Necesitadas 1 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is a thirty-two-year-old borrower who lives in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Necesitadas (Women in Need), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Altagracia and her husband have five children and live in a simple home in Hato Mayor, a small rural town in the agricultural area in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough; they do not have potable running water, there are frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and the health care is inadequate. Despite these difficulties, Altagracia runs a successful business selling clothing. With this loan, Altagracia plans to purchase new clothing to sell at a small markup to her friends and neighbors.
 
This is Altagracia’s eighth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve life for her family. With her profits, she also hopes to one day build her own home. Altagracia looks forward to sending her children to college someday, an opportunity she did not have as a young adult. This will give her children a step up in society and allow them to pursue any career that they choose.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Altagracia and the Mujeres Necesitadas group!

loans.use: To buy new clothing for resale

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom V., age 51, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling areca palm and betel leaves for old people to chew, earning approximately USD 4.9 in revenue per day. She has been with the business since the year 2000.  Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 2.9 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. V. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to replace her husband's motorbike. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a partner of KIVA.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarios 1,5 Group

texts.en: Carmen plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear, by travelling to the capital to purchase her goods in the main markets and then selling them at a profit in her community. She is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She will use the profit to invest in her future by saving towards her goal of opening her own salon, as well as saving money for the education of her children. Carmen is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Solidarias ("Women in Solidarity"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children. Carmen thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg B. is 31 years-old and the married mother of a six year-old son. She and her family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent) in a rented yard in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, Temuge, attends a local kindergarten. Erdenechimeg earns her living by selling food products with her husband at a local market called Bayanzurh. 

When she began her retail business, her working capital was 500,000 tugrugs (~  360 USD) and now, as a result of hard work, it has increased to 700,000 tugrugs (~ 500 USD) in only three years. However, she still needs to increase her working capital in order to expand her product line and grow her business. Erdenechimeg earns 224,000 tugrug (~  160 USD) monthly from her business and pays for her family's expenses. She is a polite person who has good communication skills. Erdenechimeg would like to purchase her own place to live with her family and provide better living conditions for her only son. She is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~  525 USD) loan to purchase a variety of food products including preserved cucumbers, tea, sugar, rice and mayonnaise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino R. is from the village of Yeban Norte. He is 44 years old. Marcelino is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelino raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Marcelino has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 100,000 Philippine pesos during harvest season. In 2008, Marcelino joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marcelino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
44-year-old Lourdes C. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

Lourdes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Lourdes from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um T., 45, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

T. sells vegetables at a local market for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day.

T. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to become a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a transportation business for one of her children

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en: Cheri Maiya M. is 39 year old and lives in Thecho — one of the under-developed villages of Nepal. Most of the people of this region are poor and work in farming. She lives with her husband and two sons. Mrs. M. and her husband, Dil Bhakta M., both make brass religious statues. They have 16 years of experience. The older son is in grade 9 and the younger son is in grade 8. She seeks RS 30000.00 loan to purchase the raw materials for making brass religious statues. In Nepal the cost of education is very high so she is planning to spend her income on her children's education.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her work

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina does not work herself, but her mother and her brother does. They live in the same house. Her mother is a seamstress by profession, while her brother is a mason but he also knows how to drive. He drives a rented rickshaw part-time to generate extra income.
 
Rubina helps her mother complete the orders of her customers. She sews clothes with her and completes them on time, which helps her mother to receive a reasonable income from her customers and more sewing orders.

Rubina is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her brother. With the loan amount he will buy his own rickshaw and take on this profession full time. This will help him to improve his and his family's financial conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen K. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are  currently in school.  She has had a business for two years, running a small restaurant where she sells cooked food.         

To help expand her business, Hellen is requesting a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more supplies to be used in the restaurant, like cups, plates and saucepans.  The additional supplies will allow her business to serve more customers, and to generate more profit in order to support her family.  In the future, Hellen hopes to educate her children up to university and to start a business raising chickens.


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: to buy supplies like plates, cups, and saucepans

loans.name: Siyama

texts.en: Siyama M. is currently in the business of selling crates of beer, white wine, Heineken, etc. in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Siyama is 41 years old and is married, with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Nyamwegabira Twetugure, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working Ruth N. from Nyamwegabira Twetungure group has been running a retail shop from Nyamwegabira trading centre in Kihihi, where she sells general merchandise. She has been operating this business for over 5 years down the road. The married mother of 7 children confirms that she has had problems in restocking her business as the stock available is not satisfying for the customers' demands.

Therefore, Ruth is seeking a loan to help her buy more goods for the business for resale in the hope that she will earn more income and be in a position to cater for her family's needs, thus improving her standard of living. She belongs to a group of other members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To restock the business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. is married and has a child. She has been through senior high school. Araba sells charcoal and kitchen utensils at Elmina. She has been in this business for five years. Her husband is a driver. Araba uses her income to help her husband provide food, clothing and shelter for the family. Araba will use the loan to purchase extra bags of charcoal and utensils to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to build a store house for her goods.

loans.use: To purchase extra bags of charcoal and utensils to sell

loans.name: Kenia Griselda

texts.es: La  Sra. Kenia Griselda R. C.  ella  se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos ella vende de casa en casa, ella tiene doce  años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ampliarlo en mercadería,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su negocio y su   condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Kenia Griselda R. C. sells new clothing and cosmetics from house to house and has been working in this business for twelve years. She is currently married and has a school-age son.

She has had eleven loans through CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase products for her business and increase her merchandise. The CEPRODEL loans have benefited her greatly because she has improved her business and her and her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To purchase clothing (pants, blouses, bras).

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou C., age 51, is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilou has a specialized store from which she sells her wares, primarily rice. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have four school-aged children and live in the village of Pagbangkeruan, Alcala, Cagayan.
    
Earlier this year, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting her first loan in the amount of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell from her store

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg P. is 52 years old. She is a widow who lives with her 20-year-old daughter in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter attends a college while Altantsetseg operates a ger-bracing supply production business. She produces ropes, belts, and straps used in ger construction. She started her business in 1973 and has gained much experience as a maker of these products over the years. In the future, she is planning to expand her business into an industrial level by having her own workplace and hiring more employees in order to export her products to the Kazakhstan. Over the many years of owning this business, she has built a stable and successful operation and her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family.  Altantsetseg is a kind, gentle and hardworking person. She is a diligent worker and hopes to continue to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase horse manes and tails and machinery that can reduce manual work in order to produce ropes and straps.

loans.use: To purchase horse manes and tails

loans.name: Protenziana

texts.en:
Protenziana S. is a married lady with five children aged between thirteen and two years old. Her business is located at Kakamega town. She sells fish to the local people. Besides this business, she sells cereals, which include beans, peas, rice, etc. She has been in business for one year now, and has managed to give employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is the lack of capital. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more fish and cereals to expand her businesses. In future, she hopes to develop her businesses and even diversify to photocopying and printing. She describes herself as focused, determined and courageous.

loans.use: To buy fish, maize and beans.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en: Nizar is 30 years old and lives in Saida - South, Lebanon.  He is married with two sons, who are 2 years old and 1 month old.  He works as a general builder, a trade in which he has15 years of experience.  He is requesting a loan of $1500 to buy tools and a quantity of wood.  He enjoys his work, likes being self-employed, and is excited to expand his business. In the future, he wants to invest in more tools for his workshop.  Nizar had a previous loan that he found very beneficial, as it improved his financial situation.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa N. lives in the Mengo MacKay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (house girl).    Hasifa has a business of a restaurant.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Hasifa has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cooking oil, rice, beef, chicken, sweet and Irish potatoes.  

The main business challenges for Hasifa include thieves and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to start an outside catering department.   

Hasifa lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more food for restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children.  She is from Lebanon. She sells a wide range of goods from her home to customers in her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works as a security man in a local cinema. Her goods are enjoyed by members of her community. She sells different Lebanese food and products. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory for the winter months since her business sales increase during this period. She believes that her business would fare be better if she were to sell her goods in a different part of Lebanon. In the future, she would like to rent out a space to sell her merchandise, as well as sell popular homemade food products. For the time being, she will continue to sell goods from her home.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Anita Antonia

texts.es:
Anita es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Pacasmayo y que se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Anita se dedica a trabajar vendiendo frutas y verduras en un puesto ambulante situado en uno de los centros de abasto más concurridos de su localidad. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversas verduras frescas y frutas de estación atendiéndolos siempre con un trato amable y servicial. Su negocio cuenta actualmente con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su establecimiento para agenciarse de los productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y progresar.

Anita desea surtir su negocio adquiriendo más verduras y frutas de estación de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, así también desea  aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan progresar. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Anita is a 49 year old mother.  She lives with her family in the San Pedro de Lloc district.  It is an agricultural zone in the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region.  It is over two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Anita works selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor at one of the busiest markets in the area.  She offers her customers different fresh vegetables and seasonal fruit.  She always gives her customers kind and helpful service.  Her business now has a group of loyal customers who always return to her establishment to get the products that she sells.  

The income that she gets from this business activity is used to help her family get ahead and progress.  

Anita wishes to stock her business by getting more vegetables and seasonal fruit.  That way she will be able to meet the demand that she currently has.  Also, she wishes to increase her sales and get greater income, which will allow her to make progress.  In order to achieve her objective, she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles.

loans.use: To get more vegetables and seasonal fruit

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over ten years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her customers are neighbors and passersby. Jamila faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand, and to open another restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase furniture and fittings to expand her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu because of its low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and fittings to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Monica Owino

texts.en:
Monica Owino is 46 years old and a modest lady from the County of Migori, a town along the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. Monica is widowed and takes care of six children single handedly.

Monica operates a clothes-selling business in Migori town where she stocks new clothing only. She has run her business for the last 24 years and has been very successful. She makes a monthly income of 94,000 KES. Monica joined KADET LTD a long time ago and is requesting her sixth loan, which she will use to buy new clothing to sell. 

Monica is optimistic that she will reap good profits with her new stock. She will put her profit back into her business well as use some funds to support her family. Being a single mother, her hope and dream is to help her daughter open a retail shop to increase the family income.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Isaac, who is 42 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 5 and 21 years old. Marjorie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marjorie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements. Marjorie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 32-year-old hardworking man living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For three years he has been in the retail trade, and the money generated has enabled him to take care of his parents. He faces the challenge of having limited funds to meet the demands of his customers and he longs to become a wholesale trader. Kenneth needs this loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es: La Sra. Elodia  es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y sencilla, que se ha distinguido entre sus amistades, porque desde hace 15 años, ella se ha dedicado a la venta de ricos tamales  los  cuales los vende  en las diferentes maquiladoras y  ya  cuenta  con sus clientes que  le  realizan pedidos  por semana , ella al igual que su esposo con su esfuerzo y perseverancia  han  acondicionado su hogar además  de  sacar adelante  a sus hijos, en  esta  ocasión  requieren  el  crédito para  invertir  en su negocio y  de  esta manera  obtener   mayores  ingresos los cuales  les  permitirá continuar  con el acondicionamiento de  su  hogar  y  podrán  a  su vez  instalar  un portón en su  domicilio para  de  esta  manera  tener  mayor  seguridad y  privacidad  en su  domicilio.
texts.en:
Sra. Elodia is a simple, honest, and hardworking woman who has distinguished herself among her friends because she has been selling delicious tamales for fifteen years. Her tamales are sold at different factories where she has customers who place orders each week. Just like her husband, Elodia has worked hard and with perseverance to provide a suitable home to raise her children.

On this occasion, she needs a loan to invest in her business so that she can generate more income. This will allow her to continue remodeling her home as well as install a gate to provide greater security and privacy.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her tamale business.

loans.name: Hea's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mr. Hea is the village bank president. He was selected as the village bank president by the others members.
Mr. Hea, who was born in 1975, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Pril, is a farming laborer. The couple has three children: two stay at home and the other is a student. Currently, Mr. Hea wants to buy some home appliances, but he doesn’t have enough money to do so. Therefore, he would like to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to purchase home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances

loans.name: Omar Roman

texts.es:
Omar es un hombre trabajador, con su propio negocio, en su casa de habitación, una pulpería que logro poner hace nueve años, el cual trabaja junto a su esposa.
Y que  junto  han logrado el bienestar para sus cinco hijos mediante la educación. Con el crédito anterior desvió el crédito, y lo invirtió en la pulpería, ya que las ventas estaban bajas y logro aumentar el inventario para mejorar sus ventas y equilibrar sus gastos.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo podrá mejorar el techo de su vivienda el cual espera terminar esta mejora, ya que las reglas están en mal estado, a si como el zinc. Contento por poder optar al financiamiento el cual es de gran beneficio a pagar en plazos.
texts.en:
Omar is a hard-working man with his own business - a grocery store - which is located in his home.  He set up his business nine years ago and runs it together with his wife.

Together, Omar and his wife have managed to look out for their five children's well-being, providing them with an education.  Omar invested his previous loan in his grocery store since his sales were low.  He managed to increase his inventory, improve his sales and balance his expenses.

Omar will use this new loan to improve the roof in his home.  He hopes to finish off this improvement since the beams and metal sheeting are in a bad state of repair.  He is happy to receive this loan.  It is a great help to him to be able to pay in instalments.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and wood to replace his roof

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José tiene 37 años, él es casado y tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica es la de brindar el servicio de barbería. Juan trabaja todos los días desde hace mas de 7 años, cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona en la que vive. El ha proporcionado a su familia los ingresos necesarios para comer todos los días. Juan está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de espuma, navajas, cepillos, peines, máquina para afeitar. Juan es un cliente que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de las personas que lo conocen. El anhelo de él es de poder brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia día a día.
texts.en: Juan José is 37 years old. He is married and has two children.  His work is that of a barber.  Juan has worked every day for more than 7 years.  He has an already established clientele in the area where he lives.  He has provided his family with the income necessary in order to eat every day.  Juan is seeking a loan to buy shaving cream, blades, combs, brushes and an electric razor. Juan is a client with very good references among the people who know him.  He craves to be able to offer his family a better standard of living day after day.

loans.use: to buy shaving cream, blades, combs, brushes and an electric razor.

loans.name: Cindy Jhanetly

texts.es:
Cindy  es una joven trabajadora de 22 años de edad con muchos deseos de superación pues es madre de un bebé de 9 meses al cual le desea dar todas las comodidades que pueda. Ella vive con su hijo y su novio, quien es albañil, en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope – Lambayeque. La comunidad donde Cindy vive es una zona urbana en vías de desarrollo que cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica y agua potable.
