La actividad que realiza Cindy es la venta de golosinas y bebidas en un pequeño puesto que ha ubicado en la puerta de su domicilio. Ella vende principalmente bebidas gaseosas, néctares, bebidas hidratantes, entre otros.

Con el préstamo que Cindy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa ella podrá surtir su puesto con productos de higiene, útiles, y otros abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y aceite. De esta manera Cindy podrá ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades de sus clientes y así crecerá en su actividad. 

El préstamo solicitado es de 1000 nuevos soles. Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele pues le ayudaría a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en especial  la de su bebé.
texts.en:
Cindy is a hard-working, 21 year-old woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  She is the mother of a 9 month-old baby who she would like to provide with all the comforts that she can.  She lives with her son and her boyfriend, who is a construction worker, in their home which is located in Mórrope district - Lambayeque.  Cindy lives in a community which is located in a developing urban area which benefits from electricity and piped water.  

Cindy's business activity is selling candies and drinks from a small stall that she has set up by her front door.  She mainly sells sodas, nectars, sports drinks, etc.

Cindy will use the loan that she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa to stock her stall with hygiene products, essentials and groceries such as rice, sugar and oil.  In this way, Cindy will be able to offer a greater variety of products that will satisfy the needs of her customers.  This will enable her to grow in her business.

Cindy has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles.  She is very grateful for her loan since it will help her to improve her family's quality of life, especially that of her baby.

loans.use: to buy new products for her business

loans.name: Mariposas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Mariposas Emprendedoras" este nombre fue elegido porque igual que las mariposas les gusta buscar nuevos horizontes. Está ubicado en el estado D. México, esta comunidad se caracteriza  por mantener sus raíces D. L. lengua y vestimenta Mazahua, L. mayoría D. los habitantes se dedican a L. venta D. verduras que en su mayoría los cultivan. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es L. novena vez que solicitan un prestamo ya que estos apoyos les han servido mucho en sus ventas, producción y han logrado hacer crecer su negocio. Una D. las integrantes del grupo se llama  Elizabeth, elL. tiene 27 años, estudió hasta secundaria,  es ama D. casa y a su vez comerciante, comenta que su negocio es parte fundamental para salir adelante con los gastos que se presentan diariamente, elL. tiene 2 hijos D. 8 y 1 año. Elizabeth  se dedica a L. venta D. verduras que elL. misma cultiva según sea L. temporada como lo son, chicharo, frijol, ejote, las calabazas y flor D. L. misma, para elL. L. oportunidad D. obtener un prestamo es D. gran ayuda ya que pueD. invertir con mayor facilidad para el cultivo D. su verdura. su dedicación en su negocio ha permitido que tenga una mejor estabilidad familiar y económica, con el prestamo va a comprar semillas y abonos que necesita para sus cultivos. Sueña que algún día pueda incrementar sus cultivos  para contribuir a que sus hijos tengan una mayor educación y tengan una profesión.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mariposas Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Butterflies).  The name was chosen because just like butterflies they like to seek new horizons.  It is located in the State of México.  The community is noted for maintaining their Mazahua linguistic roots and traditional costumes.  Most of the residents sell vegetables which they farm themselves for the most part.  The group has 11 members and this is the ninth time they’ve requested a loan since they have been helpful in their sales, production and they have helped their business grow.

One of the members is Elizabeth, 27.  She completed secondary school.  She’s a housewife but a merchant at the same time.  She comments that the business is vital to be able to meet household expenses that crop up daily.  She has two children who are 8 and 1 years old.  

Elizabeth sells vegetables that she herself grows according to the season such as: peas, beans, string-beans, squash and squash blossoms.  For her, the opportunity to get a loan is of great help because she can invest more easily in her vegetable crops.

Her dedication to work has maD. it possible for her to have improved family and economic stability.  She will use the loan to buy seed and manure that she needs for her crops.  She dreams with one day being able to increase her crop yields in order to proviD. better education for her children so that they will have professions.

loans.use: to buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 26 year old married mother of one child. Luvuno sells clothes and tailoring materials in Shanzu, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the past three years.
 
Luvuno has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing cycle to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase bales of Lesos (colourful Kenyan cloths). The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family. Her future dream is to own her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Lesos to sell.

loans.name: Severiano Jose

texts.es: Severiano de 42 años, habita en Chacaraseca una pequeña comunidad ubicada en León, es padre de tres hijos, el es agricultor, con estudios básicos solo termino el cuarto grado de primaria. Empezó a los 27 años de edad, su primer negocio fue la agricultura, sembrando ajonjolí, maíz y yuca el conto con  la ayuda de un tío quien le dio herramientas necesarias para cultivar, después el continuo solo por su cuenta, y cembro  yuca así fue surgiendo poco a poco. También se dedica a la ganadería como otro ingreso que el posee. Requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abono para sembrar yuca (vegetal). Con esta inversión piensa sacar una producción de calidad. Su meta próxima es sembrar 2 manzanas de  hortalizas tales como ayote, pepino.
texts.en:
Severiano is 42 years old and lives in Chacaraseca, a small community in León.  He has three children and works as a farmer.  He received a basic education.  He only finished his fourth year of elementary school.

Severiano started out at 27 years of age.  His first business was farming, growing sesame, corn and cassava.  He had the help of an uncle who gave him the tools he needed to farm.  He then continued working on his own, growing cassava, gradually making progress.

Severiano also raises livestock and this makes him additional income.  He needs this loan to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for growing cassava (vegetable).  With this investment, he plans to obtain a good-quality production.  His next goal is to sow two 'manzanas' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of land with vegetables such as squash and cucumber.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for growing cassava

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Rowena has a purified drinking water sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more plastic containers for her purified drinking water business.
Rowena has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic containers.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur.  She is a widow with no children.

For the past seven years, she has sold foodstuffs. This business has enabled her to improve the standards of living for her family.

She requires this loan to purchase more cassava that she will sell at her place of business.  She plans to save the future profits from her business so she can continue to provide for her family in the long term.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
S., who is in his early 50s, is married and has one child who is going to school.  He has been running a small fruit and vegetable farm for five years now.  He works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy an irrigation machine and expanded his small farm and pay his house expenses.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a new loan to expand his small farm further and plant more vegetables to sell. His dream is to one day be able to buy a big irrigation machine and to send his child to good schools.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tunaweza", which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand his small farm and plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a residence of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer and she runs a retail store to earn extra income. It started operating four years ago and continues to exist. The store offers basic need items and other sorts of necessities. From it, she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

As a GDMPC member, Marcelina has enjoyed the privileges granted by the organization to its qualified members. The cooperative allowed her to borrow 5,000 PHP which she will use to purchase rice and corn grits to sell in the community. She hopes that this investment will make sense and help improve her business operations. The revenue will be used to buy fertilizers for the farm cultivated by her spouse and to buy more stock for the store.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 65 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia con unos familiares, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Julio es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra plantas de plátano, con una experiencia de 4 años, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive y a otros sitios también, así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y necesidades personales. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicamente.  Julio es una persona que se preocupa porque sus tierras cada vez sean más productivas para poder brindarle más comodidades a las personas con las que vive.
texts.en:
Julio, 65, is single and lives with some family members in his own home, which only has electricity, in the district of La Matanza in the department of Piura.  The area is known for agriculture and cattle.

Julio works in agriculture.  He has his own land where he has grown banana plants for four years.  Once he harvests his crop, he offers it at various markets in the area where he lives as well as in other places so he can get earnings to cover his expenses and personal needs.

He has requested a loan of 2500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his crop, with the goal of offering it at a better price to the merchants and so have higher bids.  Julio is a person who is concerned about always increasing the productivity of his land so he can provide more comforts to the people with whom he lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his crop.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group.  She is 30 and, together with her husband who is a farmer, she raises two sons both of whom study at school. Six years ago with an initial investment of 4000 soms the family started to breed cattle and then resell it at the higher price after being fattened. In this way the family earns about 6000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the trade Nazira meets the family needs. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future Nazira wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena ya ha tenido crédito con KIVA el cual ha sido para invertir en su negocio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar más mercancía de ropa para niño, bebes, dama y juguetes nuevos. Ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario y no quiere descapitalizar al negocio. 
Doña Rosa Elena es viuda y sus hijos ya están casados, este ingreso es el que tiene para salir adelante. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que sus hijos le ayudaron a pagar sus gastos personales. 
Espera contar con su cooperación en este préstamo ya que es muy importante invertir, antes de que llegue la navidad.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena has already had loans with Kiva, that she has used to invest in her business.

She is applying for another loan to buy more merchandise, such as children's, women's and baby's clothing, as well as new toys.  This is because she  doesn't have the necessary working capital, and doesn't want to take capital out of the business. 

Rosa Elena is a widow, and her children are already married. This income is what helps her move forward. With the earnings she gets from her business, she plans to pay off the loan, since her children have helped her pay for her personal expenses. 

She hopes to have your cooperation in this loan, since it is important for her to buy merchandise before Christmas arrives.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing and toys, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Elaine; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de moto, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya no se dedica al negocio de tejido de chompas porque el negocio de venta de repestos de moto es mas rentable, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de moto . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de moto al por mayor.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elaine is 36, married and has three children.  Along with her daily activities, she sells motorcycle spare parts. She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. 

She no longer has the sweater knitting business, because the motorcycle spare parts business is more profitable. She wants to expand the motorcycle spare parts business. She is applying for the loan in order to buy motorcycle spare parts at wholesale.

She is happy about getting the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is a member of this group. She is 31 and resides in Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She works with a public fund, and her parents are engaged in cattle breeding. At the moment Aigul needs additional funds to pay the tuition at her university, and is applying for a loan for this purpose. In the future she hopes to graduate from university, and dreams of then becoming a lawyer.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society); Planet (remaining environmentally friendly); and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay the tuition at her university.

loans.name: Sindy Judith

texts.es:
Sindy es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 23 años, es madre de 1 hija, desde hace 1 año y medio es socia de FINCA Peru.
Sindy vende carne en el mercado, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió en su Banco Comunal aprendió ahorrar, tambien a dirigir su negocio como mujer, a ser responsable y puntual, le gusta las capacitaciones porque aprende mucho sobre temas de endeudamiento y cuidados de la mujer. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carne.
Su meta es tener una tienda mayorista de venta de carne y repartir a los mercados.
texts.en:
Sindy is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity). She is 23 years old and the mother of one daughter. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 1½ years.

Sindy sells meat at the market. Thanks to the training she received from her Communal Bank, she has learned how to save. She knows how to direct her business as a woman, as well as be responsible and punctual. Sindy enjoys the training classes because she has learned a great deal about indebtedness and women’s issues. The loan she is requesting will invested in the purchase of meat.

Her goal is to have a wholesale shop where she can sell meat and make deliveries to the markets.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luz Marina tiene 32 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Luz Marina se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, ella vende de lunes a sábado de 8 a de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Ya dos años que se dedica a los negocios y le va muy bien. Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para comprar utensilios como por ejemplo ollas, cubiertos y otras cosas más.  

Luz Marina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of Asociación Arariwa's 'Las Palmeras' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco.  She is 32 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage.  She lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business activities.

Luz Marina sells food as an itinerant vendor.  She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She has been in her business for two years and it is doing well.  Luz Marina needs a loan to buy utensils such as pots and cutlery, and other items.

Luz Marina is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy utensils such as pots and cutlery

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 26-year-old single man with no children. He runs a cyber café business in Miritini, Mombasa and the business has been in operation for two years. The business is doing well and he has been able to serve many people.

This marks John’s first borrowing from KADET to finance his business and with the money he plans to purchase more computers for his café in oder to meet and satisfy the demands of his increasing clients. 


With the anticipated profits John hopes to be able to repay back his KADET loan and to expand his business even further. In the future, he hopes to open a new cyber café and to expand and offer other internet services to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase more computers for his cyber café

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es: Dina Luz, es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 13 años y vive en el municipio de las Butifarras, o embutidos típicos artesanales de Soledad, pueblo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía en miscelánea, negocio que inició desde hace mas de 10 años cuando trabajaba de mercaderista, ahorró las comisiones y de su salario, para lograr hacer pequeñas inversiones, que hoy son muy importantes para apoyar junto a su esposo el bienestar de su familia. Al principio solo contaba con dos vitrinas y un surtido de cosméticos, pero gradualmente fue agregando papelería, accesorios femeninos y actualmente tiene 5 vitrinas y vende además de estas mercancías, ropa plásticos, desechables, en la esquina de su casa de orden familiar.  Su meta es lograr el mejoramiento de su local, para tener un ambiente más confortable para sí misma y para sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es enfrentar diariamente la competencia de tres misceláneas que se encuentran a su alrededor, pero su experiencia es la que hace que sus clientes tengan preferencia en los productos que Dina Luz vende  y que ellos sean leales a su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cosméticos, juguetes, ropa y calzado, para surtir con un nuevo capital su negocio y responder con mercancías encargadas a sus clientes que día a día se multiplican, especialmente en la´temporada mas comercial del año y las mas hermosa para las familias. Navidad y Año Nuevo.
texts.en:
Dina Luz is a married woman with two children, who are one and thirteen.  They live in the land of butifarras, the typical artisan sausages of Soledad, fifteen minutes from the city of Barranquilla, where she earns her living as a vendor.  She started her business ten years ago while working as a sales rep.  She saved her salary and commissions so she could make small investments, which now provide very significant support to her and her husband in looking after their family.

At first she had only two display cases and a stock of cosmetics, but she gradually added stationery and women's accessories.  Now she has five displays and sells clothing, plastic goods, and disposables as well from a corner of her family's house.  Her goal is to improve her locale to create a more comfortable environment for herself and her customers.  Her greatest daily challenge is competition from three grocery stores in her area, but her customers prefer her experience and are loyal to her shop.

Dina Luz is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll use her new capital to stock up on cosmetics, toys, clothing, and shoes so she can fill orders from a clientele that is expanding by the day, especially during the biggest sales season of the year, as well as the most beautiful for families, with Christmas and New Year's.

loans.use: to stock up on cosmetics, toys, clothing, and shoes with her new capital.

loans.name: Elizabeth María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elizabeth, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 17 y 4 años de edad, los tres estudian en Universidad, colegio y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a  confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares.  También se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar (ventiladores, planchas, colchones, sabanas, entre otras cosas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 en sus dos ocupaciones, para vender sus productos ella sale a recorrer tres días a la semana y  también vende en su casa donde tiene su taller de costura, lleva más de 10 años con su taller y un poco menos dedicada al comercio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va invertir en ventiladores, colchones y planchas para la venta y telas y otros materiales para la costura. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de recibir ayuda a través de los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Proyecto 2003” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jaramijo (Manta) Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of the residents here are very hardworking and engaged in tasks related to the sea.

We met Elizabeth, 41, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 19, 17 and 4 years old.  The three attend University, secondary school and Kindergarten.  Her husband’s a driver.

She has a small sewing workshop where she’s been making all types of clothing on order for private customers for several years now.  She’s also a merchant.  She sells items for the home (fans, irons, mattresses and sheets, among other things).  She works every day from 6am until 10pm in her two occupations.  To sell her products she goes out three days a week and also sells from home which is where she has her sewing shop.  She’s had the shop for over ten years and has been in commerce for a little less than that time.

She will use this new loan to buy fans, mattresses and irons to sell and to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the opportunity to receive help through the loans.

Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a store downtown where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fans, mattresses, irons, fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru: Турсуной 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она уже три года как занимается торговлей. Целью получения кредита является покупка конфет и шоколада.
texts.en: Tursunoy is 32 years old, and married. She has three children. She has been involved in the retail business for three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets and chocolate.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and chocolate

loans.name: Dulcenia

texts.en:
Dulcenia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 
Dulcenia has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts & bananas for sale.
Dulcenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dulcenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas for sale

loans.name: Glenrose

texts.en:
Glenrose is married with four children. Glenrose is 32 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Glenrose makes her living from a general store she has had for a year. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Glenrose has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Glenrose hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Progress-Iii Group

texts.en:
Yarie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone thirty-eight years ago. She is married and has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. For ten years now, Yarie has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and gari (food made out of cassava roots). 

This is the first loan that Yarie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Yarie will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business. She will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and gari in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Luis Giomar

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial,  el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Luis pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Verde para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como ayudante de construcción, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente  a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y mejoramiento de las ventanas de su vivienda, ya que las que tiene actualmente son de madera y fáciles de vulnerar, de esta manera Luis podrá tener mayor seguridad y bienestar en su hogar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa constructora y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve himself. Thanks to his own efforts and the support of his parents, Luis was able to study for a degree in computing. In his free time, he likes to play football, and from time to time he makes delicious "Green Rice" [rice in a green vegetable sauce] to share with his family.

Through his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work, Luis started working as a construction assistant. He works every day from early in the morning for around eight hours. He enjoys his job and he believes that it is going well because he works hard and treats his customers well. 

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can repair the windows of his house. Currently his window frames are made of wood and are easily broken. By replacing them, he will make his house more secure and that will give him peace of mind. He will continue working and doing his best to achieve his dream of having his own construction business and being successful.

loans.use: to replace the windows in his house.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: JUAN RAMON: Es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad con deseos de superación. Originario del empalme de Columbus, que se localiza aproximadamente a 85 kilómetros de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casado, tiene un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Desde su infancia se dedica a labores agropecuarias ayudándole a sus padres. Solicita financiamiento, para ir creando poco a poco su patrimonio y sacar adelante a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara cerdos lechones y vacas para su engorde y comercialización. Sueña con sembrar granos básicos.

loans.use: para comprar cerdos lechones y vacas para su engorde y comercialización

loans.name: Angel Osiris

texts.en:
Mr. Benavides has 3 years making toy packages for children. He buy the toys in large quantities and sticks the toys in a carton panel and sells in grocery stores. \"I initiated this business because there are some children that the parents don’t have the opportunitie to buy expensive toys, and I sell cheaper ones , in addition this is a game system surprise. This method is new and it pleases much to them to the children. Now that approaches the end of the year, I need to provide many orders but I dont have enough merchandise, reason why I need a credit 1.500 dollars to buy toys and to provide all the orders that have done to me. This will increase my business and will allow that many children have a toy for christmas.\" I will repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

El Sr. Benavides tiene tres años dedicándose a la fabricación de paquetes de juguetes para niños. Compra por mayoreo y pega los juguetes empaquetados en exhibidores de cartón, y los vende en la tiendas de abarrotes. “Inicié este negocio porque se que hay niños a los cuales sus padres no les pueden comprar juguetes caros, y los juguetes que yo vendo son muy económicos, además que los niños los compran mediante un sistema de juego sorpresa. Este método es nuevo y les agrada mucho a los niños. Ahora que se acerca el fin de año necesito surtir muchos pedidos pero no cuento con suficiente mercancías, por lo que necesito un crédito de 1,500 dólares para comprar juguetes y surtir todos los pedidos que me han hecho. Esto aumentará mi negocio y permitirá que muchos niños tengan un juguete este fin de año.” Pienso pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy cheap toys and games for kids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hairdressing equipment and renovate and expand her hair salon.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has a farm where he grows rice and raises cattle. He lives with his wife, his grandparents and his children. He has two kids, a 16-year-old son and an infant daughter. His son helps him on the farm while also going to school. He wants to use the loan to prepare his lands for the upcoming planting season. In the future, he wants to improve his home by making it out of cement, as it is currently out of wood and is not in the best condition.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserves for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to sell them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances, they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Prepare his lands for rice farming

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Titi is a housewife with three children who has been married for 26 years. Her family could not afford to give her more than a primary-school education, but Titi is an ambitious person who joined various groups in her area that are committed to empowering women. Her membership in these groups inspired her to open a shop where she sells cold drinks to both retail and wholesale customers.

This business is doing well, and Titi would like to thank all of the lenders who made her first Kiva loan possible, because this support allowed her to increase her stock of sodas, juices and beers to sell, and start construction of a hair salon that she plans to open as soon as construction is complete.

Titi is excited about this new business, which she believes will do well because it is in a good location in a new neighborhood with no competing salons and lots of potential customers. Titi has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to equip her salon with hairdryers and curlers, a fan, hairdressing materials and other items.

loans.use: To buy driers, hairdressing materials and other items for a new salon

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is married and has two children; they have been the reason why she decided two years ago to begin selling jewelry. Her husband is a carpenter and works on commission and they do not have a secure salary. After seeing their needs, Armandina began her own business so that she would be able to care for their children. Little by little she has increased her number of clients and orders.

In order to offer better service, Armandina is requesting a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise, so she will be able to fill the orders that she has. She promises to repay this amount in three months. Be an important part in the development of this business and in the life of Armandina and her family. Many thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Armandina es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual decidió empezar a vender joyería hace dos años, su esposo es carpintero y trabaja por su cuenta, por lo que no tiene un salario seguro y al ver las necesidades por las que pasaban Armandina inició su propio negocio ya que éste le permitiría estar al cuidado de sus pequeños, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su número de clientes y pedidos.

Para poder ofrecer un buen servicio Armandina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, para surtir todos los pedidos que tiene, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Aremandina y su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Jewelry merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
My house is small and I would like to build a room in the back so as to provide more space for my children. Generally those homes that receive a social interest are quite small and we are a family of four. I ask for $500 dollars in order to build another room onto my home.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi casa es muy pequeña y me gustaría construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás y asi darles más espacio a mis hijos, generalmente las casas de interés social son muy chicas y nosotros somos 4 de familia”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para constuir un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Zuhro has an extensive experience in sewing europian style clothes. It is known that more than a decade ago, after separation from Soviet Union, sewing factories in Tajikistan were not able to provide for their employees because of the outdated equipment. Every factory had to deal with difficulties such as absence of demand and distribution channels, lack of necessary materials and others on its own. The credit provided by MicroInvest will provide substantial help to Zuhro in development of her work in this difficult environment.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Зухро имеет долгий опыт работы по шитью европейской одежды. Известно, что несколько лет назад швейные цеха не смогли обеспечить своих работников, доставшихся в наследство от Советского Союза, технически морально устаревшие цеха. Каждое из этих цехов самостоятельно преодолевало трудности проблемы переходного периода, такие как, отсутствие рынка сбыта, трудности с сырьем и материалами и др. Кредит, получивший с Микроинвест, оказал значительную помощь в продвижении ее работы.

loans.use: Additional fabrics

loans.name: Delila

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 30-year-old Delila M.. She is single with no children. In 2007 Delila established a livestock business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requests a loan of $525 in order to purchase additional chickens.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku! "Who or what are kuku?" you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. 

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Pastora Carmen

texts.es:
Since she was very young, Pastora M. has been an excellent worker. She started working at a young age as a cleaning lady in a home of the city of Chinandega. Later, she met her husband, whom she married. Upon the birth of her children, she decided to invest in a general store, which she still has right now.

The business is located in the market of Santa Ana of Chinandega and Pastora has been keeping it stocked with new products. However, in spite of this, Mrs. Pastora is going through a difficult situation for lack of money to acquire new products. This is the reason for which she wisely approached Ceprodel to benefit herself from loans that will allow her to acquire the products she needs to continue her general store business, and in this way keep contributing to raising her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Pastora M. desde muy pequeña se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora. Su actividad de trabajo comenzó desde muy jovencita como empleada domestica en un hogar de la ciudad de Chinandega. Posteriormente conoció a su esposo con quien contuvo matrimonio y al nacer sus hijos decide invertir en el negocio de pulpería que es el que tiene actualmente.

El negocio se ubica en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega y lo ha venido surtiendo de nuevos productos pero a pesar de esto, la señora Pastora atraviesa una situación difícil como lo es la ausencia de dinero par adquirir sus productos. Por este motivo es que muy sabiamente acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan adquirir sus productos para continuar con el negocio de su pulpería y así seguir contribuyendo con la formación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell (Compra de los productos para su venta)

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 4

texts.en:
Normilia is a 47-year-old woman who lives in a very poor community called Los Guaricanos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She runs a small business of fried foods and breakfast foods. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest money into her business and buy a wider variety of foods to offer her customers in the mornings.

She says her goal is to move her life forward and to live in comfort with a consistent source of income. She would also like to have enough money to afford medicine for her migranes: she often suffers from debilitating headaches, but can’t spare the money to buy medicine to ease the pain.

In her free time she likes to read the Bible, go to her church, and spend time with her family. Normilia is very thankful to everyone who is helping her with his loan—on behalf of her, and our entire team at Esperanza, thank you!

loans.use: Purchase food staples for cooking

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Islom Shomahmadovich A. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 61 years old, married and has 8 children. He has a college education and is an agronomist by profession, but does not work in this field. He is in the animal husbandry business and breeds small cattle. He has five years experience in this field. He buys the cattle on the local market, feeds them for about 40-45 days and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. This business is the only source of income for his large family. Islom wants to buy goats and needs the money so he decided to apply for a loan. At this time small cattle costs less to buy and prices will start to rise in about a month. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Ашуров Ислом Шомахмадович проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 61 год.Женат,имеет 8 детей .Образование высшее,по специальности агроном. По специальности не работает. Занимается разведением мелкого рогатого скота. Имеет опыт в животноводстве 5 лет. Клиент покупает на местном рынке сельхоз.животных ,откармливает их по 40-45 дней и перепродает их на том же рынке,по выгодной ему цене.Животноводство является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи.Клиент хочет купить коз ,для чего нужны средсвта. Поэтому он решил взять кредит .В данное время мелкий рогатый скот можно купить дешевле. Через месяц цены начнут расти. Кредит планирует погасить в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy small cattle

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Despite of her age, Fermina T. (60) keeps working as if she were a young girl. She has four sons who live with her.

Since 2001, Fermina has owned a fashion shop in a market known as “Mercado N4 de la ciudad de Asunción”. Each season, Fermina travels to Brazil to buy new trends of clothes to then sell in her fashion shop. The outfits Fermina sells include: t-shirts, jeans, cardigans, jackets, skirts and dresses.

It is worthy to mention that Fermina is an old client of Fundacion Paraguaya.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of clothes (mentioned above) for this winter-fall season.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru:
Nodira S. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. Since she was young, she has sold goods in the market with her mother. After her marriage, she got a job as a street sweeper in the market. Along with this work, she and her daughter sell household goods. At the present time, she doesn’t have much selection. In order to increase the variety of goods she sells, she decided to come to Mikroinvest for assistance.We told her about KIVA and she wanted to take part with request for business expansion( for purchasing of house hold goods: cleaning fluid,electro belongings and battareis of different size)

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Сангинова Нодира женщина в возросте 36 лет замужем имеет 3 детей, с молодости торговала вместе с матерью на базаре,после замужества устроилась на рынке дворницей ,параллельно с этой работой она с дочькой торгует хозяйственными товарами.На сегодня у нее оборот бизнеса не велик, для увеличения ассортимента товаров она решила обратится в Микроинвест. Ей мы рассказали о помощи Кива и она захотела участвовать с просьбой на займ на рассширение бизнеса( на покупку хоз.товаров: чистящие средства для ванны и кухни, электро. принадлежности и батарейки разных размеров.)

loans.use: Purchasing household goods

loans.name: Safina Nakalema’S Group

texts.en:
Safina N. is a 26-year-old married mother of 5 children, ranging in age from 3 to 13 years old.  She is the leader of a group of four women taking out their 8th loan from MCDT.  She was able to start her clothing business with a loan from MCDT. 
Safina describes herself as a “hard working woman.”  She has a kiosk in her neighborhood of Mulago where she sells clothing for small children seven days a week from 6 in the morning until 10 at night.  Each week, and sometimes twice a week, she re-stocks her inventory by buying clothing from the market at Kikumba.  She reports that about 30 people a day come to her shop—mostly men.  Sundays are particularly busy. 
With this new loan, Safina will be able to complete a goal of building a house.  She has already purchased a plot about 3.5 km (2 mi) away.  With the loan, she will be able to start construction on the house and eventually not need to pay rent.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity E. is 56 years old. She is a widow with 6 children. She sells bread. She has been able to send her children to school up to secondary school level, and she hopes to send them up to the university level. To Charity, bread business is fine. Hence she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 525 to buy more bread for re-sale. This, she said, will help her serve her customers better. She lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Арипов Абдусалом житель района Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет, женат , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиент занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота.Он покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их .После 40 дней откормки реализует их на рынке.На доход от этого бизнеса Абдусалом содержит свою семью.Сейчас он хочет получить кредит для покупки 2 бычков. Планирует погасить кредит в течении10месяцев
texts.en:
Abdusalom A. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. This client raises cattle. He buys calves in the local market and fattens them. After fattening them for forty days, he resells them at the market. Abdusalom supports his family with the income from this business. Now he wants to take out a loan to purchase two calves. He plans to pay off the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying two calves

loans.name: Isadora

texts.es:
Isadora tiene 53 años. DesD. hace mucho tiempo ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, en el local que logró acondicionar en su vivienda. Además por las noches tiene un puesto D. comida ambulante que le produce ingresos extras.
El ultimo crédito que Isadora recibió, lo invirtió en sacar adelante su negocio ambulante.
Sin embargo ella cuenta que necesita ampliar el negocio D. venta D. comida que tiene en su casa, para eso necesita un pequeño capital para comprar los insumos en mayor cantidad y tener un mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en:
Isadora is 53 years old. Since many years ago she has sold food from a shop she set up in her home. Additionally, at night she works in traveling food sales to earn extra income.

Isadora used the previous loan that she received to invest in expanding her traveling business. Nevertheless, she says that she needs to expand her food sales business that she has out of her house. To do this she needs a little money to buy food supplies in bulk and to increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food sales business

loans.name: Veth

texts.en:
Mrs. Veth K. is a villager in Thaom Ney Village in the Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Phan Phorn, is a fisherman. He gathers fish to support his family.

Although Mrs. Veth K. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve their living situation, Mrs. Veth K. has decided to ask for a loan. She will save the loan so she can purchase timbers, which she will use to build a new house.

She hopes this loan will allow her family members to live in better conditions.

Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings so she can buy timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Thy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank includes twenty people, who live in the Por Pel Pok village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambridge. Mrs. Chan Thy S. is the village bank president, and she is rice farmer. She does not have enough rice seeds to plant a new crop. S. she requests a loan to buy more rice seeds. With some of the money from the loan, she alS. plant to buy fishing nets for Mr. Nu Saron, her husband, who is a fisherman in the local village.

Mrs. Chan Thy S. is 52 years old and the mother of five children; two children are employed in a garment factory, and the others attend the local school. (Mr. Met S.'s wife is requesting a loan alS., and she is in the picture.)

loans.use: Buy more rice seeds for planting

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Née en 1970 à Lomé, Madame K. Dédé est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari conducteur sans emploi et les revenus dégagés par Madame K. Dédé seule ne suffisent pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille.	
Elle s’est engagé à donner une autre dimension à son activité afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante des clients et par conséquent disposer de revenu stable susceptible de permettre à sa famille de joindre les deux bouts. Elle sollicite alors un crédit pour s’approvisionner en boissons, savons, chaussures et autres. Ce financement aidera cette famille à améliorer son niveau de vie et aussi pour l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Lomé, Ms. Dédé K. is married and the mother of five. Her husband is an unemployed driver, and the income earned by Ms. K. alone is insufficient to cover family needs. She has dedicated herself to giving her business another dimension to satisfy the burgeoning customer demand and consequently to have a stable income that may enable her family to make ends meet. She is therefore requesting a loan to get supplies of beverages, soap, shoes, and more. This financing will help this family improve its standard of living, so that it can thrive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy  năm nay  28 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại xã Yên Đồng huyện Ý Yên. Năm 2004 chị Thủy  tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư buôn bán hoa quả. Hiện nay  ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh dịch vụ vận tải hành khách với tổng thu nhập đạt 6.000.000đ/ tháng .
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để  đầu tư mua dầu máy phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh vận tải hành khách của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thủy is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children in the Yên Đồng village, Ý Yên district. In 2004, Thủy joined TYM Fund and received a loan to invest in fruit sales. Today, in addition to the income from the fruit sales, her family also have income from their business of assisting with transportation of cargo for a total income in the amount of 6,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND to purchase motor oil for the family's cargo transportation business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Cargo Transportation

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha comenzó a trabajar  vendiendo ropa como ambulante en un mercado y según los pedidos que sus clientes le hacían en su casa también.. Sin embargo a veces sus cliente son le pagaban al contado y tenia problemas para cubrir los gastos de la reinversión así como de su casa. Es así que luego de nueve años se animó a poner un negocio sonde el pago y las ganancias sean directas.

Hace cinco años inició un negocio en el cual además de vender extintores a diferentes empresas y negocios pequeños también ofrecía el servicio de fumigación. Hoy en día cada vez le va mejor gracias a su empeño por conseguir más clientes y por las ganas de ofrecer también un buen trabajo.

Por ahora, además de dedicar a su negocio también esta analizando las posibilidades de construir un local en su casa para abrir un negocio de cabinas publicas de Internet o una tienda de abarrotes
texts.en:
Bertha started out as a street vendor, selling clothing at a market and also taking customer orders from her house. Regardless, sometimes her customers paid on credit and she had trouble meeting her expenses, both to reinvest in her business as well as for her home. For this reason, nine years ago she was inspired to start a business where the pay and earnings went directly to her. Five years ago, she started selling extinguishers to various enterprises and small businesses. She also offered fumigation services. Currently, things improve every day thanks to her efforts to attract more customers and offer quality services. For now, in addition to dedicating herself to her business, she is also analyzing the possibility of building a site at her house to install Internet cubicles or a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a supply of extinguishers.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad E. and her husband Ismael are already in their 50’s but despite their age, the couple share their strength in sustaining their livelihood for survival. They were blessed with eight children, some of them were already married, some are working and others are still studying.  Her family enjoys their simple way of living in the large village of Marabulig 1 in Cauayan City which is a flatland and subdivided into five districts. 

To help her husband in meeting their immediate needs, Soledad ventures into a small village store where she earns a monthly average income of PHP2,000.  This is smaller but more convenient compared when she was in the rolling store business.  

Her store sustains the immediate needs of their family while their income from their farming activities supports the tuition fees and allowance of their children. To fulfill her plan for her store, she wishes to avail a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase additional merchandise for her store.  With the different business trainings that she had, she is confident enough that she can make it grow.

loans.use: To purcahse additional merchandise

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 22 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Amer has owned a barber shop. He also sells beauty products. Amer requested a loan of 800 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his salon. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his salon and helped him start selling beauty products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Amer first started his business, he had difficulty finding the right place to open the salon. Amer decided on doing his business because he has experience since he learned the business in an academy. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and change his décor.

loans.use: Amer will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her little shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a new motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Gpf Pointe Sarrène 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous remercions Kiva de nous avoir fait confiance en nous finançant. Cela nous a permis de réaliser notre activité qui est celle de la transformation de produits halieutiques. Après avoir soldé notre premier prêt, nous venons solliciter un 2e prêt qui va permettre de continuer notre activité principale de transformation et commercialisation de produits halieutiques, mais aussi diversifier les activités en faisant du maraichage en saison des pluies pour rembourser notre prêt dans les délais quand on sait que durant la saison des pluies, il nous est très difficile de vendre les produits à cause des problèmes de séchage et de conservation.
texts.en:
We thank Kiva for putting faith in us and financing us. This allowed us to realize our business, which is the processing of fish products. After having settled our first loan, we have come to ask for a second loan which will allow us to continue our principal business of processing and marketing fish products, and also to diversify our activities through market gardening during the rainy season. This will help us repay our loan during these times, since we know that during the rainy season, it is very difficult for us to sell our products due to difficulties in drying and preserving the fish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish products and fresh fish for processing

loans.name: Iqbal Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
Iqbal baji is the wife of M. A. who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from Multan and sells them in Borewala. He buys clothes from Multan because the price of clothes is not high and so he gets a profit on each dress at the time of selling. Iqbal baji operates a business sewing clothes. She gets orders from her neighbors and charges $2 per dress. Iqbal baji is applying for a loan to expand her clothes-selling business. 

Iqbal baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Razia baji and Shahnaz akhtar baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

Shazia baji and Muniran baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Note: Two of the members Razia baji and Shahnaz baji also operate their artificial-flower-selling business to pay their utilities.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: B. Mavluda is 44 years old and is married with three children. She dedicates herself to raising livestock. Her earnings have helped her to purchase more animals to raise, which she has done over a period of eight years. In one month’s time, she sells them at the Sunday market. Now she decided to request a loan of $750 to purchase two bulls. She is very content with her work because, together with her husband, she carries out her enterprise. Her dreams include buying food for her livestock and providing an education for her children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two bulls

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: N. Samuel is 38 years old and married with two school-aged children. Samuel is a hardworking businessman who has had a retail business in the Bingo zone for quite some time. He will use his loan to purchase retail commodities such as soap, washing Jik (bleach), cooking oil, sugar, etc. to meet customer demand. His hope for the future is that he will be able to work hard to make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase retail commodities

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in the business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Don Vicente P. A., cuanta con 51  años de edad es casado actualmente vive con sus cuatro  hijos y con su esposa se dedica al comercio de utensilios para el hogar vende por unidad como ambulante y se encuentra en el lugar conocido como Paraje Patzite de la zona uno  del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán cuenta con su pequeña micro empresa lleva 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad por su situación económica que tiene no son suficientes para la compra otros tipos de productos para cubrir el pedido de sus clientes por la misma razón se acerco a  las instalaciones de la asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo mejorando a si sus ingresos mensuales como también generando mejor su capital de trabajo

loans.use: Comercio (Compra de mercaderia)

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme a appris le métier d’informatique ; il n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Malheureusement pour lui, il n’a jamais pu trouver un emploi pour mettre ses compétences au service d’une institution donnée. C’est pour cette raison qu’il a décidé l’année dernière de se lancer dans l’activité de maraîchage dans le quartier de Dabarakondji à Lomé. Pour ce faire, il a recruté un jeune homme qui maîtrise les cultures. Actuellement il approvisionne les vendeuses de feuilles de salades et de  toute sorte de légumes au Grand Marché de Lomé. C’est pour acheter de nouveaux intrants (les graines) qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Il compte sur sa meilleure connaissance du marché pour rembourser le crédit dans les délais exigés.
texts.en:
This is a young many who learned computer programing as a trade. He is not married and has no children at all to support. Unfortunately for him, he was never able to find employment for putting his skills to work in a given institution. For this reason, he decided last year to embark on a market-gardening business in the Dabarakondji district in Lomé. To do so, he recruited a young man who supervises the crops. Currently, he supplies retailers with salad greens and all sorts of vegetables at the Grand Market of Lomé. To buy new supplies (seeds), he's requesting a WAGES loan. He's counting on his better knowledge of the market to repay the loan per the required due dates.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies (seeds)

loans.name: Flavio Jaime

texts.pt:
Flávio Jaime M. nasceu em Boane um dos Distritos da Província de Maputo, que localiza se a 30 km da cidade, tem 32 anos de idade, estudou ate 5ª classe. Não foi possível continuar com os estudos, na altura o pai perdera a vida o único que sustentava todas as despesas. Vive maritalmente sustentando 3 filhos dos seus 6, 5 e 2 anos de idade todos frequentando a Escola, o de 2 anos na Escolinha. O filho de 6 e 2 anos são da outra mulher.

 Nunca mudou da cidade onde vive, em 1997 junta se com a primeira esposa a mãe de 2 filhos 6 e 2 anos, em 1999 junta se com a outra por sinal a mãe do menino de 5 anos. 
Na vida ele é agricultor dono de uma machamba e trabalhar desde 1995, tem 3 trabalhadores juntos trabalham cerca de 8 horas por dia. Adquiriu a experiência trabalhando num farmeiro desde 1993.

O repolho é o produto favorito, produzindo numa área de 80 metros quadrados, gastando ate 35mil meticais por campanha o que lhe rende cerca de 65 mil meticais. Depois de juntar a receita de outras culturas chega a somar 75 a 85 mil meticais por campanha, assim consegue poupar algum por mes.

Este é o quarto empréstimo do Flávio na Hluvuku no valor de 23.000,0mt para compra de insumos agrícolas (sementes, fertilizantes, pagamento de jornas de trabalho, preparação do solo e outros) embora tendo como desafios enfrentar pragas, roubo e a falta de transporte para o escoamento.
Os outros créditos foram pagos sem problemas (10.000,00mt; 20.000,00mt e 20.000,00mt) todos para a mesma actividade.

Para garantir os estudos das crianças, alimentação e outras despesas correntes precisa continuar apostando nesta actividade, sendo a única que consegue desenvolver, herdado dos pais. Assim pretende pedir mais financiamento no futuro para a compra de um carro para facilitar nos seus trabalhos agrícolas, principalmente o escoamento.
texts.en:
Flávio Jaime M. was born in Boane, a district in the province of Maputo. He is 32 years old and had to drop school before finishing 5th grade, when his father passed away and he had to start working to help support his family. He lives with his wife and children aged 2, 5 and 6, and all of them go to school. He has never left the city and he works with agriculture and owns a machamba (a large garden where crops are grown that provide most all the food for the people in the villages). He's been working since 1995 and has 3 employees, who work 8 hours a day. He got his work experience from working in a farm prior to that. His favorite vegetable is cabbage, which he grows in a 80km2 (80 square kilometers), and spending up to 35.000,00MT (U$1,275) each harvest, and making back around 65.000,00MT (U$2,365). Adding to that the other cultures, he's able to make up to 85.000,00MT (U$3,100) at the end of each harvest, which allows him to save some money. This is Flavio's 4th loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 23.000,00MT (U$850) to buy agricultural consumables (seeds, fertilizers, soil preparation) and also to pay his employees. He faces tough challenges like plagues, burglary and the lack of transportation for yielding. The other loans were paid in time and were all used for the same purpose. In order to guarantee his children proper food and education, he feels that he needs to keep investing in this business, as it is what he's good at. He plans on taking another loan in the future to buy a car to help with the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural consumables (seeds, fertilizers)

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Direct selling is the business of Laila D. S.. She is married to Jonie D. S. who is engaged in their rice fields. They don’t have any children yet.

Laila sells MSE, Natasha and Sundance cosmetics products. She has been selling cosmetics and apparel for almost two years and has noticed that this kind of business really helps in improving their way of living. She is able to generate PHP 3,000 weekly from her business but she still needs to continue improving her business by buying more products because she has so many orders. 

Laila would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000 which will allow her to purchase inventory for all the orders she has. She hopes that her loan request will be approved; it would serve as a big help in improving their way of living. Laila is looking forward to the betterment of their living standard.

loans.use: To buy more products to fill her orders

loans.name: Ovoke

texts.en: Ovoke is 30 years old. She is married; she and her husband have four children. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. Ovoke sells hair extensions and plaits beautiful hair styles for her customers. She is requesting for a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions to sell. This is the high season for the sales of hair extensions and she hopes to make more profits during and after the season. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
“Patience and sacrifices are the major steps towards success” says Mrs. Ofelia C. of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya.

She is married to Mr. Felix C. and they are gifted with three children. Being industrious parents, two of their children graduated from college and presently applying for a job. The youngest is still studying in tertiary education.

The main source of their living is through farming. They till their land twice a year by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Ofelia engages in selling vegetables in their village and also at Solano Public Market during market days. She wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to Php 13,000 to be used to acquire more vegetables to be sold in their village.

She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: Additional capital to help in selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 36 year old married woman, with four children aged between 10 and 16. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a three room house where she lives with four people. Aisha takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Aisha works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She incurs transportation costs traveling to and from the African Village along Buganda Road in Kampala city to buy merchandise and uses public transport to and from shopping. Aisha works six days a week. She receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She pays a monthly rent of 45000 UGX. Her major business challenges are the increasing prices of crafts and transportation. She has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her eleventh loan. Aisha wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for crafts for her retail shop. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crafts for resale

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 43 years old and married with three children.

He owns a welding business that has been in operation for six years and also earns some extra income through small-scale farming. He successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for 35,000 KES. This loan is for 50,000 KES, and he will use the funds to buy more welding materials.

Leo describes himself as hardworking and optimistic and hopes to improve his standard of living by expanding his business. He says that through Faulu, he has learned how to better manage his business and believes that in ten years he will own a very large welding company.

loans.use: To buy welding materials

loans.name: Lakulo

texts.en:
Lakulo J. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour in the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Lakulo is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 7 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for the school fees for children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Đặng Thị's Group

texts.en: T. Đặng Thị (10105050014) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.
