loans.name: Judith Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Judith tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado de Paltay, Distrito Taricá, Provincia de Huaraz, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que todavía asisten al colegio.  

Pertenece al Banco Comunal Paltainas al Progreso, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de Abarrotes, paralelamente se dedica a la agricultura.

Con  el reciente préstamo  recibido de Manuela  Ramos de  S/. 500.00  soles ($ 167.00 aprox.), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará artículos variados (abarrotes) como azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, entre otros.  Además comprará remedios para sus cultivos (fertilizantes).

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery items for store and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
R. Zebi Amonovna is selling children's clothing for the past 16 years. She is married and has five children. After the collapse of the Soviet Union (USSR) she and her husband lost their jobs. Her husband is currently unemployed. Zebi had to start selling on the market to feed her family. Her older son was also helping her. As her children grew older her income was not enough. Her older son had to go to Russia to find work. He was sending home US$100 a month, but it was still not enough. In the early 2006 Zebi obtained a loan to expand her business. She started buying merchandise in large quantities (wholesale) for a lower price and selling it retail or semi-wholesale. Her younger son, Zubaidullo is helping her with the business. Zebi wants to be more competitive and intends to travel to Bishkek, the Republic of Kyrgyztan, herself to purchase merchandise which will allow her to start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Расулова Зеби Амоновна в течение 16 лет торгует детской одеждой. Замужем. Имеет 5 детей. После распада СССР они остались без работы. Муж в данное время без работы. Чтобы прокормить семью она была вынуждена выйти на базар торговать. Старший сын помогал ей. По ходу взросления детей ее доход не был достаточен. Её старший сын вынужден был поехать на заработки в Россию. Он присылал по 100$ в месяц. Но и этого было, не достаточна и в начале 2006 года она для расширения своего бизнеса получила кредит. Она закупает большими партиями товар (оптом) по низкой цене и продает в розницу и мелким оптом. Ему сейчас помогает ее младший сын Зубайдулло. Чтобы быть более конкурентоспособным она намеревается ездить сама за товаром в Бишкек (Республика Кыргызстан), что позволит ей перейти в оптовую торговлю товарами.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods and purchase new products for winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and sewing machine and re-locate.

loans.name: Muhsinjon

texts.en:
M. Muhsinjon is 22 years old. 

With his mother, Muhsinjon sells kids clothing and shoes. The store is located in the central local market. Muhsinjon has been in this business already for 4 years. In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet, Muhsinjon travels every two weeks to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, to purchase new goods. During his  absence his mother helps him in the market. Currently his working capital is about 1,500.00 US Dollars. 

Today Muhsinjon requests 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. He is planning to spend the loan to travel to Bishkek and purchase the clothing and shoes. This is Muhsinjon's first loan, however, he is sure he shall pay it in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the clothing and shoes for kids for selling

loans.name: Sunarto

texts.id:
Sunarto is a craftsman, he lives in a rented house with his wife and his two children.

In a month Sunarto can spend IDR 3 million to 3.5 million (approx of USD 330 to USD 385) for salaries of his four employees. He can earn IDR 5 million (approx of USD 525) as revenue for one month. This means he gets a profit of IDR 1.5 million (approx of USD 165) per month.

With the loan money of USD 550 he will be able to add his capital which he can use to buy the handbag material. His customers usually only pay 20% down payment.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam satu bulan Sunarto mengeluarkan dana berkisar antara Rp 3.000.000,00 sampai dengan Rp 3.500.000,00 untuk gaji karyawan, sementara penghasilannya Rp 5.000.000,00. Besar keuntungannya per bulan Rp 1.500.000,00. Nilai tersebut bergantung sekali dengan jumlah pesanan yang ia terima. Saat ini dia bekerja dengan mengandalkan 4 orang karyawannya. Pinjaman modal sebesar Rp 5.000.000,00 akan dia gunakan untuk modal awal, karena tas – tas yang dipesan harus dia selesaikan dengan modalnya sendiri. Pemesan biasanya hanya memberikan uang muka 20% dari harga total. Dia tinggal rumah kontrakan bersama dengan isteri dan dua orang anaknya.

loans.use: to add working capital (Modal awal)

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is a mother of six children in Ghana. For the past nine years, she has sold rice, vegetable oil, soap, and other toiletries. She uses her income to support her children.

Akosua has applied for a loan of $925 U.S. dollars to purchase more inventory to sell. She has saved some of her money, so that she can register for Ghana's National Health Insurance Scheme, a new program that provides healthcare for poor and lower-income residents.

Akosua a proud member of the group “Yonko Do” (meaning Oneness). The group operates on peer pressure principle where each member guarantees for each other to re-pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetable oil, and soap to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
I have already started building my home but I lack the materials needed to finish it. I need finishing liquids and bricks for some rooms. I'm requesting a loan of $1,2000 so I can complete construction.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya tiempo que empecé a construir mi casa pero me esta faltando material para terminarla, me esta haciendo falto los acabados y la losa de algunos cuartos. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para terminar la construcción de la vivienda.

loans.use: Finish construction on her home / Terminación de la construcción de la vivienda

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. sells second-hand clothing. She is married, but her husband's income from selling second-hand clothing does not cover the expenses for Joyce and her three children. Joyce has many customers for her clothes.

She plan to use the loan so she can purchase more second-hand clothing to sell. She wants to expand her business so she can increase the income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Mr Kalifa T. is 27 years old, lives with his mother, brothers and sisters at his grandfather's house in Bougoula-Ville, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After the death of his father, Kalifa quickly had to give up his scholling and became an apprentice tailor in Sikasso and then in Bamako in order to help his mother take care of his younger siblings. Following a 6-year apprenticeship, he became a well-known master tailor in Sikasso with customers from all social classes. His workshop already has 2 machines, and is located at Bougoula-Ville, a very busy capital region of the third administrative area of Mali. In order to face the growing demands from his customers, he has decided to take part in the Soro Yiriwaso program, and this is his first individual loan. He would like to buy one (1) sewing machine in Bamako to supplement his existing equipment. With this machine he plans to increase his monthly income by 120.000 FCFA, with which he would like to further build workshop, to help with his family's needs and pay the interest on his loan. Mr. Traoré hopes to become a designer stylist of international reputation.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Monsieur Kalifa T. a 27 ans, vit avec sa maman, ses frères et soeurs chez son feu grand père à Bougoula-Ville, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali) Après le décès de son père, Kalifa abandonna vite l’école depuis l’enseignement fondamental pour faire l’apprenti tailleur à Sikasso puis à Bamako dans le souci de venir en aide à sa maman et à ses cadets. A la suite d’un apprentissage qui a duré 6 ans, il devient un maître tailleur brodeur connu de tout Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories socio professionnelle. Son atélier de couture contenant déjà deux machines, est situé à Bougoula-Ville un quartier très populeux de la capitale de la troisième région administrative du Mali. Afin de faire face aux demandes de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son 1er prêt individuel. Il compte acheter une (1) machine de Brodérie à Bamako pour compléter ses équipements. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA.avec lequel il compte agrandir son atelier, faire face aux dépenses de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt. Monsieur Traoré espère devenir un styliste modeliste d’une réputation continentale.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Pabla, 52, is married and has 3 grown children, all of whom are college graduates.

Pabla has been a biochemist for more than 20 years. Currently, she is the owner of a small pharmacy located in a middle-class, well-established neighborhood.

Pabla tells us that she married at a very young age, and from early on she had to juggle her duties as a wife and mother with her profession and other jobs. At that time, she worked as a house maid, but this job gave her little time to spend with her young family. With great effort, Pabla and her husband, who is a doctor, were able to save some money and invested it to open a pharmacy sixteen years ago.

In their pharmacy, Pabla offers good prices, a good variety of products and personalized attention to her customers. Pabla is requesting a loan to buy medicine lots of various kinds: cold medicine, antibiotics, and medicines imported from abroad.

Translated by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Pabla tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos ellos mayores y profesionales.

La Sra. Pabla es bioquímica se dedica a esta profesión hace más de 20 años, Actualmente es propietaria de una farmacia en un barrio bastante poblado y habitado por personas de un nivel económico medio.

Comenta la Sra. Pabla que se casó bastante joven y ejerció su profesión dividiéndose con la educación de sus hijos y su trabajo, en esa época era empleada doméstica en una casa y su actividad le daba poco tiempo para su familia. Con esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su marido que es médico, invierteron un capital ahorrado y abrieron una Farmacia que hoy día ya posee 16 años de antigüedad.

Ofrece buenos precios, variedad en productos y una atención personalizada a sus clientes. Ella hoy solicita el préstamo para la compra de lotes de medicamentos varios tales como: antigripales, antibióticos, medicamentos de procedencia extranjera entre otros.

loans.use: Compra de lotes de medicamentos varios tales como: antigripales , antibióticos, medicamentos de procedencia extranjera entre otros.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi G. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Komi exerce depuis plus de 6 ans, le métier de menuiserie à Adeta un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère, par ce troisième crédit, acheter des planches pour l’exécution des commandes reçues et aussi pour aménager son atelier. Il espère mieux gagner sa vie par les gains qu’engendrera son activité.
texts.en:
Komi G. is 37 years old, married and the father of two children. For six years Komi has been working as a carpenter in Adeta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this third loan he hopes to buy planks of wood to fulfill the orders he has received and also make improvements to his workshop. He hopes to make a better living from the earnings his business will create.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks of wood to fulfill orders he has received and also improve his workshop

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua. Ingrid es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive con sus padres, Ingrid estudio enfermería técnica y ademas en bombera voluntaria, Ingrid vende cosméticos por catálogos, también productos naturales para el tratamiento de diferentes enfermedades, ambos productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y sus ventas en mayor parte son al crédito. Además Ingrid ayuda a su mama que tiene un restaurante vegetariano en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde además ella vende galletas integrales que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Ingrid necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas integrales y productos naturales. Los sueños de Ingrid son tener una tienda, independizarse, estudiar una carrera universitaria y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a member of the Comunal Bank Amaquella which means Don't be Lazy in Quechua. Ingrid is single, 26, and lives with her parents. Ingrid studied EMT, and in addition to being a volunteer firefighter, Ingrid sells cosmetics by catalogues, as well as natural products for the treatment of various diseases, she offers both products to her friends, families and her sales are largely on credit.

Also Ingrid helps her mother who has a vegetarian restaurant n downtown Ayacucho, where she also sells cookies which she gets in the city of Lima.

Ingrid needs a loan of 1800 soles which will be invested in buying the cookies and natural products. Ingrid's dreams are to have a store, become independent, study a career in a university, and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cookies and natural products

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long A. is a villager in Okrolang Doul Village in the Takeo Province. She is a nurse and she has a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband Mr. Verk Shout is a farmer. Although they have different businesses, they do not earn enough money to make a good living.

They also face a small problem in cultivating their field because they do not own animals to plow the rice field. They also need fertilizer to make their crops more productive.

Thus, Mrs. Long A. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy oxen and fertilizer to support her field. She hopes this loan will increase her income and help to improve their standard of living.

She is 51 years old and the mother of two children. On of the children attends the local school and the other child has a job.

Mr. Verk Shout is standing on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy oxen and  fertilizer to support her field

loans.name: Lut

texts.en: Lut L., 33, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Lut L. is a housewife, cooking food and looking after her children. She also owns a small business, raising pigs and growing rice. On average, Lut L. makes about US$4 per day, the same as her husband (pictured in the photo) who is a construction worker and earns income building houses. Currently, Lut L. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase livestock and fertilizers for her farmland and raise more pigs. She believes that the loan will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of additional pigs and fertilizers

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is a 34-year-old widow and the mother of two children who are in school. Afia lost her husband through a prolonged illness. She operates a clothing shop in New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region, where she lives with her family.  Afia sells clothing such as blouses, skirts, women slippers, and dressing bags to support her family. She started this business two years ago with her own small amount of capital. She operates on a small scale because of a lack of funds. 

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into her business. She will use the loan to purchase good quality stock so she can upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing such as ladies wear, headscarves, and slippers. Afia is a member of a borrowing group called All Nations Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee the repayment of the loans for one another. Afia does not sell on group-meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
K. Patience is 30 years old. She is the loving mother of two children, aged 3 and 1. Ten years ago, she began her nursery school in Ntungamo. The income from her business enables her provide for her family.

To accommodate the rising number of students at her school, Patience is requesting a loan to purchase more desks, chairs and reading materials. She dreams of setting up a primary school with modern facilities to offer quality education for local children and employment opportunities for the community.

loans.use: Purchase more desks, chairs and reading materials.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline es madre de tres hijos, uno de doce años, el segundo de nueve y el último de tan solo tres años. Es por ellos que siempre ha estado dispuesta a aprovechar todas las oportunidades de trabajo o negocio que se le presenten, para poder ayudara a mantener a sus tres niños.

Hace diez años trabaja con una señora vendiendo comida en un puesto ambulante en la calle principal de su localidad. En un inicio empezó vendiendo solo productos de belleza pero una vez que se le presento la oferta de trabajo ella la acepto y hoy no solo vende cosméticos y vende comida junto a la señora, desde hace siete años vende postres en la puerta de su casa. Por las tardes vende gelatina o mazamorra, depende de la estación, junto con su hermana quien vende por su parte frituras y comidas típicas. 

Aunque no le va mal en su trabajo, ella asegura que podría irle mejor, por ello planea abrir un bazar o tienda de ropa dentro de unos años.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a mother of three: her children are 12, nine and three years old. For them, she is always prepared to seize work or business opportunities as they present themselves so that she can help support her three children. For the past 10 years she has been working with another woman selling food from a cart in the main street of her neighbourhood. Initially she was only selling beauty products but when the offer of work came she accepted it and today she sells not only cosmetics but food with this woman. For the past seven years she has sold desserts from the doorway of her home. In the evenings she sells jello or pudding depending on the season together with her sister who sells fried foods and traditional foods. Although work is not going poorly, she asserts that it could go better and because of this she is planning to open a hardware store or clothing store in a few years.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beauty products and to stock her pudding-selling business with glasses, spoons and so on.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He mills palm kernels to make palm oil. He also sells palm kernels. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more palm kernels  to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell

loans.name: Soen's Group

texts.en: T. is the leader of a group of three members. She is the mother of three children; all of them are students. She is married to Sok, 34, who owns a small shop providing bicycle and motorbike repair to the whole commune. T. earns a living selling soft drinks in the market. She is good at making a tasty soft drink from beans. She boils the beans that she bought from the farmers; after boiling, she keeps compressing the beans so liquid flows from the boiled beans. This is the activity that she does everyday. She has a lot of customers; some buy her soft drinks at the house. She now wants to increase her husband's business because it is widely spread. To do so, T. is taking a loan to buy motorbike accessories and equipment for her husband's business. The other two group members are: P., 63, who provides a breakfast meal service and is taking a loan to invest in her business; and K. C., 37, who sells clothes in the market and is looking for a loan to buy more clothes for her shop. They all live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy motorbike accessories and equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Al señor José M. le acaban de entregar su vivienda por medio de un crédito Gubernamental a la casa le está haciendo falta algunos detalle, por el momento le interesa más la elaboración  de la  barda alrededor de su casa, no hay seguridad para su familia y teme que su pequeña hija le pueda pasar algo. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagar a la persona que se encargara de la mejora.
El día que se realizo la visita el señor José no se encontraba en su vivienda estaba en su trabajo, por eso que nos atendió su esposa la señora Sandra De La Paz quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. José M. has just received a home as part of a Government grant. The house is still in need of a few improvements, and José would like to start by building a fence around it. At the moment his home is not a secure place for his family, and he fears for the safety of his young daughter. In order to build the fence he is asking for a loan to purchase the materials and labor. When we visited his home, Mr. José was at work and his wife, Mrs. Sandra de la Paz, welcomed us. She is in the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around his home

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.en:
S. Fakhridin is 34-year-old married man with 3 children. Fakhridin has successful business of selling flour at the local market of Dushanbe. Fakhridin sells an assortment of good quality flour. Fakhridin has been engaged in this type of business for 12 years and during that period he become a very successful entrepreneur. While his business is doing very well, he sees the opportunity to increase his sales by maintaining a larger inventory of goods. Therefore, Fakhridin is requesting a loan of $1900 USD to purchase more goods for resale.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase inventory of flour for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty F. is single and has two children. She has received an education through senior high school.

Betty works as a trader selling provisions, footwear and bags in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2000. Betty uses her income to pay for school fees, food and utilities.

Betty will use the loan to purchase provisions, footwear and bags in bulk for reselling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Betty plans to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase provisions, footwear and bags in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Juana owns and operates a farm, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Juana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Халима хочет получить повторный кредит.Она использует займы на расширение бизнеса животноводства.Сейчас у неё 25 голов коз и три коровы.На следующий кредит она планирует закупить корм для скота и пару молодых породистых коров.
texts.en:
Halima wants to obtain another loan. She uses her loans to expand her animal husbandry business. She currently has 25 heads of goats and three cows. Halima plans to use her next loan to purchase feed for the livestock and a couple of purebred cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock feed and two purebred cows

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Haydee es casada tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 15, 10 y 4 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Haydee estudio obstetricia, no lo ejerció por que le ofrecían un trabajo en provincia y tenía  que  dejar a su familia, y se puso a trabajar con su esposo  vendiendo extractos de sábila, uña de gato, jugos naturales, ellos e levantan muy temprano para preparar todo, y salen con una carreta a trabajar todos los días.
Desde que Haydee esta en Finca   los prestamos han sido de ayuda para comprar más mercadería, aprendió ahorrar.
Haydee  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de productos naturales, miel de abeja, algarrobina,  no ni todo de la selva. 
El sueño de Haydee es alquilar un puesto grande, y trabajar en su carrera de obstetricia.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of Las Luciérnagas Communal Bank. Haydee is married, is 38 years old and has three children who are 15, 10 and 4 years old and study in the public school. Haydee studied obstetrics but did not practice because they offered her a job in the province and she would have had to leave her family. She went to work with her husband selling aloe extracts, cat’s nail, and natural juices. They wake up very early to prepare everything and go out with a cart to work everyday. Since Haydee is in Finca that loans have helped her to purchase more merchandise and she learned how to save. Haydee needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase natural products, bee’s honey, and algarrobo syrup. Haydee’s dream is to rent a big stand and work in her career as an obstetrician.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural products, bee's honey, and algarrobo syrup

loans.name: Рустам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
.

Рахматов Рустам , один из известных шашлычников в Худжанде. Он изготавливает очень вкусные и качественные шашлыки из мясо акарачка и мясо баранины. Его точка реализации расположена в центре города, поэтому у него стабильная торговля и много своих клиентов. На следующий кредит он хочет увеличить производство шашлыка, а следовательно прибыль, которую хочет использовать на ремонт дома.

loans.use: продажа шашлыка

loans.name: Ipogolo C Group

texts.en:
Romana is a member of the Ipogolo C borrower group,she is 48 yera old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 18,15,10 and 8 years,she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Romana started her own food business selling vegetable and fruits 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Romana`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits and vegetable.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Romana hopes to save more money and expand her business. 

Edina is another member of the same borrower group she requested loan amount 200,000 in order to expand her own clothing business

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Fátima del Rosario de edad de 41años, reside  en Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, junto a su familia, su esposo trabaja en enderezado y pintura,  con dos hijos que estudian,  su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras que desde hace doce años administra  con capital propio comenzó, para compartir los gastos con su esposo y poder cubrir sus necesidades diaria para su familia. Este crédito es su doce avo en Afodenic y con este préstamo lograra comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda toda de concreto ya que tiene parte forrada con zin y así  poder estar en mejores condiciones y seguridad. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios logrado.
texts.en:
Fátima del Rosario is aged 41 and lives with her family in the Memorial Sandino district of Managua. Her husband works as a panel beater and painter and her two children study. Using her own funds she set up her fruit and vegetable business twelve years ago with the aim of helping her husband to cover their costs and meet the everyday needs of the family. This is her twelfth Afodenic loan and will be used to purchase construction materials to finish building her home completely in concrete, as a part is covered with corrugated metal, making it more habitable and secure. She is grateful to the institution for the progress she has achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building her home completely in concrete.

loans.name: Essam

texts.en:
Essam is a 35-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Essam has owned a laundry for four years. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. He decided to set up his business because he learned this trade when he was young.

Essam has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase an iron press and aspirator for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. Essam's previous loans helped him to improve his laundry. In the future, he plans on further improvements.

loans.use: To purchase an iron press and aspirator

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 46 year old black smith who lives and operates his business in Machakos, Kenya. He previously sold shoes  before beginning this business thirty years ago. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to enable him add stock of raw materials. He hopes to diversify into farming through irrigation in order to uplift his living standards. He hopes to dig a borehole for irrigation soon. He describes himself as hardworking.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of raw materials

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en: Like other farmers, Nicasio has experienced failure, but this doesn’t stop him from farming. He plants corn on his farm. Nicasio is a member of CEV and is now requesting his fourth loan. He wants to borrow Php 10,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies that he needs. Hopefully, with this financing, Nicasio's farm will not fail.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate, 40 years old and the mother of five children, lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria, where she is married to a man who sells planks. Kate has sold utensils, including cooking pots and coolers, for a long time and eventually hopes to become a distributor of utensils in her community. Kate is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more utensils to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.pt:
Sandra Maria N. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 5 anos de idade. Fez 9ª classe parou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive com os seus filhos na casa dos pais, sustenta 3 irmãos que vivem com ela.

Saiu da Matola para Boane quando criança com os seus pais. Tem um negócio a mais de 3 anos, trabalha sozinhas das 11h as 2h por vezes a irmã tem ajudado. Neste negócio consegue uma receita de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por dia, poupa semanalmente através do sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique). Esta actividade aprendeu com a sua mãe que também desenvolve a mesma a mais de 20 anos.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para início da sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais empréstimos. No futuro deseja continuar com os estudos e solicitar mais créditos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria N. was born in Matola city, in Maputo province. She is a 30-year-old widow with 2 children who are 10 and 5 years old. She finished 9th grade and stopped studying because she was pregnant. She lives with her children in her parents’ home, and she financially maintains 3 siblings who live with them. She left Matola for Boane when she was a child. She has had her own business for 3 years, she works alone from 11 until 2, but sometimes her sister helps her. She earns about 2.000.00mt to 3.000.00mt a day through this business and she saves her money in a traditional savings system called (Xitique). She learned to save money this way from her mother, who has been involved in the system for 20 years. She has never had loans with other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through friends that are clients of this institution. This is her first loan and has a value of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, steel, sand and other materials) in order to begin her work. She is committed to paying this loan in order to be able to access loans in the future. In the future she would like to continue her education and take out more loans in order to finish her project.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Jevelyn

texts.en:
Jevelyn is 32 years-old and a farmer who lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has five children who go to school. She has learned farming skills in order to maintain the farm in good conditon. She aims for her farm to be productive so that she can earn an income for her family.

Jevely joined Kiva partner CEVI to avail of its financial services and to improve her business skills. She is applying for a loan of Php 13,000. This loan will be used for farm supplies and other farming necessities.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D.  is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of groundnuts and cooking oil to sell.  Monica is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a laborer. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase bags of groundnuts and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children is in school while the other is still breastfeeding. Beatrice lives with her family in a community in the western region of Ghana. She works tirelessly to support her husband in taking care of the children.
Beatrice owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood and also sells cosmetics products. She is a very skillful and talented hairdresser with six years of hairdressing experience. For this reason, many clients visit her salon. Beatrice believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, and therefore wants to use her loan to buy larger quantities of hair products such as assorted wigs, pomade, shampoo, activators, hairdryer machines etc., to serve her customers well. She would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy hair products such as wigs, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: M. Nguyễn Thị's main source of income comes from raising chickens for sale. M. is 35-year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. M. is married and has two school-age children. M. has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 dong (VND) a month. In 2007, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.876.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.886.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fifth loan from SEDA. M. plans to use the additional revenue to pay for the tuition fees of her children. M. is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members (if someone is delinquent or defaults). The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Kha (2). 10114060011 About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Trần Thị Thúy H. is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 10114060013 2. Nguyễn Thị N. is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 10114060012 3. Trần Thị G. is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 10114060015 4. Trần Thị D. is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 10114060016 5. Nguyễn Thị K. is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 10114060014 About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. M. Nguyễn Thị (10114060011) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. M. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Kha (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. M. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.876.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.886.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trần Thị Thúy H. (10114060013) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị N. (10114060012) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Trần Thị G. (10114060015) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 4. Trần Thị D. (10114060016) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 5. Nguyễn Thị K. (10114060014) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak L. is 45 years old and a resident of a commune in Siem Reap province. She currently stays at home to plant crops on her land located near her house. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than eight years. 

She has a partner in her husband, who is skilled in decorating wooden furniture by hand. People hire him to produce beds, chairs, windows and other furniture for fees. The couple helps each other in order to feed their five children. Four are married and live separately, while the other one is single and lives at home. 

Chak L. will use her first loan to buy accessories which will allow her husband to continue to perform his good service.

loans.use: To buy accessories.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice to sell. Tamara is 50 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 3 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es:
Don M. es profesor de profesión siempre se dedico a la enseñanza lo cual es vocación lamentablemente el sueldo que percibía era muy bajo esto lo incentivo a ver otras formas de lograr un ingreso adicional, es así que  decide formar su propia empresa “JMW FUMIGACIONES” dedicada a prestar servicio de fumigación a empresas e instituciones publicas y privadas, acondiciono un lugar  en su propia casa y empezó con muy  poco.  La ayuda de su familia. Fue vital ya que el seguía ejerciendo su carrera de maestro, con el pasar de los años siente que ha logrado muchas cosas una de ellas que su negocio haya prosperado y  lo principal  que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
El señor M. tiene muchos planes a futuro quiere que su negocio siga progresando ahora cuenta con trabajadores  y muchos clientes, por otro lado junto con  vecinos y amigos forman el grupo “RESPONSABILIDAD” del cual es  presidente, su compromiso con el grupo es serio y lo desempeñara de la mejor manera, este es su primer  préstamo y lo utilizara para comprar una maquina nebulizadora necesaria para su negocio y cumplir sus deseos de ser un empresario exitoso.

*E l Señor M. es el que viste camisa verde
texts.en:
M. is a teacher by profession and has always made a living in teaching. Unfortunately, it is a job in which the pay is very low, and that is why M. began looking for other ways to earn additional income. He decided to form his own business, “JMW FUMIGATIONS,” dedicated to providing a fumigation service for businesses and institutions, both public and private. He set his business up in his own home and began with very little, with help from his family. His business was vital, since he was going on to pursue his graduate degree. As the years have passed he feels that he has achieved many things, most importantly, that his business has prospered and his children have a good education. M. has many plans for the future. He wants his business to keep progressing, now that he has employees and many customers. He is the president of the “RESPONSABILIDAD” group, which he formed with his friends and neighbors. He takes his commitment to the group seriously, and will fulfill his duties in the best way. This is M.’s first loan and he will use it to purchase a nebulizer machine; he needs it for his business and in order to achieve his goal of being a successful businessman. * M. is the one wearing the green shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a nebulizer machine for fumigation

loans.name: Metuli

texts.en:
Metuli Maliota is 55 and married with 5 children (ages 15 - 29).  She is starting a business venture,  which is flower garden.  Metuli needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchse additional garden equipments.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Metuli joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Metuli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Metuli Maliota are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional  garden equipments

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai is 31 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. They have a two year old daughter and live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger. 

Bayarmagnai started a transportation business in his local area in 2008 after working as an excavator driver for a gold mining company the previous two years. Today, he transports people throughout his town and the surrounding local area. He previously operated between his province and the surrounding cities. However, a bus service was installed, which cut into his profits. This caused him to make the change to becoming a local driver. Bayrmagnai is a well experienced driver and has good communication skills. His business is very important to him because it is the only source of income for his family. Bayrmagnai is focused on the future and says, "I would like to stabilize my business and will work hard to pay back my loan in full." He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~ 1,100 USD) loan to contribute money to the purchase of a car to use as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Seark

texts.en: Seark N. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in Takeo province. She stays at home and makes silk scarves to sell at the local market and is able to make about US$2.30 of profit a day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. On average, he makes US$3 a day. Seark N. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: Purchase silk.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Composé de six femmes mariées et de deux veuves, les membres du groupe Baara ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de la ville de Bougouni, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Par des relations d’amitiés et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de pagnes, de poissons (tels Sali D.) etc. 
Dans le souci d’améliorer leurs capacités d’achats afin de satisfaire l’attente des clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe et tous les prêts  précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Sali D. fait le commerce de poisson frais qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman depuis le bas âge. Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, 200kg de poissons de mer et 120kg de poisson d’eau douce. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des bozos pécheurs installés le long du fleuve Sankarani, dans la préfecture de Yanfolila et quant aux poissons de mer congelés, à partir de la Côte d’Ivoire.
Toute les ventes se font en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans la ville de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle désire obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
The group Baara is comprised of six married women and two widows, on average they are 26 years old and have an average of 3 children each. They live in nuclear conjugal families with their children and spouses. The women are residents of the Hérémakono-Nord neighborhood of the town of Bougouni, (the 3rd administrative region of the republic of Mali). The women know each other through friendships and business relationships, and sell food, "pagnes" (colorful wax-cloths), fish (Sali D. is one of the women that sells fish) etc. In order to increase their capacity to purchase goods, in order to satisfy the needs of the clients, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan and all of their previous loans have been be properly reimbursed. Mrs. Sali D. does business selling fresh fish, a business she learned from her mother at a young age. With this loan she home to buy 200 kilograms of salt-water fish and 120 kilograms of fresh-water fish. She supplies herself from the fisherman along the river of Sankarani, in the neighborhood of Yanfolia; she supplies herself with frozen salt-water fish from the Côte d’Ivoire. They sell their goods at retail prices, for cash, or credit in the town of Bougouni, to a clientele of men and women. With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 25,000 FCFA; the other members of the group hope to earn an average monthly income of 15,000FCFA which they will use for their businesses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn M. is from the village of Iniawon, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 32 years old and married with 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Emelyn owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes primarily from cooking and selling grilled chicken and pork barbecue in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year  and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her most recent loan of 7,000 PHP which was used to purchase raw chicken and pork meat and to build up levels of working capital. Emelyn has now requested a new loan, her third with HSPFI, for 10,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sgeam

texts.en:
Sgeam S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for good quality rice. She produces religious tools and earns an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase more materials to produce religious tools to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more material to produce religious tools

loans.name: Winner Sisters Group

texts.en:
Richael N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Winner Sisters. She is 38 years old, single and has three children whose ages range from 3 to 10. She also cares for one sibling. Richael was unable to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For three years, she has been selling sugar and rice in the West Point Market, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more sugar and rice to sell. She describes herself as very hard-working.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito F. is from the village of  Minsapinit Gingoog City. He is 35 years old. Angelito is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelito owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Angelito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Angelito is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Angelito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila L. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old, separated from her spouse and has 6 adult-aged children. Leonila owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Leonila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José reside en el transito departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos los cuales dependen de los ingresos que José obtiene con el negocio de bebidas y boquitas. 
Comenzó el negocio por iniciativa propia por la necesidad que tenia para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, trabaja de lunes a sábado en la venta de gaseosas, refrescos, naturales y boquitas, el se dedica a vender en las escuelas y las canchas de futbol.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas boquitas y productos para la elaboración de refrescos naturales y de esta forma ver surtido y grande el negocio para tener buenos ingresos a futuro.
Esto le ayudara a aumentar su mercadería para atraer al cliente y lograr buenos ingresos para que su familia salga adelante.
Sus aspiraciones es que su negocio se haga más grande comprar un vehículo para distribuir el producto por mayoreo a las tiendas y lograr darles el estudio a sus hijos  logrando así una calidad de vida más estable para su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in El Transito, Morazán Department. He lives with his wife and four children who depend on the income José earns with his drinks and snacks business. He started the business on his own initiative because he had to provide for his four children and his wife. He works from Monday through Saturday selling carbonated drinks, soft drinks, natural beverages and snacks. He makes his sales at schools and soccer fields. He will invest the loan in purchasing carbonated drinks, snacks, and products for making natural drinks, and in this way have a large and well-stocked business so he can have a good income in the future. This will help him to increase his inventory to attract customers and earn a good income so his family can make ends meet. His aspirations are to make his business grow, buy a vehicle for distributing his products wholesale to shops, and manage to give his children an education, thus achieving a more stable quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carbonated beverages, snacks, and products to make natural drinks

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia T. is from the village of Anastacio. She is 43 years old and is married with six adult-aged  children.

Lucrecia owns and operates a general store. selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,100 PHP a month.

In 2006, Lucrecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jordan

texts.es:
Jordán H. Briseño   es un joven  de 23 años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en provincia de Alajuela; desde joven el se ha dedicado a la producción y venta de leche. 

Por medio de su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a toda su familia. Sin embargo el necesita aumentar la producción de leche ya que 2 de sus hijos van a iniciar el colegio y necesita dinero para pagar sus estudios, es por eso que Jordán solicita un préstamo de ¢599,000 (quinientos noventa y nueve  mil colones)    para la compra de de 2 vaquitas lecheras.

El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y esta muy motivado por la oportunidad que le brinda este tipo de organizaciones.
texts.en:
Jordán H. Briseño is a young man of twenty-three years who lives with his wife and five children in the community of Hernández, which is in the province of Alajuela. Since he was young he has earned his living producing and selling milk. Through his work Jordán has succeeded in bringing success to his whole family. However, he has to increase milk production because two of his children are about to start school and he needs money to pay for it, so he is seeking a loan for 599,000 colones to buy two young milk cows. Jordán belongs to Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo [United for Development Municipal Credit Enterprise], one of EDESA's one hundred organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he is very excited about the opportunity this type of organization provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene  26 años de edad vive en el barrio San Marcos en la calle murillo entre colon y Daniel campos en la ciudad de Tarija, Nancy aun no se caso y vive en su casa de su abuela, Nancy se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y manualidades para su tienda de cotillón ubicado en la zona las Panosas. 
Ella es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo que el realiza  tiene su taller establecido en su mismo domicilio  Nancy se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años a esta actividad.

Nancy lucha todos los días por sacar adelante a su hermana y su persona, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para esta temporada de primavera, según la experiencia que tiene Nancy en este negocio nos dice que de aquí hasta diciembre sus ventas se incrementan ya que comienzan los cumpleaños, matrimonios, eventos en donde ella comercializa sus productos y de esta manera generar más ingresos.
Nancy aun no se caso y vive en su casa de su abuela, Nancy se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y manualidades para su tienda de cotillón ubicado .
texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Marcos on Murillo street between Colon and Daniel in the city of Tarija.  Although Nancy is not married and lives in her grandmother's house, Nancy develops arts and crafts for her party favor shop located in the Panosas area. She is very responsible and dedicated to her work and has been able to set up her studio out of this same household.  Nancy has been working in this business for 3 years.  

Nancy struggles everyday to support her sister and another person.  The loan she is requesting will help her to buy the materials for this spring season.  Based on her experience in this business, Nancy tells us that from now until December sales will increase from birthdays, weddings, and special occasions, where she markets her products and thus will generate more revenue. Although Nancy is not yet married and lives with her grandmother, Nancy is dedicated to developing arts and crafts for her party favor shop.

loans.use: Investment for working capital, purchase of raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun V., 27, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Bonteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Temples complex near Siemp Reap province. V. is a barber earning an income of USD 6 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 15 on water and electricity, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more barber supplies to improve his business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more barber supplies

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Bagadadji  de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’articles divers tels les cosmétiques, les pagnes wax et  bien d’articles divers de boutique (thé, citron, lipton, bonbons, lait en poudre, des conserves …). 
Dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante, les membres du groupe ont de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. Tous les six prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Madame Ami Cissé, la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 40 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché de Bamako. Elle  les revend  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de Ségou, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Ami Cissé espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer en condiments et acheter les fournitures scolaires des enfants. 
Elle a pour ambition à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is composed of four married women who live mostly in monogamous families, are on average 33 years old, and have two children. They live in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know each other as neighbors and through their work in the district.

The members of the group buy and sell a variety of items such as cosmetics, pagnes (lengths of colorful cloth used for dress making) and numerous grocery items such as tea, Lipton soup, candy, powdered milk, canned goods, etc. With the goal of meeting the demands of their growing clientele, the members of the group have collaborated with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their seventh group loan.  The six preceding loans have been properly repaid.

Madame Ami Cissé, the president of the group, plans to use her loan to buy 40 pagnes at wholesale in the main market of Bamako.   She resells them at retail, for cash and credit, door to door and while traveling through different districts in Ségou, to a clientele composed of women and men. Madame Ami Cissé hopes to earn with this loan a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used for daily food needs at home and to buy school supplies for her children. 

Her ambition, like that of the other women of the group, is to buy a plot of land to build a home.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (lenths of colorful cloth used in dress making)

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga S. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a small house that he built last year. His wife looks after their twins at home and the three elder sons attend a local secondary school. 

He operates a newspaper and magazine sales business at bus stop booth. Early in the morning he purchases a daily newspaper from the newspaper distribution center and sells it at his booth. His daily earnings are 30.000-40.000 MNT. He has been operating this business steadily for four years. He is requesting a loan to purchase a computer for his children.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Djuma

texts.en:
Djuma is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 3 and 8 years old.  He has been working at his food stall for 10 years and knows the business well.  His stall is kept clean and full of produce.  He works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day of the week.

Djuma has requested this loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to purchase new products for his stall, including milk, onions, and eggplant.  He would like to use the profits from his business to continue to expand.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, onions, and eggplant

loans.name: Laïdou Ii Group

texts.fr:
LAÏDOU II est un regroupement de cinq femmes toutes mariées dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles ont   une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 3 enfants et résident à Heremakono-Nord, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
Elles se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de commerce d’articles divers : pâte d’arachide, condiments, préparation et vente de jus de fruits, le tricotage de la laine etc.
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits, afin de satisfaire en quantité et en qualité la clientèle, qui devient de plus nombreuse et exigeante, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui  elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce prêt, SAMADJE B., compte acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes variétés auprès des forains venant de Sikasso et  de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente, en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Laidou II is a group of five married women living in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and hubands. They have an average age of 28 years and 3 children and live in Heremakono-Nord in the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through community and business ties.  They sell various items: peanut paste, condiments, hand-knit wools etc.  They also prepare and sell fruit juices.  Intending to buy more products to meet the quantity and quality expectations of their customer base, which is increasing and becoming more demanding, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan. SAMADJE BAGAYOO intends to purchase different types of condiments from vendors from Sikasso and Bamako with this loan. She sells her goods at retail, for cash and on credit in the BOUGOUNI market to a clientele composed mainly of women.  She expects to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA with this loan of which a part will be used in the business and the remainder for her children's education expenses.

loans.use: Purchase condiments

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en: Tsogtbaatar L. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 19 and 12, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in an apartment. Both of his children attend a local secondary school and Tsogtbaatar and his wife operate a clothes-making and repair business out of a rented space at the Bayangol department store. Tsogtbaatar started the business in 2007 after working as a driver at the local transportation business between 2004 and 2007. He is a modest and honest man who says, "I want to continue operating our business at a stable level to provide higher education for my children." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for his clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: La Alternativa 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Alina is a divorced mother of 3 children. She is running a sales business, where she sells different products like cosmetics, shoes, accessories, and clothing. This activity allows her to support her family. With this particular loan, she will invest in her business by buying more of those products. Her future plans are to have a wholesale store and to have enough money to give her children all their needs and to pay for their degree studies.

Alina is just one member of the 10 person group, La Alternativa 4 & 5. Together, these Dominican entrepreneurs are able unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.
